For the future of his business, he would like to buy new machinery to compete with other larger carpentry workshops. This is Leoncio’s second loan with MFP, and he is committed to making all his payments on time since he doesn’t want to create any problems for the other members of the cooperative bank where he is well-liked. With the one thousand Peruvian soles he is requesting, he would like to purchase more wood so he can increase his furniture production.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años, es madre D. seis hijos mayores D. edad, Mercedes se dedica a la venta D. plátanos y carbón D. esta región en el puerto D. la ciudad, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante (servicios). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” desD. hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió D. este banco fue D. 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra D.  plátanos. Actualmente, requiere un crédito D. 1000 soles, monto que será utilizado para comprar carbón y luego venderlo al por mayor. La meta D. Mercedes es llegar a tener una tienda D. abarrotes y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 57, has been a dynamic, optimistic member of the “Corazón D. Jesús” communal bank for the past year. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has 6 adult children. She sells bananas and charcoal from the region in the city's port. She has her husband's support; he is employed as a watchman. The first loan she received from this bank was for 300 soles which she used to buy bananas. Now, she needs a 1000 sol loan which will be used to buy charcoal to resell at wholesale. Mercedes' goal is to have a grocery store and to keep helping her husband meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal at wholesale.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah has a bakery where he bakes bread to sell at wholesale and retail prices. He is a focused, hard worker. He is 26 years old and single without children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes to expand his business in the future by starting a catering school. He requests a loan in the amount of 180,000 NGN so he can purchase more bags of flour to bake more loaves of bread to sell. He is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to bake more loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Es Mi Piloto 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Nuris is the coordinator of her group, Jesus es mi Piloto (Jesus is my Pilot), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is located in the slums surrounding Santiago, an agricultural center famous for tobacco and beef production where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as single mother with her child.

Nuris is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in a business selling clothing in her community. Her business plan calls for taking orders from her neighbors and then travelling to the capital city to purchase the items in bulk at a low price and then selling the items at a profit. She will use the profits to improve her quality of life and invest in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for resale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hawa J. is 46 years old and is married with six children: two girls and four boys. She lives in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone.

With her previous loan, Hawa expanded her business by purchasing more bags of cement, crates of drinks and bags of sachet water (water sold in plastic bags).

Hawa hopes to secure this loan so she can improve her business, which will enable her to care for her family. With this loan she will purchase more bags of cement, crates of drinks and sachets of water. The profit will be used to further enhance her business.

loans.use: To boost business by purchasing more bags of cement, crates of drinks and sachets of water

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
La señora Claudina H. O. tiene 39 años está casada con el señor Florencio Herrera por más de 10 años, tienen 3 hijos de (10, 8, y 4) años son una familia de escasos recursos económicos. La señora Claudina se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta solamente con 4 cabezas de ganado lechero, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos, el esposo se dedica a la construcción (Albañil), trabaja en la misma zona donde vive.

La señora Claudina vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de playa ancha, tienen una pequeña casa en la cual solo hay 2 habitaciones,  doña Claudina hace todo lo posible para que sus tres hijos estén cómodos en la casa.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero con lo cual incrementara la producción de leche, de esta manera aumentara el nivel de ingresos y mejorara el nivel de vida de ella y de su familia, ya que uno de los sueños de la señora Claudina es aumentar la cantidad de cabezas de ganado lechero y con ello la producción. Entre sus sueños y metas también es realizar una ampliación y construcción de su casa, que tenga por lo menos una habitación para cada uno de sus hijos, y que los tres hijos estudien una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudina H. O. is 39 years old and has been married to Florencio Herrera for more than ten years. They have three children (10, 8, and 4) and are a family of limited financial resources. Claudina works in milk production. Currently she has four dairy cows whose milk she sells to company that makes different dairy products. Her husband works in construction as a mason and works in the same area as where they live. Claudina lives in the city of Cochabamba in the community of Playa Ancha. She has a small two-room house, and she does her best to make her three children comfortable in the house. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow which will increase the milk her cows produce. Growing her dairy cow herd is one of Claudina's dreams, and it will help her improve her family's quality of life. She also dreams of being able to build an addition to her house, so that her children can each have their own room. She also helps all three will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo is a 50 year single mother of four children aged between 15 and 21 years. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with four people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Teo sells bananas in Kawempe market. She incurs transport costs to and from buying matooke (bananas) from villages in Uganda. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She works six days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people in retail and wholesale. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, monthly market dues for her business, and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation of bananas and theft. Teo has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for seven years. This is her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. Teo joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: Purchase more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.es: Anatalia G. T. de 50 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive en un lugar muy humilde, junto a su esposo quien trabaja como motorista del transporte público y junto a dos hijos. Ella posee un negocio en su propia casa, en el cual se encarga de elaborar tortillas y pupusas, dos tipos de alimentos los cuales son muy típicos de la comida salvadoreña. Anatalia se encarga de elaborar y cocinar las pupusas y tortillas en una cocina de barro, y con leña, lo cual es muy escaso en estos días, por esta razón ella cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales compran en el lugar por ser pupusas y tortillas elaboradas de manera artesanal. Anatalia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, así mismo para comprar toda la materia prima para elaborar las pupusas, en mayores cantidades. Este negocio es muy rentable, ya que a pesar que cuente con muchos clientes siempre se logra obtener ganancias diarias, es por esto que Anatalia desea poder seguir adelante con el y de esta manera mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia y brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Anatalia G. T. is 50 years old. She lives in Delgado city, which is located in the San Salvador department. She lives in a very humble place with her husband, who works as a public transportation driver, and their two children. She has a business in her own house. She makes tortillas and “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables), two typical Salvadorean foods. Anatalia makes and cooks the pupusas and tortillas in a clay oven with firewood, which is very scarce these days. The reason that she has a lot of customers who buy from her place is that the pupusas and tortillas are handmade. Anatalia is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of corn. She will also buy all of the ingredients to make greater quantities of pupusas. This business is very profitable. She has a lot of customers, and she always gets daily earnings. Anatalia wants to be able to get ahead with the business. That way she will provide economic stability to the family and give her husband the necessary help to pay the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and other ingredients to make pupusas

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania García tiene 55 años y es dueña de un comercio en Emboscada, la misma es oriunda de Asunción.
La Sra tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, y anteriormente trabajaba en la Argentina y su marido tiene una moto que trabaja como taxi, hace como 6 años que regreso de la Argentina y su sueño es abrir un Autoservice ya que en la zona no hay, y así dejarles a sus hijos un buen negocio.
Solicitó nuestra asistencia para compra de Bebidas, y agradece a la Fundación por haberle dado la oportunidad de un crédito.
texts.en:
Melania García is 55-years-old and owns a shop in Emboscada, although she is a native of Asunción. She has three school-aged children and previously worked in Argentina. Her husband has a motorbike that he uses as a taxi. She returned from Argentina six years ago and she dreams of opening an AutoService, because there are none in the area. She hopes to be able to leave her children a successful business. She has requested assistance to buy drinks, and she is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya (Kiva Field Parnter) for giving her the opportunity of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cigarettes, and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of SODABI liqueur

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D., 50, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Widowed and blessed with a child, she makes sure that she earns so that her family can have a better life. She has been selling health supplements and vitamins for quite some time now.

Elizabeth has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 45,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy more quantities of products that she can sell.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can buy her own house and lot.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying more quantities of health products that she can sell

loans.name: Asler

texts.en:
Asler M. is from the village of Pocopoco, Damulog Bukidnon. He is 37 years old. Asler is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Asler owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling snack food and dairy products in the local community. Asler has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Asler joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asler has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Asler is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Asler from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hatice

texts.es:
La señora Hatice vive en casa propia en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como enfermera en el hospital de la mujer donde percibe un sueldo muy bajo.

El crédito que solicita es para obtener un diplomado en enfermería para de esta manera pedir un ítem en mejores condiciones, que le permita ascender a un cargo mejor ( se denomina ítem a un puesto de trabajo).

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Hatice lives in her own home in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz; she works as a nurse in the women's hospital where she receives a very small salary. The loan she is seeking is to get a nursing degree which will help her to request a better job with better working conditions as well as be promoted to greater responsibility. She has been an Impro customer and has always paid on time which qualifies her to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nursing degree to be able to receive a higher salary in the hospital where she works

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco tiene 37 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una  casa alquilada. Hace mas de 5 años que ofrece el servicio de transporte público, asimismo es vendedor de productos naturales, que previamente se ha capacitado como medico naturista de su zona, desde entonces recomienda con la seguridad y garantía de sus éstos productos naturales. Desde entonces y durante las mañanas trabaja en el servicio de transporte y durante las tardes se dedica en la venta de medicina natural. Ambos negocios le son importantes y rentables y por tal razón deseo adquirir a futuro su propio terreno y tener  su espacio de ventas y otra movilidad mas. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y asegura cumplir con sus pagos además considera que este aporte le será importante y de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de llantas para su carro.
texts.en:
37-year old Marco lives with his two children in a rented house. He has worked in public transportation for more than five years, and as well he sells natural products. He has taken training as a naturopath in his area. Now he can safely recommend and guarantee these products. During the mornings he works as a driver and during the afternoons he sells natural medicines. Both jobs are important to him and bring in a good income. For this reason he wishes to obtain a piece of land of his own so he has space for sales and more vehicles. This is Marco’s fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP and he promises to complete all his repayments. He believes that this financial support is important and will be a great help for his business. He will use the money to buy tires for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Hegenio

texts.en:
Hegenio C. is from the village of Acad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 41 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Hegenio owns and operates a business providing video machine repair services in the local community. Hegenio is just starting this business.

In 2009, Hegenio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hegenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Hegenio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Hegenio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.en:
Hermenegilda T. is from the city of Tabuk Tulay Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is 41 years old. Hermenegilda is single. Hermenegilda owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Hermenegilda is just starting this business.

In 2009, Hermenegilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Hermenegilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from PMPC. Hermenegilda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Hermenegilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rem

texts.en: Mrs. Rem S. is married to Mr. Sophana Long both of them are living in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She was born in 1985. She and her husband are farmers who own two point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family and a side from farming her husband is also a fisherman and motorbike taxi driver. Now this couple has some problem because their field is time to do farming, but they did not have enough money to grow. So to improve production, Mrs. Rem S. is requesting for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is three years old. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Rugando Farmers & Traders B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
As they say, determination is a key to success. T. Jovlet, a happily married mother of 5 children, ventured into tea growing in Nyamirambi, Kihihi, over 10 years ago. This was after realizing the readily available market in the area for a tea factory, that she developed an interest in growing and selling tea leaves alongside her banana plantation business. This enterprise has seen her earn 200,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis, which has greatly had an impact on her standard of living.

Her main drawback is the land being infertile with low yields, therefore, with this loan she will buy fertilizer and manure and further expand the tea plantation through buying more seedlings and doing it on a large scale. This will improve her yields, sales, and enable Jovlet to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for the tea plantation.

loans.name: María Olinda

texts.es: María Olinda M. de 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por: su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada, y junto a sus dos hijos. María tiene como profesión el ser costurera, ella se encarga de confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad de muchos clientes como familiares, amigos y vecinos, ya que la responsabilidad es una de las mejorar cualidades de ella. María elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas de vestir para vender en su casa de habitación, donde también se dedica a elaborar su trabajo. María solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa, María posee la certeza que de esta manera su negocio podrá mejorar y así obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean de beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
María Olinda M., age 49, lives in the Ilopango municipality. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and their two children. Her husband works for a private company. María is a seamstress. She makes formal clothes, uniforms, and casual clothes. She is quite meticulous, and she does very good work. This allows her to have many loyal customers like her relatives, friends, and neighbors. One of her best qualities is being responsible. María works by orders. She also makes clothes to sell in her house, which is where she makes the clothes. María is requesting a loan to be able to buy fabric in different colors and patterns. She will also buy thread, needles, and everything that is needed to make clothes. María is sure that this way her business will be able to improve. Then she will get greater income, which will be beneficial for her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia D. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nemia owns and operates a bakeshop, baking and selling a variety of baked goods to the local community. Nemia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Nemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Nemia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nemia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Magna

texts.es:
Magna B. es una señora D. 37 años  y  tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar. Magna esta casada y su marido se dedica a trabajar en un camión D. su propiedad, con lo que se complementa la economía D. la familia.
La Sra. posee una despensa desD. hace unos cinco años. Asi también, paralelamente a las ventas realizadas en la despensa pone a disposición D. sus clientes comidas rápidas, ensaladas D. fruta, actividades con las que complementa su despensa. 
El crédito obtenido D. la Fundación Paraguaya lo ha invertido en compra D. mercaderías, D. manera a tener un stock D. productos mas variados como carne, verduras, bebidas, etc. El futuro proyecto D. Magna es incluir venta D. helados a su despensa. 
Magna Agradece el crédito obtenido, pues le permite crecer en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Magna B. is a 37 year old woman who has 2 children, both of them schoolaged. Magna is married and her husband works driving a truck that he owns and uses to support the family. She has had a store for about five years. Along with the store sales, she also offers her customers fast food and fruit salads, activities that complement the store. The loan obtained from Fundación Paraguaya has been invested in purchasing merchandise in order to have stocks of various products such as meat, vegetables, beverages,etc. Magna's future project is to incluD. the sale of ice cream in her store. Magna is grateful for the loan she has obtained as it allows her to grow her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as: meat, vegetables, beverages and more.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Albertina;  La socia tiene  46 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a confeccionar diferentes prendas de lana, ella realiza chompas de lana en su domicilio y a pedido, La socia es muy conocida y tiene su clientela desde hace 4 años atrás y realiza chompas y ropones para niños, ella trabaja en su domicilio y una es que termina la prenda la lleva a donde sus clientes. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar lanas y botones para sus trabajos pendientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra lanas y botones. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Albertina, 46, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children.  She makes various articles of clothing out of wool.  She makes wool sweaters at home and on order.  She is very well known and has had her customer base for the last four years.  She makes sweaters and children’s robes.  She works at home and once she finishes an item she home delivers them to her customers.

She needs funds to buy wool and buttons for her pending jobs.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of wool and buttons.

She is grateful for and appreciates the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wool and buttons.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng N., 40, is married with six children living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. She grows rice and raises pigs, typically making US$2 each day. Her husband sells coconuts, and typically makes US$3 each day. Cheng N. would like a loan of US$500 to finish her construction.

loans.use: To finish construction.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 53 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella es profesora y enseña en colegio nacional de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Juana con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $100 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para gasto familiar como para comprar ropa para sus hijos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 53 years old and lives in the city of Cusco.  She is a long-standing member of the "Patrón D. San Sebastián" Communal Bank of Unidad Microfinanza Arariwa.  Juana is married and has two children.  She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who keeps her family going.  She is a teacher at Cusco's national school.

With her next loan of $100 USD that Juana hopes to receive, she will invest in household expenses such as buying clothes for her children.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided here, and she is committed to repaying the loan on schedule.

loans.use: For household expenses such as buying clothes for her children.

loans.name: Appolonie

texts.en: Appolonie is single. She sells women's clothes and has been doing this for three years. She would like this loan to buy more blouses, skirts and dresses to sell. The profit from this business will be used to replenish her inventory. Appolonie says that her business helped a lot in her education and even helped support her relatives.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Chheoun S., 29, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  S. is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $2.50 per day.  She spends $26 on food, $6 on electricity and water and $85 on other necessities every month.

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S. is a 48-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She and her husband use this land to grow vegetable. This couple has eight children and all of them are single. The five of them are working in different jobs. Chum S. has also built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chum S. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to rise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to rise for sale.

loans.name: Luz Oliva

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIA: Luz Oliva Londoño A.

Luz Oliva Londoño y su esposo durante mucho tiempo no tuvieron un trabajo fijo, lo que les dificultaba tener estabilidad económica en su familia.

Es por esto que hace 6 años Luz Oliva y su esposo decidieron comenzar a vender frutas. 
Su negocio inició en tablas y cajas en un semáforo de la ciudad pero luego de un tiempo por la calidad de sus productos Espacio Público les cedió un punto de venta para que tuvieran un espacio para mejorar su negocio.

Actualmente, Luz Oliva requiere de un crédito para comprar insumos para su negocio y de esta manera puede ofrecer mayor diversidad de productos y puede mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijas y nietas.
texts.en:
Small Businesswoman: Luz Oliva Londoño A.

Luz Oliva Londoño and her husband did not have steady work for a very long time.  That made it difficult to have financial stability in her family.

That is why Luz Oliva and her husband decided to start selling fruit six years ago.  Their business started with boards and boxes at a stoplight in the city.  After a while, “Espacio Público” (Public Space) gave them a sales spot because of the quality of their products.  They did this so that they would have a space to improve this business.

Luz Oliva now needs a loan to buy supplies for her business.  That way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products.  Then she will be able to improve the quality of life for her daughters and her granddaughters.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Sherlita's Group

texts.en:
Sherlita M. lives in the village of Villa Marzo Cordon, Isabela. She is 48 years old and leads an eight-person loan group affiliated with ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sherlita is married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by raising pigs. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns about 9,000 PHP from her work.

In 2006, Sherlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, her ninth, to buy feed and other supplies she needs to run her business. She will use to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.es:
La señora  Elisabeth Hernández Chaves, vive  en Chicoasen Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor  Julio Gutiérrez Méndez, en donde procreo cuatro hijos quienes ya están casados y está muy feliz que hayan encontrado la felicidad.

      El préstamo que ha estado solicitando lo invierte en la compra de  frutas y legumbres, para luego salir a venderlo en las comunidades cercanas de su pueblo,  en esto lleva  un año y dice que le va bien  ya que ha logrado ver que tiene buenos resultados.

      Para dedicarse a esta actividad se puso de acuerdo con su esposo, para que juntos trabajen y así salgan adelante hasta que dios les preste vida.

      De las ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad y de eso mismo toma para cubrir algunos gastos generados en su hogar, como también ser de manera puntual en sus pagos de fundación.
 
       Lo que desea es agrandar más su negocio para que logre tener más ingresos y así tener de donde sostenerse cuando ya esté  grande y no puedan trabajar mucho.
texts.en:
Elisabeth Hernández Chaves lives in Chicoasen in the state of  Chiapas, México.  She is married to Julio Gutiérrez Méndez.  This marriage has produced 4 children who are already married and are glad to have found happiness. 

The loan that she has requested will be invested in the purchase of fruits and vegetables that she will later sell in the communities near her town.  She has had this business for a year, and says that it is going well as she is seeing good results.  

In order to dedicate herself to this business, she made an agreement with her husband that they would work together and in this way continue to make progress as long as God grants them life. 

From the earnings that she gets from this investment in her business she will cover some of the household expenses and also make her payments on time to the foundation.

What she wants is to expand her business so that she can have more income and in this way support herself when she is older and can no longer work as much.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to later sell in nearby communities

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is 47 years old and lives with his son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They moved there in 2001 from Suhbaatar province. His son is currently studying at college. 

Gantulga began transporting goods with his truck between Ulaanbaatar and the eastern provinces of Mongolia in 2001. In addition to that he brings sand that is used for construction and sells it at a local market that specializes in construction material. A full truck of sand sells at between 100,000-110,000 MNT. 

He is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I would like to buy a new car for my son." He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts and tires for his truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tires for his truck

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto B. Jr. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. He is 32 years old. Loreto is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Loreto owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Loreto has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Loreto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreto is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Loreto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Kaniba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kaniba F. est un polygame de plus de 50 ans et père de seize  enfants (11 garçons et 5 filles) qui réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur F. est chauffeur de formation, après vingt années dans cette profession en république de Côte d’Ivoire, il s’est initié depuis son retour au bercail il y a environ sept années au de petit commerce notamment à l’achat et la vente de Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, et maintenant au transfert de crédit pré payé des  téléphonies, la charge des batteries et la vente des cartes téléphoniques. Il est  également le représentant de la société Nationale de Tabacs et Allumettes du Mali (SONATAM SA) au niveau de son quartier. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité, la diversité et la variété de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois ans avec laquelle il est à son quatrième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Il compte acheter avec ce  nouveau prêt, 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 sacs du sucre, 8 paquets de bonbon, 2 cartons du thé, 6 paquet de Chewing-gum, 7 paquets d’allumette, 2 cartons de savon, 5 chargeurs supplémentaires, 40 cartes de recharge téléphoniques Orange/Malitel, etc. Il achète ses marchandises auprès de commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail au comptant à crédit à une clientèle composée des garagistes et routiers puisque sa tablette est située auprès des garages-auto et de la direction régionale de Douanes de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 230 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kaniba F. is 50 years old, polygamous and the father of sixteen children (11 boys and 5 girls). He lives with his family in Sanoubougou in the center of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. F. is a trained driver. After exercising his profession for twenty years in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire, he returned home seven years ago and began a small retail business buying and selling cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing-gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, and recently selling pre-paid mobile phone cards and telephone cards, and recharging batteries.

In his neighbourhood, he is also the local representative of the National Society of Tobacco and Matches of Mali (SONATAM SA). He is quite sought after for the quality and diversity of his products. Over three years ago he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy his ever-increasing number of customers. He is now requesting his fourth personal loan, all preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed.

With his new loan he intends to buy 15 cartons of various cigarettes, 5 bags of sugar, 8 packages of candy, 2 cartons of tea, 6 packages of chewing-gum, 7 packages of matches, 2 cartons of soap, 5 additional battery chargers, 40 Orange/Malitel telephone recharge cards, etc.

He buys his products from local wholesalers before reselling them retail, for cash or credit, to a customer base of garage owners and truck drivers, as his stall is located close by car garages and the regional offices of the Sikasso Customs.

With this loan he hopes to attain a monthly income of 230,000 FCFA which will mainly be used to increase his working stock, pay loan interests and invest the remainder in his business activity.

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is currently in a business selling maize. She is 24 years old, married, with three children and only one goes to school. Lona borrowed a loan to stock more maize to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more maize to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old and married, with 5 children. Marina works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like oil, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Marina has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items, such as candies, cigarettes, curls, eggs, salt, etc..  In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is married and has one child. She sells rubber bowls and also cooks food for sale at Amoanda near Elmina. Her husband is a driver. Esi uses her income to assist her husband to pay school fees and other household expenses. Esi will use the loan to purchase food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards building a food joint. In this picture, she was traveling to some of the communities to sell the cooked food.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Gladys Karina

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es de estado civil conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Estudió educación superior. 
Gladys nos cuenta que trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de cristales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará cien unidades de vasos y vajillas e implementará el local.
Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, él tiene un estudio de abogados y trabaja en el magisterio.  
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y mejorar sus ventas.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Unión Arco Deustua” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She finished high school.

Gladys tells us that she has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling glassware.

Gladys will use this new loan for 500 soles to buy 100 units of glasses and dishes with which to stock her business.  Gladys' husband helps her in the business.  He has a legal practice and works in teaching.

Gladys' dream is to grow in her business and to improve her sales.  What she likes about her community bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy 100 units of glasses and dishes

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik was born in 1962 in Kapan. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter, who studies in the agricultural institute. 

For about 14 years, Garik and his wife have had their own business. They sell household goods, shoes, underclothes, cereals, etc., at Kapan market. Garik spends part of his business profit for his daughter's education, and another part, he uses to keep his family.
 
This is Garik's tenth loan from Nor Horizon, and he is asking for 900,000 Armenian dram to buy cereals and wheat from villagers and household goods from Yerevan to resell them in the Kapan market.

loans.use: To buy cereals and wheat and also household goods to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children; two of them are still attending school. In 2000, she started working at producing homemade food such as bread, olive oil, etc. She sells her products to local customers. In parallel, she works as a housekeeper for clients who request her to clean their houses. She works hard in both jobs to be able to satisfy her family needs. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of food products in order to increase her business productivity and therefore her sales. She hopes that the loan will help her meet her business objectives.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food production business in the Philippines.

Marieta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Marieta has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from a variety store.

In the future, Marieta would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos labora como guarda de seguridad, en horas libres trabaja en soldadura, el cual ejerce desde hace varios años.
Su esposa tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas el cual apoya con los gastos del hogar. Y a sus tres pequeños hijos, la mejor es una niña.
El objetivo de ambos ha sido la mejora a su casa, en donde han venido mejorando para el bienestar comun de la familia. todas esta mejora la ha logrado con prestamos en Afodenic. 
Con este nuevo financiamiento pondra verja al porche y porton que no tiene aun, logrando la seguridad de su familia.
Comprara soldadura, hiero liso, tubos redondo, para poder hacer el trabajo,  que el mismo lo hace ahorrandose la mano de obra, siendo de gran beneficio para sus mejoras. Contento por que terminara la obra  y podra gozar de mas espacio.
texts.en:
Carlos works as a security guard. During his free time, he works in welding which he's done for many years. His wife has a small business selling tortillas which supports with the house bills and their three small children, the youngest of which is a girl. The objective of both has been to improve their house which they have been improving for the common wellbeing of the family. They have achieved all of these improvements through loans with Afodenic.

With this new loan, they will put up a railing on the porch and a gate that they don't have yet, for the security of the family. They will purchase solder, smooth iron, round tubes to be able to do the work so they can save on labor being a great benefit for their improvements. They are happy to finish the work and be able to enjoy more space.

loans.use: to purchase solder, smooth iron, and round tubes to close the porch and make a gate, making more space.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Sheila has been in this business for three years. Sheila earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase items like blouses and pants to sell to customers.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like blouses and pants to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.fr: Monsieur Mansour habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 37 ans et s’active dans le secteur du transport. Il gère un taxi depuis quelques années. Il a choisi son activité par nécessité. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de son véhicule. Ce financement lui permettra de ne pas interrompre  son activité, d’assurer ses revenus journaliers et  la prise en charge de la  dépense quotidienne. Une de ses missions consiste a soutenir  les membres de sa famille  et ses proches.
texts.en: Mansour lives in Senegal. He is 37 years old and works in the transport industry. For the past few years, he has been earning a living by driving a taxi. He is requesting a 200 000 francs loan so that he can get his car repaired. This will allow him to continue working and earning the income he needs to cover his daily living expenses. One of his goals is to be able to support his family members and loved ones.

loans.use: to get his vehicle repaired.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and has five children: three sons and two daughters. 

She and her husband are rice farmers, earning $4 each day.  Both are skilled and have many years of farming experience.  It's a skill they learned from their ancestors.  

To earn a better living, this modest couple requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike.  

Keo hopes to send her children to school through at least high school.  Her family is very grateful to all lenders.  This is her first loan from Kiva and HKL.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and is married with three children. For the past three years, she has earned a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  

Gina is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and a mother of four, two of whom are adults while the other two are still in school. She lives with her family in their home in Nkubu in central Kenya. She has been in farming for 20 years and currently produces vegetables, fruits, and milk for the local market.

Joyce has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into the poultry business. She says  the loan will help improve her income and  pay for the kids' education. She hope to build residential houses in the future.

Joyce laments the poor prices for farm produce and the insufficiency of water.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 50-year-old married man and father of four children who has been selling furniture for 20 years. His long experience has given him special skill in the furniture business, which has helped a lot in providing special deals to attract customers.

Kamel is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new furniture collection to attract new customers. He hopes to open a special furniture factory one day to design his own collections.

loans.use: To buy a new furniture collection

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con sus hijos en una localidad muy concurrida de personas. Ella posee una venta de productos de uso personal, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre vende productos de primera calidad a excelentes precios; Yolanda es una mujer muy activa y le encanta su trabajo, le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que el hombre tiene el secreto del éxito en sus manos si pone esfuerzo y constancia en su trabajo, solo así lograra el triunfo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, shampoo, entre otros. Yolanda tiene fe que este esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is forty-five years old and living with her children in a busy town full of people.  She has a business selling personal products.  Yolanda is well known in the area and has made a lot of customers, because she always sells quality products at great prices.  

Yolanda is a very active woman and loves her job.  She likes to stay ahead of the competition.  She thinks that one has the secret to success in their hands if they put in effort and perseverance in their work; this is the only way to triumph.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that allows her to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, shampoo, among other things. Yolanda has faith that this effort will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, and shampoo.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La Señora Roxana, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo desde hace 21 años,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de San Manuel, Cortes.
Ella tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente dos viven en su casa y están estudiando la educación secundaria.
La ocupación a que se dedica es la agricultura, produciendo plátano, guayaba y maíz con el apoyo directo de su esposo. 
Ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para dar un mejor manejo a los cultivos.
En el futuro ella espera exportar el producto a varios países y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana, 33, has lived in a common law relationship with her husband since the age of 21.  She lives in a rural community in San Miguel Municipality, Cortes.  She has four children but only two still live at home; they are attending secondary school.

She is a farmer growing bananas, guavas and corn with direct help from her husband.  She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to provide better care for her plants.  In the future, she’d like to export her crops to various countries and increase her income to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii SHG Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family and educate her kids. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield, harvesting 25 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 21 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mary will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Mary and the group with the field officer far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La señora Pablina tiene 53 años de edad, es Soltera, comenta que no tiene hijos. La familia de Pablina vive en la ciudad de Caacupé y cuente que tiene en su domicilio un copetín desde hace 4años.
La señora Pablina trabaja mucho y más en este tiempo cuando van llegando las fiestas de fin de año, donde las ventas de comestibles y bebidas  aumentan considerablemente. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por darle a su familia todo lo mejor y de esa forma retribuirles lo que han hecho por ella.
La Cliente agradece a Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y con el crédito que pide desea comprar carnes, condimentos, panificados y demás ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que prepara.
texts.en:
Pablina is 53 years old, single, and says that she has no children. Pablina’s family lives in the city of Caacupé and she says that she has had a snack shop in her house for the past four years.

Pablina works a lot, especially now that the holidays are almost here when food and beverage sales increase considerably. She considers herself to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman who struggles to provide her family with all the best and thus repay them for everything they have done for her.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support provided to her business. With this loan requested, she would like to buy meat, condiments, bread products and other ingredients needed to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, bread products and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school, located in Blama village, near Kenema City in Eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves 60 pupils and employs 6 teachers. In operation since 1990, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.

However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side-projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries.

Elizabeth is the leader of this group of teachers. Elizabeth is 49 years old and has been in the teaching profession for 27 years. She is married, and together they have four children – one in primary school, two in secondary school and one in college. Elizabeth plans to use her portion of the loan to buy house building materials, like cement and nails, for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement and nails for the construction of a house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married and has four children. He runs a retail shop and he has been in business for 4 years earning a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

He is borrowing his first loan with KADET Ltd. of 30,000 KES. He intends to use the funds to purchase sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and other items for the retail shop. With the anticipated profits, he will pay back the loan.

His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase stock like tea leaves, cooking fat, sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a woman who has experienced a lot of difficulties. She always tries her best for the well-being of her family. Matluba is married and has two children. Her children are non-adult and she is the main breadwinner of the family because her husband’s income is small.

Matluba is going to start a new sewing business. With this aim, she took part in a course entitled “To Get Ahead” from a women's organization and she got a certificate. Matluba will offer the sewing service in her house. She can sew different kinds of dresses.

Matluba is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy and she dreams to open sewing workshop in future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.en:
Angel has a small store where he sells snacks and foods. He also makes lunches and delivers them to construction sites to make sales. He has had this business for about five years after he lost his job selling supplies. He is seeking to use his money to purchase his food supply from wholesalers. He is a very hard worker who runs his business from early in the morning until 10 PM.

Angel is 31 years old and does not have a family. Currently he is studying at a local university on the weekends in order to get his degree. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He is seeking to use his money to purchase his food supply from wholesalers.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is divorced and has a daughter who depends on her financially. Socorro works in a restaurant making food and she began selling cosmetics 15 years ago because the wages she receives are not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. Socorro is a very hard-working woman and that is why she is requesting a loan of $550 dollars with which she plans to buy a supply of products she can offer to her clients and thereby increase her earnings.

You can contribute to the improvement of conditions in which Socorro and her daughter now live. Your help will be of great use to this family. Socorro believes strongly in the power of human warmth and goodness to help those most in need. For this reason, she is awaiting your cooperation and offers to pay the loan she is given over a period of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Socorro es divorciada, tiene una hija que depende económicamente de ella. Socorro trabaja en un restaurante haciendo comida, y por necesidad hace 15 años inició vendiendo cosméticos, dado que la pensión que recibe es muy poca para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. Socorro es una mujer muy trabajadora y por ello es que ella solicita un crédito de $550 dólares con los que planea surtirse de mercancía para ofrecérsela a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ingresos.

Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar las condiciones en que en las que viven ahora Socorro y su hija. Tú apoyo será de gran utilidad para esta familia, ella confía mucho en la calidad humana de las personas y su bondad para ayudar a los que más necesitan por ello espera su cooperación y ofrece pagar el préstamo que le den en un período de 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to buy chemical ingredients for making soaps

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia C. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. Silvia runs a small grocery store located at her house that she and her husband just started a year ago after he retired. Her husband used to work in public administration, but now he is working on fixing the yards of their house and neighbors.

Silvia and her husband are seeking a loan in order to purchase chickens to start a small farm because they want to start selling chicken at their small grocery store. With their last loan, they were able to purchase 2 pigs.

loans.use: Purchase chickens.

loans.name: Julia Ernestina

texts.es:
Julia is a selfless working mother and grandmother who cares for her family. For many years she has worked, providing and education and clothing to her children since they have been in the home. Despite her advanced age, together with her husband she continues to create cheese and milk from the cows that have provided economic stability since they were purchased many years ago. Now, through her daily labor she is able to provide food and sustenance to her young grandchildren. For this reason, Julia wishes to obtain an additional cow to increase her production so that she can continue to support the beloved descendants of her children. She is requesting a $325 loan, which she has committed to repay within 6 months. She also plans on planting a potato crop in 3 months with the earnings that she obtains from milk production. With your assistance, Julia will be able to keep helping to provide for her children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia, es una madre y abuelita trabajadora, abnegada y preocupada por su familia. Que a pesar de la avanzada edad que tiene aún realiza, junto a su esposo, la actividad que por muchos años les ha otorgado educación y vestido a sus hijos, cuando estos se encontraban en el seno familiar, la fabricación de quesos y venta de leche que obtienen gracias a las vaquitas que compraron hace muchos años les ha podido otorgar estabilidad. y ahora a través del desarrollo diario de esta tarea pueden brindarles comida y bienestar a sus pequeños nietos .Es por ello que Julia, desea adquirir una vaquita más para poder ampliar su producción a fin de seguir apoyando a los queridos descendientes de sus hijos. La solicitud para llevar a cabo este deseo es por un monto de 325 dólares con un compromiso de pago durante 6 meses y también está en sus proyectos a mediano plazo iniciar el cultivo de papa con las ganancias que obtenga por la producción de leche. Julia puede seguir ayudando a sus hijos y nietos, no te olvides, ella te necesita

loans.use: The purchase of an additional cow will help Julia to continue supporting her beloved children and grandchildren

loans.name: Llama De Amor Group

texts.en:
About the Group Leader

Maria is 28 years old and has two children (a girl who is three and a boy who is five). Her mother and her brother both help out working in her small store, which is next door to her house. The name of her small grocery store is “Colmado Yahira” after her nickname, “Yahira”. She sells bread, rice, bottled water, cooking oil, milk, candies for the kids, sugar and soda. Maria started her small business with her first loan from Esperanza.

She uses the profits from her shop to continue stocking her shelves. She is also able to tuck a little away each month to save for the future. She has been able to store up voluntary savings in addition to the obligatory savings that Esperanza requires. She hopes to be able to save enough money from her business to finish building her house out of concrete.

About the Group

During training sessions with Esperanza, their loan officer, Marcelina Marte, leads group discussions about the importance of solidarity and discipline in taking out a loan. The group talks about the true meaning of solidarity and the need to truly stand by each other in the event one of the group members doesn’t fare well in her business ventures. She points out the difference between choosing neighbors and friends who you like as business partners versus choosing ones who you know will pay back their loans.

Maria is the coordinator for her group of six women within the larger Bank of Hope. Together with the coordinators from the other four groups, they form a leadership council, whose responsibilities include involvement in community activities such as mothers' clubs and the local health clinics.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of bread, rice, bottled water, cooking oil, milk and sugar

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en:
Romoke B. is a mother of 4, is 34 years old, and comes from the Shibiri part of Lagos State, Nigeria .She sells yams in bulk and has been in business for 6 years.

She requests a loan of $700 to buy more yams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Buy yams to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna Z. has a business selling fish at one of the busy local markets in Melitopol, Ukraine. Anna’s family has been involved in fish selling for some time. Anna’s mother-in-law was an expert selling fish for many years and Anna’s husband has an identical business at another market. Anna has been selling for about five years and has benefited from the experience and advice of her mother-in-law. Anna and her husband have two small daughters. Their businesses provide the sole means of income for their family.

Anna has requested a loan of $600 to purchase a supply of raw fish that she will be able to marinate and re-sell at her fish stand. This type of fish is popular in Ukraine and should sell well. Anna has benefited in the past from financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw fish to marinate for re-sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married with a 19-year-old son. She and her family live in Zaporozhye. Angela owns a small business in the central city market which is the biggest market in the neighborhood. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been in this trade for 11 years in a row. Presently, her turnover capital is about $900. 

Angela is hoping to use this loan of $1000 to increase her turnover capital and purchase assorted inventory wholesale. The quality clothing she offers for sale in her kiosk is always in demand among customers. Angela is hoping to re-supply her inventory and attract more clients offering an even better variety of merchandise this spring season. We believe Angela will benefit from more consistent financial support which will strengthen her trade and help her continue to grow professionally.

loans.use: To increase assorted inventory

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Fumi A. is 48 years old, married, and has six children. She hails from Lagos state, Nigeria. Fumi sells broken plates and also supplies groundnut oil. She has been in business since 2003. She needs a loan of $450.00 so that she can buy more groundnut oil and broken plates to sell.

loans.use: To buy more plates and groundnut oil for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, strives every day working to earn the income necessary to support her three children. For this reason, she has small stand where she sells items in the dairy products market. She also sells her products in the fair in Jauja two days a week - Wednesdays and Sundays, which makes her very happy. In the future she would like to provide more of her products, making it necessary to purchase of a better breed of cow, which is capable of the production of milk in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda, se esfuerza cada día para lograr en su trabajo los resultados esperados es decir las ganancias que requiere para sostener a sus 3 hijos, por esta razón sale a vender en el pequeño espacio de ventas que mantiene en el mercado productos lácteos, también los oferta fuera de este espacio los días miércoles y domingos en la feria de Jauja por lo que ahora ella esta muy contenta. Desea a futuro ofertar sus productos en mayor número valiéndose de la compra de una raza mejorada de vacas capaz de proporcionarle leche en mayor cantidad.

loans.use: Purchase a better breed of cow.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami A. is a 32-year-old man who keeps cows for the sale of dairy products. He has more that 10 years experience in this field. He is married and has three children; they all live in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He purchased his last two cows with his first loan that he borrowed from Aqroinvest. He has successfully completed its repayment and now he is applying for this second loan. As selling dairy products is the main financial source for his family, Nizami is focused on expanding his business. For this reason, he has applied for a loan of $800 USD. He will use this loan to purchase one milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow.

loans.name: Carmen Francisca

texts.es:
Ms Carmen Francisca is a member of the communal bank “Brave Women,” located in the Jr Coronel Portillo 836, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and is the mother of 3 daughters, her husband is a carpenter, but their income is not sufficient for their needs, so Ms Carmen with the first loan received of Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decided to invest on the construction of a commercial space for events.

Currently, Ms Carmen has one location, which she rents for all kinds of social events. She gets up at 7 o'clock in the morning and prepares breakfast for her daughters and her husband. Then she waits for the arrival of her clients and at the end of her work day she takes care of the home. With this loan of S/. 1000 which will be paid in 4 months, She bought wood, cement, nails, paint, etc.

Carmen has just begun to make her dream come true. She has always wanted to have her own business, since her husband was always the one dealing with their investment. Carmen desires to continue to prosper on her business in order to benefit her family. She feels happy with the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carmen Francisca pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Trujillo 250, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre de 3 hijas, su esposo es maderero, pero su economía familiar no es suficiente para sus gastos, es así que Carmen con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la construcción de un local para eventos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un local con el cual presta servicios de alquiler para todo tipo de eventos sociales, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijas y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la espera de la llegada de sus clientes y a los quehaceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró madera, cemento, calaminas, clavos, pintura, etc. Carmen recién esta empezando a hacer realidad el sueño de toda su vida, el de manejar sola su empresa ya que siempre las inversiones lo realizaba su esposo, ella desea seguir adelante para el beneficio de su familia. Se siente feliz con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is 48 years old and is mother of 5 children, all of whom are an inspiration to her to keep going. Together with her husband Arnulfo (is retired and a pensioner) who supports her in everything especially her business. Her responsibilities rest in providing all that is necessary to their children, and it is the reason why she works so hard.

She sells fresh squeezed fruit juices in the market. She has been working at this for many years now and she has been very successful. Her stand is located in a very attractive place and best of all, it is well travelled. Marina wants to rise above and see more success. She wants to make this happen and she has been doing everything with great enthusiasm. She works to meet the family's needs and above all to improve their standard of life.

Her wish is to build a kiosk so that with time her business will be located in an even better locale. To make this dream come true she requires working capital, which she is requesting here. Your support will help her reach her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina tiene 48 años, es madre de 5 hijos, los cuales le inspiran a seguir adelante, junto a su esposo Arnulfo (jubilado, pensionista) quien la apoya en todo y sobre todo en su negocio, son los encargados de brindar todo lo necesario a su hijos, es por eso que le echan muchas ganas a su trabajo. Se dedica a la venta de jugos en un puesto del mercado, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, y le va muy bien, se encuentra en un sitio acogedor y sobre todo muy concurrido.
