Marina quiere surgir y salir adelante, desde luego cumplir lo que tiene propuesto, y lo hace con mucho entusiasmo. Trabaja para solventar los gastos familiares y sobre todo para mejorar su nivel de vida. Su deseo es construir un kiosco y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en un lugar de mucha concurrencia, para lograr este propósito ella requiere de un capital, que solicita aquí, el que le ayudará con su objetivo.

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell fresh squeezed juices.

loans.name: Confort

texts.fr:
Madame KWADZO Essimé est née le 22 août 1967 à Lomé. Elle est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des fournitures scolaires dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis le décès de son mari. 
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 50 cartons de cahiers et 10 cartons de livres. Ainsi avec le nouveau stock qu’elle aura à constituer, elle pourra mieux vendre à l’approche de cette nouvelle rentrée.
texts.en:
Mrs. Confort T. was born August 23, 1974, in Mango in the prefecture of Oti. She is divorced and responsible for three children. She currently lives in Agoè and sells wood coal and firewood. She stocks up in the village of Amou. This first loan that she seeks will allow her to buy 25 bags of wood coal and 6 bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood and wood coal

loans.name: Asong

texts.en:
Asong K. is 48 years old. He is married with three kids who are currently in school. K. is a dealer in bicycle parts. 

He also provides repairs and servicing for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. Nankese, where he lives and trades, is a farming community. 

He says the sale of bicycles and parts is a very lucrative business since most of the farmers ride on bicycles to their farms. He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of bicycle parts to serve his customers. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings to expand his shop and support his kids in school. 

He belongs to the community group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. In this group, Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of bicycle parts.

loans.name: Ea

texts.en:
Mr. Ea S. is a villager in Boeng Tranh village in Takeo Province. He owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice. He also breeds pigs. His wife, Mrs. Keav Tetjany (on the left in the photo), is a cake seller. They have four children who are all attending the local school.

Even though they run several different businesses, they do not make enough money to support their living conditions. Thus Mr. Ea S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to improve his breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy piglets to improve his breeding business.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Ngo Thi T. is 27 years old. She has been in TYM since 2006. With her first loan, she bought pigs. Now, her family's primary income is raising pigs and trading mats. With an income of about 3,5 million/month, her family’s life is becoming more and more stable. For her second loan, Ngo Thi would like to borrow 5 millionVND ($300USD) to invest in more mats.

loans.use: To invest in mats

loans.name: Yeur

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeur P. is a villager in Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a mat maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more raw materials to make mats for her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Yeur P. is 29 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sean Sarath, is a construction worker. Her husband and her children are shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make mats for her customers.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Vendiendo salchipapas y parrillas por las noches Rosario ha sabido generar recursos para ayudar en el mantenimiento de su casa y educación de sus dos hijos. Desde hace dos años se animó a vender productos de belleza por catalogo, pues tenía mucho clientes a quien ofrecérselos.

Además de vende frituras por las noches, hace poco también ha implementado una vitrina con algunas golosinas para venderlas mientras trabaja en la puerta de su casa. Rosario siempre está en busca de negocios que la ayuden a progresar. Por ahora se siente orgullosa de haber construido junto con su esposo su casa.

Más adelante le gustaría abrir una bodega en su casa, donde pueda vender también el café que su esposo provee a tiendas.
texts.en:
Selling salchipapas and other grilled foods every evening has taught Rosario a thing or two about earning money for househould expenses and schooling for her two children. Two years ago, she hit on the idea of selling beauty products since she had a lot of customers to whom she could offer them. As well as the prepared food that she sells evenings, she sells snacks from a display case that she recently set up at the door of her house. Rosario is always on the lookout for work that will help her get ahead. For now, she's proud of having built, with her husband, the house where they live. In the future, she would like to open a shop where she can sell the coffee that her husband distributes to stores in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for snack business.

loans.name: Alikerem

texts.en:
Alikerem A. is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his three children, whom he adores. Alikerem is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. Today his children are studying at school and the university, thanks to his efforts to provide them better educaton.

Alikerem works raising livestock. Every morning he leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals. In order to do this he will need to purchase livestock of better breeds. These animals are very costly. He needs capital of $1200 to purchase two calves. Currently he does not have that much money, and therefore he is requesting this loan. Alikerem hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Shazia Kosar M. Jamil Group

texts.en:
Shazia kosar baji, 33, is married and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Shazia baji is married to M. J. who is a painter by profession. He performs his duties only when people call him to paint their houses. Shazia baji is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son. All of her children attend the school that is located near their house. Shazia baji helps her husband by sewing clothes for neighbors and relatives. She uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy paint so her husband can fulfill the orders of his customers to paint their houses. 

Shazia baji is the group leader for the following women of her locality: 
Ashraf mai baji who wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Sugran baji who wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Suraiya baji who wants a loan to buy vehicles spare parts to sell. 
Ghulam Fatima baji who wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw. 
Parveen baji who wants a loan to buy supplies (chairs, creams, and razors) for her salon. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina O. is a single parent and has 6 dependents. She has completed schooling through junior high. Christina has been selling bread, which she bakes herself, at Kisi near Elmina since 2002. Christina uses her income to pay for her childrens' school fees, as well as for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Christina will use the loan to increase her capital in order to purchase flour and other baking materials, which will enable her to increase production. With the profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to save towards building a house with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other baking materials in order to increase production.

loans.name: Muneratu

texts.en:
Muneratu M. is thirty-seven years old. She is a married mother of five children who are all currently in school. One of them is in the senior high school. The rest are in the junior high and the primary school. Muneratu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Aquase, a fishing community near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

She is a trader. She prepares and sells palm oil. Palm oil is prepared from the palm nuts. The cooked palm is pounded, mixed with hot water, sieved and boiled for several hours. The reddish substance, which is the oil, is skimmed off and boiled again to expel water content.

She buys the palm nuts from farmers in the nearby communities. She distributes the oil to retailers and food vendors. Muneratu has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk. She hopes to improve her standard of living and give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Savoba

texts.ru: Савоба арендует часть магазина в центре города. Занимается продажей детской одежды, детских гигиенических средств. Опыт в этой деятельности более 15 лет, так как она сама бывший работник торговли. Ей 42 года. Имеет 2 детей. Ее старшая дочь постоянно помогает ей торговать. За товаром Савоба ездит на оптовый рынок г. Худжанда и в соседний Кыргызстан. Савоба собирается закупить весенний ассортимент детской одежды и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Savoba M. rents a section of a store in the city center. She has a business selling children's clothes and health products. She has 15 years of experience, having worked in retail in the past. Savoba is 42 years old. She has 2 children. Her older daughter helps in the store. To purchase goods Savoba travels to a wholesale market in a neighboring city Hudzhanda and to the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan. Savoba plans to purchase spring children's clothes, and therefore she is asking KIVA for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Nagina M.ashiq Group

texts.en:
Nagina baji is the wife of M. and has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is the mother of three chiildren: two daughters and one son. All of her chiildren are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

Her husband is a mechanic and wants to start a motor workshop. Nagina baji is applying for a loan to buy mechanical tools so that her husband is able to start his own workshop and earn a good income. 

Nagina baji is the group leader of five other women from her locality:

Shabana baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Kiran baji wants a loan to buy sanitation supplies (taps [faucets], pipes) to resell.

Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy mechanical tools for her motor workshop.

Munawar sultana baji and Tasneem baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy mechanical tools for her husband's motor workshop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn U. is a 34-year-old mother of one child and owns and manages a sari-sari store. She works hard at her business so that she can bring home the bacon. She has been selling various types of goods at the store since 2006. She is asking a loan of PHP 20,000 from CEVI to purchase additional stock of merchandise to sell. She believes that by doing so, she can attract more customers and increase her income.

CEVI provides financial services to economically active poor in Philippines. CEVI not only gives loans but also provides trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. sells peppers, groundnuts (peanuts) and other foodstuffs. She has received no formal education. She is married and has six dependents and is responsible for paying school fees for her children.

Margaret has been selling peppers and groundnuts for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy peppers and groundnuts for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy peppers and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Christina M. from Mwanza. She is married with one child, 9 years old. Christina has been running a beauty salon since 2003. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. Christina works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase long hair, blue hair and red hair. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Christina thanks you for her support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase long hair, blue hair and red hair

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline G. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector buying and selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community. Evangeline is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Rosa Del Milagro

texts.es:
Rosa es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive con su esposo y sus padres de avanzada edad en el pueblo joven Jesús Salvador, ubicado en el distrito de Monsefú, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica desde hace una año a la compra y venta de arroz, que es uno de los  productos de mayor consumo en los hogares del Perú, este negocio le ha servido para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos económicos diarios del hogar ya que el se dedica eventualmente al trabajo en construcción civil y los ingresos que genera esta actividad no son suficientes para mantener su hogar.

Debido a la constante demanda ella piensa ampliar su negocio comprando más arroz, por lo que está solicitando un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles, hasta el momento Rosa ha tenido cinco préstamos los que ha cancelado puntualmente.

Rosa desea seguir sacando adelante a su familia trabajando en su negocio, y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is married, has three children, and lives with her husband and her elderly parents in the young town of Jesus the Savior, located in the district of Monsefú 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked for a year buying and selling rice which is one of the products of greatest consumption in the homes of Peru. This business has allowed her to help her husband with the daily household expenses since he works in civil construction and the income this work provides is not sufficient to maintain the home. Due to the constant demand she is thinking about expanding her business by buying more rice, for which she is requesting a loan of 1500 new sols. Previously Rosa has had five loans which she has repaid punctually. Rosa desires to continue helping her family advance by working in her business and so be able to offer them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice by the sack for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
veronica is a member of the Bwawani C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 18,17 years.

Veronica started her own business selling potatoes,tomatoes,onions 5 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Veronia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes,tomatoes,onions for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Veronica hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,potatoes

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa B. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 26 years old. Leonisa is married and has 3 infant-aged children.

To make a living, Leonisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Leonisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 66 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Ventanilla y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años aproximadamente no recuerda bien, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio compra venta D. ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino y también ropa americana, en todas sus actividades siempre le ayuda su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela is a member of the community bank "Cuturapi" in the very small town Cuturapi of the Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 66 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Ventanilla area of Cuturapi. She did not have the opportunity to study. Ángela has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for about three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles and allowed her to increase capital for her business buying and selling small livestock. Currently, she is asking for a loan of 1000 soles, which would allow her to buy sheep as well as American-style clothing. Her husband helps her in all her activities. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes savings and chats.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep and clothing

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes quiere dar una buena vejez. El trabajo para Nancy siempre fue una actividad muy digna, es por eso que trabaja sin complejos atendiendo un restaurante, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que es uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca. 
Su labor consiste en atender a los clientes, servirles y cobrar, actividades que ella realiza muy bien y con mucha amabilidad, motivos por el cual es una de las empleadas más eficientes del restaurante.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a tantas personas a la vez, lo cual la cansa mucho. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de Nancy con MFP y espera pode pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil soles solicitados planea incrementar sus ahorros para posteriormente implementar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Nancy, 34, is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She lives in the house of her parents, whom she wants to give a good old age. Work has always been a very respectable activity for Nancy and because of this she works without complex serving in a restaurant, which is always very crowded being one of the best-known restaurants in the city of Juliaca.

Her work consists of attending to clients and serving and collecting payment from them, activities which she does very well and with much kindness. For this reason, she is one of the most efficient employees of the restaurant. She has been doing this kind of work for 4 years and most enjoys making conversation with her clients. She finds the hardest thing is attending to so many people at the same time, and this makes her very tired.

This is the second loan for Nancy with MFP and she expects to be able to pay it back on time, as she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of the communal bank, where she is well-liked and respected. With the 1,000 soles requested, she plans to increase her savings to subsequently set up a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment in her restaurant

loans.name: Jhon Angel

texts.es:
El socio JHON ANGEL, pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 3 hijos los tres son varones, el mayor tiene 3 años y esta en el jardin, el segundo tiene 1 año y el ultimo tiene 3 meses de nacido, el es abogado y tiene 2 años ejerciendo su profesión, el actualmente tiene una empresa de asesoria, el trabaja junto con su esposa que también es abogada, el socio necesita el crédito para poder implementar cosas que faltan en la oficina, como comprar libros actualizados, escritorios(muebles), computadoras, etc. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JHON ANGEL, 31, is a member of the “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES" communal bank. He is from the city of Cusco. He is in a common-law relationship and has 3 sons. The eldest is 3 and is in kindergarten, the second son is 1 year old, and the youngest is 3 months old. He is a lawyer and has been engaged in his profession for 2 years. He has a consulting firm which he operates with his wife, who is also a lawyer. He needs these funds to furnish is office with up-to-date books, desks, computers, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity offered in this manner and pledges to make his repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide consulting services to commercial establishments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits for her business

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Cruz, or “Mimi” as she likes to be called, is a 48-year-old borrower from San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is a single mother of one, 13-year-old Cesar. This is her second loan with Esperanza International, and she will be using it to buy inventory for her Dominican eatery.

Mimi will be purchasing foods such as rice, beans, oil, flour, meats, juices, and other refreshments, to serve to her customers. She believes that her eatery is a place where “once you enter, you can’t leave” because you want to just keep eating! Mimi is obviously very confident in her business and excited for what the future has in store for her small restaurant.

Life in San Pedro can be rough: power outages happen daily (if one has power to begin with!), running water is scarce and never potable, and sanitation is limited. These facilities and services are especially inadequate in Mimi’s neighborhood. Despite these hardships, Mimi is very grateful for her work with Esperanza. She said that her business is steadily improving, and even though it may not seem like much, she knows her eatery is going places. Thank you for your support in lending to Mimi!

loans.use: To purchase oil, flour, chicken, rice, and beans for her eatery

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  ROSA S. A. tiene 53 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL ÉXITO II. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria.  Es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 1 depende  económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró pollos y alimento balanceado al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará pollos, patos y alimento balanceado al por mayor. Ella sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus animales para así vender con mayor frecuencia y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa S. A. is 53 years old and lives in the district of Trujillo, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, in Peru. She belongs to the Mujeres al Exito II communal bank. She completed school through the 5th year of secondary school. She lives with her partner and has 5 children, 1 of whom she supports. She raises and sells chickens. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased chickens and animal feed wholesale. With this loan for 1,000 soles, she will purchase chickens, ducks and animal feed wholesale. She dreams of growing her livestock business so that she can sell more frequently and earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, ducks, and animal feed

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is forty years old. He is married and has three children. All of his children attend school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment. The majority of the people in their community are traders (they sell things). 

Frank sells ready-made clothes, such as jeans and t-shirt, for both genders. He buys goods from the capital city and sells the in a kiosk by the roadside in his community. He also treks to other places to sell. Frank has been selling clothes for four years. He wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothes to sell

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak V., age 31, is married with four teenage children, two of whom are employed working in construction while the other two attend school and also do housework.

Hak V. is a local grower who owns a large farmland where she cultivates crops. Her husband works with her in the farming business. Usually the couple generates around $3 of profit a day to meet the needs of their family.

Hak V. faces a problem with plowing her farmland since she doesn’t own a cow. Because of that, she decided to seek a loan to buy a couple of cows to raise for plowing her land and to raise calves.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows to raise

loans.name: Janetrix

texts.en:
Janetrix Sella M. is 33 years old and married with seven children. She lives with her family in Bukirimo, Busia district.

Janetrix started her farming business in 1995 to be able to generate income and assist her husband in supporting their large family. In her business she plants tomatoes and vegetables which she later sells in the nearby market.

With her dream of excelling in life, Janetrix also wishes for a better future for her children that will only be guaranteed in education. She would like a loan of Ksh 10,000 to lease another farm and expand her business.

loans.use: To lease an extra farm to expand her business

loans.name: Kono Lorry Park Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Kono Lorry Park' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva Lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the very first time. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality, attract more customers, make more sales, and consequently improving on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Abu Bakarr K.. Abu Bakarr has been selling shoes, clothes, vests, bras, etc. for many years now. With his share of this loan, he will invest it into his business by purchasing the above-mentioned items in wholesale. Abu Bakarr is 35; he was born in Magburaka, he is married to a businesswoman, and they have 5 children. Four of his children are in primary school and 1 is still not of school-going age. 


(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer Abdul Karim Conteh handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy shoes, clothes, vests, bras, etc. for resale

loans.name: Rafael Arcángel

texts.es: Rafael Arcángel B. de 36 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y junto a sus dos hijas menores de edad, las cuales son estudiantes de la escuela  nacional del lugar. Rafael se dedica a la venta de bicicletas, y así mismo a la reparación de estas, debido a que posee mucha experiencia en la reparación de estas, cuenta con muchos clientes, así mismo cuenta con la facilidad de estar ubicado en calle principal, lo cual le permite ser visualizado por casi todas las personas que van de paso. Rafael solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar el número de bicicletas que tiene a la venta, así mismo comprar más repuestos y todo lo necesario para repararlas. Para Rafael es de mucha importancia poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que es gracias a este como el puede contar con el dinero necesario para poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael Arcángel B., 36, lives in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad department, with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two, minor daughters, who are students in the local public school. Rafael sells and repairs bicycles; he has a lot of experience in bicycle repair and has a lot of customers. He also has the advantage of being located on the main street which makes it possible for him to be seen by almost all the people who pass by there. Rafael is asking for funds to increase his bicycle stock as well as to buy replacement parts and supplies needed for bicycle repair. For Rafael, it is very important to improve his business' condition because it is thanks to it that he can have the funds necessary to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycles and bicycle replacement parts.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy G. lives in the town of Brgy Sagasa, Ma-ao, Bago City.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a sari-sari store selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Nancy has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2001, Nancy joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from NWTF. Nancy is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be her 17th loan from NWTF. Nancy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her two children still in school.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz L. is making sure that she can meet her family's daily needs. Married to Buenvenido L., a farmer, they have five children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time.

Beatriz has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues and has used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store business. To ensure the success of her business, Beatriz would like to apply for a PHP 19,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries and other goods needed to replenish her stock. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education until they are able to successfully provide for themselves.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other items needed to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Adolé

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits alimentaires.pour gagner plus de client, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante.son commerce grandit tous les jours, afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus élevée, elle doit augmenter son stock, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 4 sacs de sucre, 12 bidons d’huile et divers.
texts.en:
This lady is married and mother to one child. She has an income-generating activity selling food products. In order to gain more customers she carries out her activity on a door-to-door basis, and her business is growing day by day. In order to satisfy her ever increasing clientele she needs to increase her stock. She is thus requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy four sacks of sugar, 12 containers of oil and other diverse products.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of sugar, containers of oil and other diverse food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: raise poultry

loans.name: Ndeye Anta

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Anta S.  est une femme de 52 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Cite Ndiobene dans la localité de Baye laye dans la banlieue de Guediawaye. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis janvier 2010 et n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit  au sein de l’institution. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active depuis 14 ans dans le secteur du commerce de  bijoux en plaque (chaine, colliers) et de chaussures. 
Madame S. sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat de marchandises qu’elle commercialise. Les revenus de son mari ne permettant pas de satisfaire l’intégralité  des besoins de la famille c’est la raison pour laquelle elle souhaite avec son financement renforcer son activité et par conséquent  augmenter ses revenus dans le but d’être plus autonome c'est-à-dire avoir la capacité de prendre en charge certains de ses besoins personnels ainsi que  ceux de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Anta S., 52, lives in the Cite Ndiobene district of Baye Laye on the outskirts of Guediawaye. She has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since January 2010 and has not yet received a loan from the institution. She is married and the mother of five children. For 14 years, she has been working selling costume jewelry (chains, necklaces) and shoes. Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy more of the merchandise she sells. The income of her husband is not sufficient to cover all the needs of their family, so she wants to bolster her little business and thus increase her earnings in order to be more independent, that is, to be able to cover some of her own and her children's expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four people who live in Lekh Pir village in Kandal province. All members have selected Mr. Vanna C. as the group leader. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes, in order  to improve their businesses in the future. Mr. Vanna C. was born in 1966. He is a motorbike taxi driver who earns money to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Simorn Thouch, is a vegetable seller at a local market where she can also earn some money to support her family. Since his wife’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve this business, Mr. Vanna C. is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell. He is a father of four children, one of whom is a chef, while another one is attending a local public school, and the others are helping his wife sell vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita S. is from the village of Daanglungsod, Katipunan. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Esterlita owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling mango shake in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is a hard-working entrepreneur determined to improve her family's standard of living. She joined Kiva partner ASHI in 2005 to gain access to loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams. The first few loans she received enabled her to support the family’s fish-selling business and sewing business. The profit from these businesses has been the main source of family income. She is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much larger amount of 27,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell and to support the sewing business. The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures and support her dream that her children will complete college degrees and find good jobs. Reina hopes to maintain long-term sustainable businesses. During the course of her membership in ASHI, she has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s business.  

Her future goal is to purchase vehicles for her husband and expand the territory of their fish-selling business to other surrounding neighborhoods. By owning her own transportation, Reina will save time and money. With her hard work, focus, and determination, Reina is hopeful that her businesses will continue to be more productive and improve the overall standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell and to support the maintenance of her sewing business.

loans.name: Bendiya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENDIYA 3 sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, en moyenne 3  enfants et  qui  vivent dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées  sont :, l’arachide, le riz et le pois sucré avec  MAMA C., la présidente du groupe.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 2 ,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village, au marché de du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.500 FCFA par campagne, qui servira à payer son prêt et  aider son mari à subvenir à certains besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENDIYA 3 are married women with an average age of 35. They each have 3 children on average and live in polygamous families in Moosibougou, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Sikasso Region of southern Mali. They collaborate with the Microfinance insitution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during winter. This is their second loan with the institution, with the first being duly repaid. The crops in which they invest are: peanuts, rice and pois sucre nuts. Mama C. is the president of the group. WIth her loan, she intends to buy agricultural products and equipment to cultivate 2.5 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a mixed male and female clientele in the village and at the markets in Dallen and Loulouni. She hopes to make an average profit of 95 500 FCFA each season, which will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband provide for the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et petits matériels agricoles.

loans.name: Ma. Eliz

texts.en:
Ma. Eliz C. is from the village of Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Ma. Eliz is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Ma. Eliz owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products like shampoo, toothpaste and more in the local community. Ma. Eliz has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Eliz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Eliz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ma. Eliz is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ma. Eliz from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita S. is from the village of Old Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Esterlita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a business providing party services to local community members. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es: Rosalbina tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Bernardo de 48 años y sus 2 hijos menores Kevin de 16 y Ketty de 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Rosalbina tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras. Junto al mayor de sus hijos trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, sembrando papa y arveja, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar y ver como sus plantas van creciendo, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una social muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosalbina is 42. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Bernardo, age 48, and their 2 young children, Kevin, 16, and Ketty, 13, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. The arduous days of work that Rosalbina passes on her small farm have served to improve her harvests and make her lands more productive. She works with her oldest child, starting very early in the morning, sowing potatoes and peas. She later brings these products to sell in the wholesale market in Tarma city. Her favourite part of her job is cultivating, and seeing how her plants grow. She has been doing this work for 27 years and she finds the greatest challenge to be keeping her fields safe from insect plagues. With time, she hopes to buy more land and thus expand her production. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She was very punctual with the payment of her quotas in her first loan, and she hopes to be so again. In her community bank she is a very happy member, which is why she is very well-liked by the rest of her peers. With the 1500 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz;  La socia tiene  56 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella compra y vende ropa, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo. La socia es independiente en cuanto a su trabajo el viaja a traer novedades a la ciudad de Lima y dependiendo l época ofrece las prendas que trae. La socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer un poco de ropa interior.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MACHUPICCHU”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is Liz. She is 56 years old and single mother of 3 children. She works as a retailer who buys and sells clothes. She also sells beauty via catalogue. The member works independently. She travels to bring new products from the city of Lima and offers the clothes she sells according to the season. She is asking for the loan to travel and bring a little bit of underwear. 

The member is grateful for and values the loan made to her in this way and she is also committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to travel and bring back a little bit of underwear to sell.

loans.name: Sidratu  D

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Sidratu. She is married and has three children who are 22, 17, and 15 years old. She has one additional dependent, a relative who lives with her. In 2007, Sidratu established her beverage business, selling soft drinks, rum, gin and water. She began her business because she realized that her salary was not enough to provide for her children. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,285,000 SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy more drinks for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 205,600 SLL. In the future, Sidratu plans to expand her business to a bar and restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Pablo Cruz

texts.es: Pablo tiene 76 años. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecido con los financiamientos. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de carpintería es una persona muy responsable pues ha sido un buen cliente. El dio inicio hace más de 45 años, el tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes pedidos y reparaciones. El trabaja todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, ya que es muy importante para el salir adelante. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de madera, maque, junco entre otras cosas. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Paul is 76 years old. He has been working with field partner Fundación for a long time and is very grateful for the funding they provide. He works as a carpenter. He is a very responsible person and has been a good client to Fundación. He has been working for 45 years and he has a wide variety of customers who ask for different orders and repairs. He works every day from 8 am to 9 pm, as it is very important for him to succeed. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase wood, lacquer, rattan, among other things. He dreams of improving his home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman. She is 40 years old and a mother of four children. She stays in the Mutomo area in Kibwezi. She sells her wares by hawking from door to door and from shop to shop and also in marketplaces. Her goods include body oils, soaps and tea leaves. This is her primary business, which she has been doing for six years now. 

She got to know about KADET through a KADET staff member. She has previously borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to increase her stock so that she can get better returns.

loans.use: Asha plans to buy body oil, bathing soap and other products

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells desserts, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed as a local primary school teacher, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase pigs and chickens to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pigs and chickens to raise for sale.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo “CRECER” esta conformado por 11 miembros, mercedes es L. presidenta del grupo elL. es una mujer muy trabajadora durante mucho tiempo solo se dedico a su casa pero debido a su separación tuvo que encontrar L. manera D. ganarse L. vida  ya que tenia 03 hijos que mantener ellos fueron su inspiración para salir adelante elL. recordó que cuando trabajaba como enfermera siempre le ofrecían productos  diversos y que mucha gente los consumía es así que perdiendo el miedo elL. empezó hacer lo mismo  entre sus amigas y familiares quienes le empezaron a comprar también incursiono vendiendo diversos productos por campañas en época escolar ofrece uniformes,zapatos,medias etc. Ahora esta abocada en L. campaña naviD.ña  su préstamo lo usara para comprar juguetes tiene muchos pedidos D. sus clientas gracias a su trabajo pueD. cubrir los gastos esenciales D. su familia además D. sentirse bien por que trabajando ha encontrado estabilidad emocional para el futuro quiere acondicionar el garaje D. su casa para poner una librería bazar ese es un sueño que desea alcanzar muy pronto,  sabe que lo podrá lograr por que cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos.

* Mercedes es L. 5ta parada viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The 'Crecer' group has 11 members.  Mercedes is the group's president.  She is a very hard-working woman.  For a long time she has looked after her household alone.  When she separated she had to find a way of making a living since she had 3 children to support.  They were her inspiration to get ahead.  She remembers that when she used to work as a nurse people were always offering her different products and many people bought them.  So, conquering her fear, Mercedes began to do the same with her friends and family members who began to buy from her.  She started selling different products according to the season.  During the back-to-school season she would offer uniforms, shoes, tights, etc.  Now the Christmas season is here her loan will be used to buy toys.

Mercedes has a lot of orders from her customers and, thanks to her work, she can cover her family's main expenses.  She also feels good about herself because by working she has found emotional stability.  In the future, she would like to adapt the garage at her house so that she can set up a book store / stationery store.  This is a dream that she would like to fulfil very soon.  She knows that she can achieve her goal because she has the support of her children.

Mercedes is the person in the picture wearing a black top.

loans.use: To buy toys

loans.name: Crucerito Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA CRUCERITO. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA 3 VEZ QUE SOLICITA UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN. JUANA G. A. ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO. TIENE 32 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3 DE SECUNDARIA ES CASADA  TIENE  2 HIJOS  1 MUJER Y 1 VARON. ELLA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO,VENDE FANTASIA NEGOCIO QUE INICIO HACE 3 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA DIFERENTES COSAS COMO: COMPRA DE FANTASIA, PAPELERIA Y COLCHAS. TAMBIEN CONFECCIONA VESTIDOS TIPICOS DE LA  REGION SUS CLIENTES SON DE LA MISMA LOCALIDAD Y VECINOS. SUS VESTIDOS LOS VENDE A LAS DIFERENTES ESCUELAS PORQUE ESTOS LOS UTILIZAN CUANDO REALIZAN BAILABLES FOLCLORICOS. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE FELIZ Y COMPROMETIDA PORQUE CUENTA CON UN CAPITAL PARA PODER INVERTIRLO EN SU NEGOCIO Y DE ALLI PODER OBTENER ALGUN INGRESO EXTRA PARA SOLVENTAR LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA PRINCIPALMENTE LA DE SUS HIJOS PORQUE QUIERE LO MEJOR PARA ELLOS, DESEA QUE ESTUDIEN Y TERMINEN UNA CARRERA PARA QUE TENGAN UN FUTURO PROSPERO.EL EXITO DE SU NEGOCIO ES TENER TODO BIEN SURTIDO PARA QUE CUANDO SUS CLIENTES SOLICITEN ALGUNA COSA LO TENGA A TIEMPO Y BUEN PRECIO.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Crucerito' and is located in the State of Mexico.  The group has 9 members and this is the third time that they have requested a loan from Credicomun.

Juana G. A. is the group's treasurer.  She is 32 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is married and has two children: one girl and one boy.

Juana's business is selling imitation jewelry.  She started her business 3 years ago and is requesting this loan for different things such as buying imitation jewelry, stationery and bedspreads. 

Juana also makes traditional, regional dresses.  Her customers are people who live in the same town and her neighbors.  Juana sells her dresses to different schools who use them when they do folk dancing.  As she requests this loan she is feeling happy and committed because she has capital to invest in her business and she can therefore make extra income to cover her family's expenses, particularly those of her children because she wants the best for them.  Juana would like her children to study and continue on to university so that they can have a prosperous future.  The success of Juana's business lies in having everything well stocked so that when her customers ask for something she has it on time and at a good price.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell in her business

loans.name: Jinna Lou

texts.en:
Jinna Lou M. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 20 years old. Jinna Lou is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Jinna Lou owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish like sardines and mackerel in the local community. Jinna Lou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jinna Lou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinna Lou is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like salmon and mackerel. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jinna Lou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like salmon and mackerel

loans.name: Samelita

texts.en:
Samelita C. is a 46-year-old married who supports her family by operating a food vending and a general store business. She lives in Prk. Manghilao, Brgy. Masaba, Danao City, Cebu. 

Samelita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 11,000 PHP. 

Samelita is now borrowing 21,000 PHP to fund her business operations. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Samelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene dos hijos.  Raquel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene un galpón en su domicilio donde aproximadamente tiene 500 cuyes. Ella vende la carne de los cuyes porque es muy suave y por supuesto que rico en proteínas. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Raquel en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y sueño es construir dos o tres galpones.   

Raquel pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Raquel lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. She raises and sells small animals, such as guinea pigs. Raquel has a pen in her home where she keeps approximately 500 guinea pigs. She sells the guinea pig meat because it is very tender and rich in protein. Raquel has been in this business for six years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to acquire more guinea pigs. Her wish is to build two or three more pens.

Raquel belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Acquire more guinea pigs

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is a 44-year-old separated woman who supports her family by operating a piggery and a food processing business. She lives in EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. Emelie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emelie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 50,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 50,000 to use as additional funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future and to hire other people for her business and provide income for them. Emelie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is an economist but has been managing a car repair business since 2009. He rents a large area which houses a car wash, a place to change oil, and a repair shop.  Samvel lives with his wife, who also helps with the business, and their two school-aged children. He has applied for this loan to pay for repair equipment.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to repair cars.

loans.name: Liene

texts.en:
Liene D., age 21, earns a living by buying and selling such items as canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, toothpaste, and biscuits from her sari-sari (general store) business. Liene has been engaged in her business for over a year now and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three small children and live in the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. 
 
Earlier this year, Liene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Liene is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods to offer for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods to offer for sale

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a hard-working businessman who sells vehicle spare parts.  He was previously farming before he went into this business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has benefited financially.  He previously serviced a loan which he used to boost his business.  He hopes to import spare parts in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy alternators and starters.

loans.use: To buy alternators and starters.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Conchita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Conchita is 56 years old and has one child who is in school.

Conchita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. Conchita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mirembe Nyenje Womens Group

texts.en:
Jane N. is 45 years old and has been in the fishing business for almost 10 years. She works from Nyenje in Mukono. Jane is a happily married mother of five children who says she was inspired by one of her close friends to try her hand at this business. Before that, she ran a small retail business. 

Jane makes a weekly profit of 100,00 UGX. She will use her loan to purchase better fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 43 años de edad, está casada con German de 39 años y viven en su propia casa, fruto de esa relación concibieron 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarle una mejor prosperidad. Justina, menciona que uno puede llegar lejos trazándose metas, ella desde muy niña quiso dedicarse a la agricultura y comprarse sus propias tierras, con el correr del tiempo acumuló dinero y logró comprarse 04 hectáreas de terreno desde entonces siembra cacao, café y raíces de barbasco. Hoy sus productos los vende a los grandes mayoristas y se siente contenta por la actividad que realiza, además asegura que la hace un bien al medio ambiente, ya que sus productos son netamente orgánicos y esta asesorada por los Ingenieros Agrónomos. En tiempos de cosecha necesariamente tiene que contratar jornaleros para agilizar con las extracciones de los frutos. Normalmente su producto lo vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio competitivo. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola de cacao. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual  desea cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, debido a la transparencia que transmiten los socios. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y obtener frutos de mayor proporción y en un menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Justina, 43, is married to Germán, 39, and they live in their own hose.  They have three children that she wants to provide better prosperity to.  She mentions that one can go far setting goals.  From childhood she’s always wanted to be a farmer and to buy her own land.  In time, she saved up enough money and managed to buy 4 hectares of land.  Since then she’s planted cocoa beans, coffee and “barbasco” (an evergreen bush) roots.  

Today, she sells her products to the big wholesalers and is happy with the work she does.  Besides, she assures us that she benefits the environment because all her products are completely organic and she receives advice from Agronomy Engineers.  During harvest time she needs to hire day laborers to make harvesting the fruit easier.  Normally, she sells her crops to the local crop concentrators at a competitive price.  Her plan for the future is to continue expanding her cocoa bean production.

This is her 6th loan with MFP and she wants to meet all her repayment obligations.  Besides, she feels comfortable in her communal bank because of the transparency with which the members operate.  She will use the requested loan to buy cocoa bean plants to graft in order to obtain more and better production in less time.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 30 years old, married and has 6 months old child. Her husband is a driver. Clementine sells food stuffs which include rice, Irish potatoes,  sugar etc. Clementine needs a loan to buy more food stuffs to make more profits. She has been in this business for one year and  with her business profits and her husband’s savings they have been able buy a house in which they stay. Clemintine hopes to buy a car in the future which will enable her to sell her goods in different places.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 58-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Her husband is a farmer in their community.  She and her husband till their small rice farm to be able to raise income for their family.

With the loan coming from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she could buy fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

In the future, Luzviminda hopes to have a bigger farm and more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Kenn

texts.en: Kenn is married with 1 child. He is 29 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. To earn a living, he has a motorcycle repair business, which he has been running for 5 years.  Each month, he earns approximately PHP 5,000.  Kenn has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more equipment for his motorcycle repair business. He has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for his motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Mahtaroy

texts.ru: Махтарой проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 61 год. Разведена. Имеет двоих детей. Она живет вместе с родителями. У нее высшее образование, она по профессии экономист. В этой области Махтарой проработала 20 лет. На сегодняшний день она занимается растениеводством. В основном сеет пшеницу, рис, кукурузу и выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для повторного посева кукурузы.
texts.en: Mahtaroy lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 61 years old, divorced and has two children.  She lives together with her parents.  She has a secondary education, and is an economist by trade.  Mahtaroy had worked 20 years in that field.  Today, she is involved in agriculture.  She primarily plants wheat, corn and grows vegetables.  She is requesting this loan for a repeat planting of corn.

loans.use: to plant corn again

loans.name: Yawavi Nicole

texts.fr: Femme d’un frigoriste, Yawavi  est une jeune dame de 36ans. Elle achète ses marchandises (produits de beauté)  chez les grossistes qui l’amènent de l’Europe et revend à ses nombreuses clientes dans le quartier HEDZRANAWOE et de façon ambulante. Elle a 02 enfants et a commencé en 2007.
texts.en:
Yawai is a young lady of 36 married to a refrigeration specialist. She purchases her wares (cosmetics) from wholesalers who import from Europe, and resells door-to-door to her numerous clients in the Hedzranamoe district.
She has two children and started in the business in 2007.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam from Madaba, Jordan is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of three.

Mariam is selling home products from a room in her house. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to expand her business and purshase more products.

Mariam is looking to sell her products via installments to increase her sales volume and income.

Her aspiration is to help her children continue their education.

loans.use: to expand her home products business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 27 years old and not married. He has been selling cosmetics for seven months. He earns a monthly income of KES.4,000. This is Ezekiel's second loan which he will use to purchase hair chemicals, hair extensions, braids, shampoos, conditioners etc. 

The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business.He hopes to become a leading cosmetic supplier in the region and to take care of  his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, hair extensions,braids,shampoos,conditioners etc

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda nació en la ciudad de Huancayo y desde hace 5 años que radica en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza todo tipo de actividades comerciales, ella tiene 28 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos brosther de forma ambulatoria en una esquina de un mercado popular de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Nilda requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nilda was born in the city of Huancayo.  She has lived in the city of Cusco for five years and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Nilda is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has two children.  Nilda sells fried chicken as an itinerant street vendor.  She sells on a corner of a popular market in the city of Cusco.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well.

On this occasion, Nilda needs a loan to buy chickens.
