The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Simon Likhola

texts.en:
Simon is a 34-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a pool table business where he rents out pool tables and sells CDs and DVDs. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. 

Simon describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and seasonality. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase one more pool table. His business goal is to find a permanent place for his business and to open a big pool hall within five years.

loans.use: To purchase an additional pool table for his business.

loans.name: Khakim

texts.en: Khakim  is 34 years old, married and makes a living by selling mobile phones and Sim cards. He also helps set up new devices and repair existing ones. He has been in this business for three years and earns about $250 a month. Khakim tries to use modern up-to-date technologies to satisfy his customers' demands and requirements. He is applying for a loan for 800 AZN to buy more Sim cards to sell and to improve his store.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Foube

texts.en:
Foube is a 42-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling beans, sugar and cooking oil in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Foube requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase goods for sale. She will use the extra income for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: El-Shadaï Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EL-SHADAÏ est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Afiavi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Afiavi est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un certain Karim. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leurs charges. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Afiavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Afiavi exerce comme activité depuis six ans, la vente de céréales et de cartes de recharges téléphoniques ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Afiavi vend des boissons. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Afiavi désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Afiavi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EL-SHADAÏ, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The El-Shadaï group is made ​​up of four people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, named Afiavi, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to raise the level of their business activity.

Afiavi is 48 years old and is married to Karim. The couple has three children, all under their care and attending school. The couple lives together with their children, both sharing responsibility for the family's diverse needs.

Afiavi has not attended school. For the past six years her business activity has been to sell grain cereals and phone refill cards, which allows her to support her family without much difficulty. As a side business, Afiavi also sells beverages.

In order to better meet customer requirements, Afiavi wishes to strengthen her product inventory and raise the level of her activities. To do this, Afiavi is requesting (together with the other members of the EL-SHADE group) a third credit loan from ALIDé,

loans.use: Buy grain, beverages and phone card refills

loans.name: Fredelito

texts.en:
Fredelito is an industrious farmer. At the age of 48, he has been in this business for 10 years. This occupation provided by our Lord to him was laborious and difficult, but he was persistent in growing it. He is asking  for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and corn seeds and to pay for people who will work in his corn field. He wants to grow his crops well so that he can reap much in the upcoming harvest season.

Fredelito has five children to support so he needed to work harder to yield enough crops for his family. Hopefully, through his perseverance and patience, he will be able to lift his family from a poor standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seeds and to pay for people who will work in his corn field

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is married and is 24 years old. She resides in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She has one child.

Mary Grace operates a fishing business selling seafood products including crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000.00 operating this business.

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Mary Grace has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Mary Grace wants to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save a monetary reserve for future emergencies

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 54 años D. edad, esta casada.

DesD. hace 14 años Maria se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. tortillas, esta actividad la aprendió D. su mamá.

Ella necesita el préstamo, para comprar una plancha para cocer las tortillas, ya que no tiene y las tortillas las elabora en un comal D. barro, por lo que tiene que comprar leña y con la plancha no tendrá que comprar leña, ya que ella tiene una fuerte demanda D. tortillas. A demás con el préstamo comprara maíz, que es la materia prima para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas. Así Maria dispondrá D. todo lo necesario para elaborar las tortillas y satisfacer la demanda, ya que donD. ella vive hay mucha población a la cual le pueD. vender las tortillas, esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y ahorrar, para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, realizarle mejoras a su casa y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and she is married.

She has been engaging in preparing and selling tortillas for 14 years, and she learned this activity from her mother.

She needs a loan to buy a grill to cook tortillas as she has a strong request for tortillas but she hasn’t got one of her own, and she must prepare her tortillas with a brass griddle she needs to buy firewood for; with a grill she will not have to buy firewood. The loan will also be used to buy maize, the basic ingredient to prepare her delicious tortillas; in this way Maria will have everything she needs to prepare tortillas and satisfy her requests, as where she lives there are many people to whom she can sell her tortillas. This will help her increase her income and save some to improve her family’s standard of living, make improvements to her house and proviD. a good service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a grill to cook tortillas.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Gilda also earns more income from videoke rentals and a general store.

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant. Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Activas se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjuntos, las cuales las ayudan a fomentar su compañerismo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades.
La Señora Silvina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas tiene un comedor donde da de comer a los obreros, es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Comenta que tiene muy buena sazón para las comidas, por lo que logró hacerse de una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, panificados, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que prepara.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Activas" was formed by a number of neighbors who joined together from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  Each member of this group has their own independent business, but the members also have activities that they work on together, which promote their camaraderie.  They are a very united group that is capable of carrying out its joint activities.

Silvina is one of the members of this group.  She has a business selling food.  She has an eatery where she provides food to the workers.  She is a very hardworking woman who has a strong desire to get ahead.  She comments that her food is very tasty, and because of this she has managed to develop a solid customer base.

She requests a loan to buy meat, vegetables, bread products, dairy products and other supplies that she needs in order to make the dishes that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bread products, dairy products and other supplies

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 41 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 3 and 17; all of them go to school. Her husband works as a farmer. With the loan, she will buy more sorghum to make the local beer; she has been in the business for the past 26 years as a farmer but most especially she grows sorghum. She expects to use the profits to pay school fees for the children and to save for the better future of the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 19 year old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan who supports two family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy clothes which she sells so that she can increase her income. She is planning on opening her own shop to sell these clothes. Her aspirations for the future are to own a home and to have her children complete their education to obtain university degrees. Since Yasmeen is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Dufatanye Bategarugori Group

texts.fr:
Olive est membre du groupe DUFATANYE BATEGARUGORI, elle a 25 ans ,elle est mariée et a 3 enfants le plus âgé a 8 ans et le moins âgé a 4 ans. 2 de ses enfants vont à l`école.

Elle sollicite ce crédit pour payer le main d`oeuvre ,et louer le champs à cultiver

Elle n`attend aucune difficulté pour le remboursement. ses stratégies pour la croissance de l`affaire est de chercher le marche des ses produits et utiliser les angrais chimiques

Ses ambitions sont les suivant: avoir son champs à cultiver et Eduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Olive is a member of the Dufatanye Bategarugori group. She is 25 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of four and eight.

She is asking for a loan to pay for labor and to rent fields that she can plant. 

She does not foresee any problems with the repayment of her loan. Her growth strategy for her business is to find the market for her goods and to use  chemical fertilizer.

Her ambitions are as follows: having a field to cultivate and educate her children.

loans.use: pay for labor.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, labora como enfermera en unos de los centros hospitalarios de la Ciudad de León desde hace 19 años, labora en turnos rotativos con 2 días libres a la semana, ella realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Martha, solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de bloques, hierro, arena, cemento y piedrín; dichos materiales fueron utilizados en la construcción de una habitación para su vivienda, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida brindándole una mejor comodidad.

loans.use: Compra de bloques, hierro, arena, cemento y piedrín

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en:
This is a group enterprise proposed by three men and four women from the village of Elinkine on the Casamance river in southern Senegal. Represented by their leader Moustapha M., the group describes their business plan as follows:

“Elinkine is a fishing village located 15 km from the departmental capital and 55 km from Ziguinchor [the capital of the southern Casamance region of Senegal]. Its geographic position makes it an incontrovertible hub because it is the only village that serves as a link between the mainland and the islands. Furthermore, Elinkine is one of the villages with the greatest number of fishermen in the entire country.

In order to take advantage of this niche, which has up until now been neglected simply because the majority of people in the fish market dedicate themselves exclusively to the production and sale of dried fish, the Couguélil group has taken the initiative to invest in this business. We plan to provision the market with fresh fish from our fishing village of Elinkine which is 15 km from the departmental capital and 55 km from Ziguinchor.

Our group hopes to have a loan which would allow it to purchase fish from the fishermen, purchase ice, and rent a car to transport the product to distant places. The enterprise will consist of marketing fresh fish, buying it from the fishermen and going to resell it in the city markets and all over the country.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Elinkine est un village de pêcheur distant de 15 Km de la capitale départementale et de 55Km de Ziguinchor. Sa position géographique lui confère de carrefour incontournable du fait qu’il est le seul village qui sert de relais entre la terre ferme et les îles. Il s y ajoute que Elinkine est l’un des village qui compte le plus grand nombre de pêcheurs dans l’ensemble du pays. Pour exploité ce créneau, qui est jusque là laissé en rade simplement parce que la plus part des exploitants des produits de la pêche se donnent à la transformation et à la vente de poisson sec, le groupement Couguélil à prix l’initiative de s’investir dans cette activité.

Objectifs du Prêt : Le groupement Couguélil à pour objectif : de pouvoir ravitailler le marché en poisson frais a partir de Elinkine village de pêcheur distant de 15 Km de la capitale départementale et de 55Km de Ziguinchor. Le groupement souhaite avoir un préfinancement lui permettant de pouvoir acheté le poisson auprès des pêcheurs, acheté de la glace et louer une voiture pour acheminé le produit vers d’autres horizon.

Activités : L’activité consiste à commercialiser le poisson frais c\'est-à-dire l’acheté auprès des pêcheurs et aller le revendre dans les marchés de la place et partout dans le pays. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fish and ice, renting car for transportation

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a young man of 19. He has completed secondary eduction but with no support to continue at the university level. He is therefore running a general provisions store in a rented shop. He plans to continue his education in the future, however, he is seeking  KIVA assistance to augment his capital and expand the business. This would help him to save enough towards his further education.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 32, she is married and has two children. Her husband is a vender who sells cassettes and discs in the city market. Irene creates clothing-craftwork (jackets, blouses, belts, purses, bracelets) and then embroiders it to sell in the city tourist market. Her goal is to use the loan to buy more fabric and thread in order to make more craft-items and thereby having a stock to sell to larger venders. She belons to the group Laguna Azul (Blue Lake) 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

IRENE TIENE 32 AÑOS, CASADA, DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES COMERCIANTE, VENDE CASETTE Y DISCOS EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD, IRENE SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR ROPA ARTESANAL (MANTAS, BLUSAS, CINTURONES, BOLSAS, PULSERAS) Y LAS BORDA, Y LUEGO LOS VENDE EN EL MERCADO TURISTICO DE LA CIUDAD. SU OBJETIVO CON EL CREDITO ES COMPRAR MAS TELA E HILO PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS PRENDAS Y ASI LOGRAR FORMAR UN ALMACEN PARA VENDERLA A COMERCIANTES MAYORISTAS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 1.

loans.use:
"Craftwork Sales. "
VENTA DE ARTESANIAS

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Description of the Business

Juan started his business 5 years ago. The products he sells are tropical fruits, rice, soft drinks and ornamental plants. Juan serves every client directly from 6am to 9pm every day.

Use of the Loan

Juan needs the loan to invest in the acquisition of fruits from the mountain range, more rice and also material for the changes to the space he uses for his business.

Personal Information

Juan is 57 years old. He has 4 children, the younger one lives with them and he is attending school. His wife works with him in the preparations of meals to sell. Juan uses his front and backyard of his own house as warehouse. He comments that a year ago he suffered an accident where he lost great part of his business. This situation has not managed to stop the work spirit and and desire to overcome that Juan has. He aspires to improve his business and fix his home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Manuel Vargas Ricalde, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Juan inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Los productos que vende son frutas tropicales, arroz, refrescos y plantas para jardín. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Juan necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de frutas de la sierra, más arroz y también materiales para el arreglo del espacio que utiliza su negocio.

Información Personal

Juan tiene 57años .Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales el menor de ellos estudia y vive con ellos. Su esposa trabaja junto a el elaborando almuerzos para la venta. Juan para la exhibición de sus productos ocupa las afueras de su casa y parte del interior como bodega. Comenta que hace un año sufrió un accidente y perdió gran parte de su negocio. Situación que no ha logrado detener el espíritu de trabajo y superación que Juan posee. Aspira mejorar su negocio y arreglar poco a poco su casa.

loans.use: Buy more fruit and fix his little convenience store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth's family is very committed to the daily work she does in their city. Each one in their own way contributes to the work so that it is less tiring and more productive. Every morning, accompanied by her eldest son, she sets out on a tricycle to sell different kinds of fish to the entire community. Riding the tricycle requires much effort, but her son's youth and strength makes travel quicker and stopping unnecessary. Realizing that she could drive if the vehicle was motorized, she has decided to purchase one so that her beloved assistant can invest all the time that he dedicates to helping her to improving his level of education. In order to realize her dream, she is requesting 575 dollars, a loan that she promises to repay in 6 months. Fulfilling this objective will help Elizabeth be able to give her oldest son more time to study as well as be able to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Elizabeth está muy comprometida con el trabajo diario que ella desempeña en su ciudad. Cada uno de ellos de diversas maneras contribuyen para que la labor sea menos pesada y más productiva. Todas las mañanas en compañía de su hijo mayor sale provista de un triciclo a ofrecer pescados de diversas clases a la población entera, si bien es cierto la conducción del vehículo demanda mucho esfuerzo, pero la juventud y fuerza de su hijo hacen que su desplazamiento sea rápido y constante. Habiendo notado que la conducción la podría realizar ella si el vehículo fuera motorizado ha decidido adquirir uno para que su querido ayudante pueda invertir todo ese tiempo que dedica a ayudarle a mejorar su grado de instrucción. Con el deseo de llevar a cabo este anhelo; ella hace una solicitud de 575 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Llevando a cabo este propósito Elizabeth podrá otorgarle más tiempo a su hijo mayor para que pueda estudiar y mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Buying a motorized vehicle would improve the service that Elizabeth provides her customers and community

loans.name: Sahid

texts.en: Sahid E. is a taxi cab driver in the northeasterly town Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 56 years old, married with two children and has been driving a taxi for the last five years. He has already successfully paid back three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit and is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 in order to make some much needed repairs to his cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.name: Nunung

texts.en: Nunung is 33 years old and has a 8 year-old child. She has a small shop which sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She earns about US$25 per day, while her husband, H., is a driver in Jakarta who earns about US$10 per week. She requests a US$125 loan to fill her shop with more inventory and also for her husband's business. Nunung hopes that she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her store with more inventory

loans.name: Oimhol

texts.ru:
Oimhol M. is 45 years old, she has secondary education, is married and has 8 children. Oimhol has been breeding and selling cattle. She has been doing it for the past 6 years and it is her main source of income. She plans to use her loan to buy several calves and food for them for their growth. She will sell them after 40-45 days and buy more calves. She will use her profit to support her family. Her husband and son are helping her with the business.

Oimhol plans to pay off the loan within 12 months

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоева Оимхол, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 8-х детей. Оимхол занимается откормкой и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 6 лет и это основной источник приносящий ей доход. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести несколько молодых бычков, корма для их откорма. Через каждые 40-45 дней она будет продавать их и приобретать молодых бычков. Полученную прибыль от продажи будет использовать для содержание семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж и сын.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Breeding and sales of cattle

loans.name: America

texts.es:
America is a 46-year-old woman who dedicates herself to food sales. In the restaurant that she runs out of her home, she sells chicken, hamburgers, and other types of food at night. Her family is comprised of herself and her husband, who is her credit co-applicant; they do not have dependent children anymore. America has more than six years of experience in this business. She doesn't have a lot of competition in the area since there aren't many people selling food.

The current request will be used for purchasing ingredients for cooking and sale (beef, chicken, rice, potato, and more). The price of these goods varies according to the sales offered by their vendors. This is the third loan America has had with this institution, and she has proven herself to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

America es una señora de 46 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de comidas. En su restaurant que se encuentra en su domicilio vende por las noches pollos, hamburguesas y otros tipos de comidas. Su familia esta compuesta por ella, su esposo que es codeudordel crédito, ya no mantienen a sus hijos ya que ellos son grandes e independientes. America tiene una experiencia en el negocio de las comidas de más de seis años, no tiene mucha competencia ya que por la zona hay pocas ventas de comidas. La presente solicitud será utilizada para la compra de insumos alimenticios para su respectiva elaboración y comercialización (carne, pollo, arroz, papa y otros). Los precios de estos insumos varian de acuerdo la oferta de los proveedores. Esta es la tercera solicitud de America con la institución y demostró ser una cliente muy puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food creation and sale.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He works even harder at it now because he has made his home with his beautiful wife and their lovely children, whom he loves very much. Due to his high level of knowledge, he takes full advantage of his parcels of land and also leaves them fallow sometimes so that the land will grow excellent products for him. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to invest in fertilizers for his crops and to take good care of his parcels.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ALEJANDRO, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la actividad agrícola y ahora aún más debido a que ha conformado su hogar con una bella dama y unos hermosos hijos a quienes ama mucho y se esfuerza a diario.Debido al alto conocimiento que posee tiene que aprovechar al máximo el uso de sus parcelas y hacerlas descansar para que estos le ofrezcan excelentes productos. A razón de este hecho solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cosecha y cuidado de sus chacritas.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: I Gede Suendra

texts.id:
To be able to support family's economical well being, I Gede Suendra has to work to obtain an income, especially now where his children need funds to pay for school expenses. That is why I Gede Suendra works on his brother's rice fields, while he is stationed in an outer island. The land he worked on is about 1 hectare. Because of subak (local rules) which is good in Pangkung Buluh village, now is I Gede Suendra's time to plant rice. As a tenant farmer whose life is very simple, to process a 1 hectare land, I Gede Suendra did not have enough funds. Especially if planted with local seeds, and non maximal maintenance, he is afraid that the results would be very unsatisfactory, and his efforts wasted. That is why I Gede Suendra requested a loan from Dinari Foundation. This loan would be used to buy superior rice seeds, fertilizer, and also insecticides, and to work the fields by rented tractor power, since I Gede Suendra does not own a cow to plow the rice field. He hopes that the upcoming harvest would bring good results, so that his profit would increase. From this profit, I Gede Suendra wished to be able to provide schooling for his children, enough to be able to support his household expenses, so that I Gede Suendra could have a happy family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Untuk bisa menopang perekonomian keluarga I Gede Suendra,harus bekerja agar mendapatkan penghasilan,apalagisekarang anak-anaknya sedang membutuhkan biaya untuk bersekolah.Oleh sebab itu I Gede Suendra menggarap sawah milik Saudaranya yang kebetulan bertugas di luar pulau. Lahan yang digarap sekitar 1 hektar. Karena pengaturan subak yang baik di desa Pangkung Buluh maka sekarang giliran di lokasi I Gede Suendra untuk menanam padi. Sebagai petani penggarap yang hidupnya sangat sederhana ,maka untuk pengolahan tanah 1 hektar I Gede Suendra menjadi kekurangan modal. Apabila ditanami dengan bibit lokal dan pemeliharaan tidak maksimal ,maka nantinya ia kawatir hasil yang diperoleh tidak bagus,sehingga biaya yang dikeluarkan menjadi sia-sia. Oleh sebab itu I Gede Suendra mengajukan pinjaman kepada Yayasan Dinari,pinjaman ini dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit unggul,pupuk dan juga obat-obat vestisida dan penggarapannya pun menggunakan tenaga traktor karena I Gede Suendra tidak mempunyai Sapi untuk membajak disawah. Hal ini diharapkan panen yang akan datang mendapatkan hasil yang bagus,dan keuntungan yang diporolehpun akan meningkat. Dari keuntungan ini I Gede Suendra mempunyai keinginan untuk bisa menyekolahkan anak-anaknya dan juga mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya,sehingga I Gede Suendra memiliki keluarga yang sejahtera.

loans.use:
To buy superior quality rice seeds, insecticide and fertilizer

Membeli bibit padi jenis unggul, anti hama dan pupuk

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Doña Hermelinda is a supportive and enthusiastic woman. For many years, she has dedicated herself to working in different trades, and together with her husband, she chose to make a living by selling hardware items more than a year ago. At first they sold these items out of their home, but afterwards, they decided to sell by traveling to the different markets in their community. All of their effort is concentrated on making their youngest son, who is 17, able to gain admittance to college, which is why they are saving. Her wish is to implement her business and to increase the items that she offers, which is what drove her to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Hermelinda es una mujer solidaria y muy entusiasta, durante muchos años se ha dedicado a laborar en diferentes rubros y junto a su esposo escogió hace más de un año dedicarse a la venta de artículos de ferretería que al inicio los ofertaba desde su casa, pero después decidieron vender de manera ambulante en las ferias de su localidad.Todo su esfuerzo está concentrado en hacer que su hijo menor de 17 años acceda a formarse en un centro de educación superior para lo cual ahora está ahorrando. Su deseo de implementar su negocio e incrementar los artículos que ofrece la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a larger quantity of items

loans.name: Nusret

texts.en: Nusret S. is a 65 year old man who has sold milk and yoghurt to locals since 1990. He is married and has 10 children! It is very hard to raise such a large family and provide for all of their needs. He is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase one milk cow. He lives in the Bilasuvar internally displaced persons settlement. He is currently unemployed but is the main breadwinner for the family. His family is subsisting on an IDP benefit of approximately 70 USD per month.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Salu

texts.en: Salu T., 34, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation/vegetable business. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Salu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Salu is a very energetic mother, owning a four-acre plantation in her village.

loans.use: Purchase purchase pesticides, sting, knives, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single woman with one nine year old child. She became a charcoal seller in 2007. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Ruth now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Maryuri Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maryuri, 23, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has two children, 4 and 5. Her husband works for a company that markets vehicles and used to be the only income-earner for the family. However, Maryuri decided 2 years ago that she would help him with the household expenses so that his burden wouldn't be so great. She started a business selling gold and silver jewelry. She's a hard-working woman, selling at her house and away, offering various pieces which she sells in easy-to-pay installments. The requested loan is for buying silver jewelry so that she can meet the demand coming from her customers. In the future, Maryuri would like to set up a shop and legally establish her business. She also wants to ensure that can provide for her children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Maryuri habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de de 4 y 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa que comercializa vehículos, y anteriormente era el único que se encargaba del sustento del hogar, pero hace 2 años Maryuri decidió apoyarlo para que la carga no fuera tan pesada, se dedica al negocio de las ventas de prendas de oro y plata, Maryuri es una mujer activa, vende en su casa y visita las instituciones para ofrecer sus productos en variadas prendas que las da en cuotas accesibles. La solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en compra de prendas de plata, y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. A futuro es establecer una boutique para formalizar su negocio y obtener más seguridad con las ventas, poder dar estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: Susitina T., 40, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business of taro, yams, and banana farming. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Susitina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband and children help with the plantation.

loans.use: To improve business status and also to help improve her home

loans.name: Ghulam Qubra's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Qubra baji is the wife of K. H. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a school in her neighborhood.

Ghulam Qubra baji’s husband has a animal-selling business. He has been selling animals for the past 10 years. He sells livestock (sheep, goats, and buffalos). Ghulam Qubra baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) to re-sell.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal-selling business. Gulshan baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for her tractor. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy a grinding machine which is used to plane marble floors. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to re-sell

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju D. is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop 8 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. D. took a 6-month training course in tailoring.

Now Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 30,000 loan to buy raw materials for her work. Mrs. D. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Sanjay Kiran D. and he makes traditional idols. She has two daughters. Both of them are studying at the secondary level.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Mr. Lusiimba Herbert is a 40-year-old hard-working businessman. He is married with 3 children, two of whom are in school. He raises poultry and also makes building bricks. In addition, he is a coffee farmer.  Income from his businesses has enabled him to build his residential home in Kansangati. For the expansion of his business, Herbert will use the loan to buy more poultry feed and some vaccines. This will enable him to have a healthy flock of poultry that will boost his income and profits.

loans.use: Buying more poultry feed and some vaccines.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: EDITH ES SOLTERA, TIENE UN HIJO DE 8 AÑOS ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN ANTICRETICO EN LA CIUDAD, EL NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO SOBRE LA AV. PRINCIPAL DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS ATRÁS, TIENE COMPETENCIA EN EL RUBRO PERO POR SER POPULAR EL NEGOCIO EN LA ZONA TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL CREDITO FUE FINANCIADO PARA AMPLIACION DE NEGOCIO DE LICORES EN GRAL. NO TIENE DEUDAS CON OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS, SOLO CON AGROCAPITAL DEMUESTRA UN EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO.

loans.use: AMPLIACION DE NEGOCIO

loans.name: Hum

texts.en:
Mrs. Hum S. was born in 1958, and she lives in Trapaing Thmor village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Nhoem Ngim, is a laborer in the field. Even though they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough of an income to provide a better life for their family.

To improve their standard of living, Mrs. Hum S. decided to request for a loan to buy eight piglets, pig food, and build a piggery to start breeding pigs. She has a child who is a tailor. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets, pig food, and build a piggery to start breeding pigs.

loans.name: Ihomiddin

texts.ru: Таваров Илхомиддин житель города Нурек. Женат имеет одного ребенка. Возраст 28 лет. Занимается торговлей уже 10 лет. Имеет свой собственный магазин , где торгует запчастями  и электроприборами. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Это даст возможность увеличить ассортимент  и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов. Это даст прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ihomiddin T. lives in Nurek. He is 28 years old and is married with one child. He has been working in sales for ten years. He has a store where he sells spare parts and electroc appliances. Ihomiddin would like to apply for a loan that would allow him to increase the assortment of goods he sells and attract new customers. This would increase cash flow and profit. Ihomiddin would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda P. sells clothing at Kotokoraba, which is the heart of the Cape Coast. Matilda has received junior high education, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Matilda has been selling clothing since 2005. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Her loan will be used to purchase additional goods in order to increase the sale of fabrics and other clothing to meet an increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business in order to reinvest and ensure the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods in order to increase the sale of fabrics and other clothing.

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr:
H. Pélagie est née vers 1985 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Pélagie a deux (2) enfants:  l'aîné est scolarisé, le benjamin est un nourrisson. Pélagie vend de poissons depuis cinq (5) ans. Pélagie achète de poissons frais chez son mari et d'autres pêcheurs au bord de la lagune de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; qu'elle revend au grand marché international du Bénin. Pélagie a eu déjà deux crédits de ALIDé qui lui ont permis d'améliorer son niveau de vie. Aujourd'hui, Pélagie a pour projet d'augmenter le niveau de son commerce et d'aider son mari à acheter une nouvelle barque motorisée pour la pêche. C'est pourquoi Pélagie sollicite un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Pélagie H. was born around 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Pélagie has two children; the elder is in school, and the younger is still breast-feeding. Pélagie has been selling fish for 5 years. She buys fresh fish from her husband and other fishermen along the lagune of Cotonou, then sells them at the big international market of Bénin.

Pélagie has already had two loans from ALIDé and they have allowed her to improve her standard of living. Today, Pélagie's goal is to improve the level of her business and help her husband to buy a new motorboat for fishing. This is why Pélagie is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

The significance of AIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigera; its GDP stands at US$ 1,500 per inhabitant. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable people and it is among a group that are soon planning to offer a program of micro health insurance for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 15 baskets of fresh fish

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is 59 years old and married to Panfilo, a fisherman. They are blessed with only one child. The family presently resides at Baybay, Panalsalan, Misamis Occidental.

Gloria is a fish vendor, and at the same time she also has a hog raising business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for food and vitamins for her pigs and also as additional capital for her fish vending. She is a good member and pays her loans promptly. The income derived from her hog raising helps her pay for the expenses of their house renovation.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and as additional capital for her fish vending.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
Bích Vũ Thị (1219060743) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two  school-aged children.  To make a living, Bích owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  Bích has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 4500000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Bích joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Bích has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand her business.  Bích is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Bích plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Munire

texts.ru: Мунире – 36 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Она занимается продажей женской одежды. Она торгует с Торговом Центре «Бадри Мунир» находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Мунира закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Мунира за свой кредит хочет закупть партию летней женской одежды.
texts.en:
Munire is 36 years old, married and a mother of two children. She makes her living selling women's clothing at the shopping center "Badri Munir" in the district "Panchshanbe" of the city Hudzhanda. Also, every Friday she travels to the "Juma-bazar" market and every Sunday to the "Yakshanbe-bazar". Munira purchases the goods in the city of Bishkek in Kyrgyzstan where she travels to once every month. Her husband works as a builder/contractor. Munira wants to use this loan to purchase a batch of summer clothes wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothes for sale

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị, 50, lives in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has three adult children. To making a living, T. raises pigs for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month.

In 2005, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. She used the previous loan to purchase breeding livestock. T. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND that she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her fourth loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Mulira Faith’S Group

texts.en:
Faith is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 45-year-old single mother of four, aged between 30 and 22. Only one of her children goes to school The rest are working because they finished school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is living with four people. Faith takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Faith resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Faith owns a poultry farm and sells in Nalukolongo, one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shopping and does her shopping once a week. She sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week.

Faith sells mainly on a retail basis and her garage functions as her business premises. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for the remaining child, electricity and water bills She has been in this business for the last two years. Besides the poultry business, she also owns a telephone booth.

Faith has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed. Faith is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика Худоерова проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 27 лет. Разведена, имеет 1 ребенка. Малика имеет среднее техническое образование. Она более 5 лет занимается пашивом одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. Кредит просит для закупа сырья, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Malika H. lives in the Gissar region. She is 27 years old. She is divorced and has one child. Malika has a technical secondary education. She has been sewing clothing for more than five years. She does this at home. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials so she can provide quality services.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is a member of the Don Bosco borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children,Her children are aged 17,16,10,07,02 years.

 Sesilina started her own clothing business selling used clothes 10 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 56,000 Tsh.

This is Sesilina first loan from BRAC_Tanzania she requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Sesilina hopes to save more money,get more food for her family, and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Marame

texts.fr: marame N. est societaire de la caisse de yoff depuis mai 2000.depuis plus de dix ans elle exerce l'activite de petit commerce(eau frache glace recharge credit).periodiquement aussi elle effectue des voyages dans la sous region et amene des articles pour femmes quelle vend en les placant pour deux ou trois mois.marame est veuve.elle sollicite un credit de deux cent cinquante mille(250 000)frs pour accroitre son fond de roulement mieux valoriser ses benefices afin de faire face a ses charges familiales.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en: N. Teo is the leader of her lending group in Mubende. She is 35 years old, the single mother of 4 children, and she cares for 3 dependants. Teo is a farmer and does most of her work in Kyanasiki village where she has a farm. Here, she grows Matooke, sweet potatoes and cassava. Her profits pay for her children’s school fees and general well-being. She wants tp buy her own lorry from which she can be able to transport her goods to the big markets at a reasonable cost. Teo needs a loan to help pay her children’s school fees and will use part of her profits to repay back her loan.

loans.use: To pay school fees for all of her children

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 02 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Pichincuta, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para mejorarlos y luego venderlos en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es convertirse en mayorista de venta de ganado.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” Communal Bank, which is located in the central village of Pusuyo in Ilave District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. Gladys lives in the community of Pichincuta and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost 1½ years. Her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling livestock.

Gladys is currently requesting a new loan of 500 soles to buy sheep to raise and later resell at the regional fairs. Her greatest wish is to become a livestock wholesaler. She enjoys her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es: Es un Cliente que se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia, el se dedica a la confección de vestidos para niñas, juntamente con su mamá quien es una artesana de 65 años y en el oficio desde hace 30 años, ella juntamente con sus hijos confeccionan ropa de niñas, vestidos blusas, camisones y todo lo que el cliente solicita, la sra. dirige el taller pese a sufrir una discapacidad en las piernas con mucho entusiasmo y energia, contratando por temporadas mano de obra en los bordados de las prendas especialmente en fin de año donde tiene mayor pedido e incluso envia al exterior sus prendas, el joven Juan Sebastian Curiti es su brazo derecho ya que el costura con agilidad las prendas en las maquinas industriales que manejan, por todo ello es rescatable el labor que realiza ya que tambien se dedica a estudiar en la universidad en sus ratos libres.
texts.en:
Juan Sebastian is in his fourth loan cycle. He works in dressmaking for young girls together with his mother, who is a 65-year-old artisan and has been in the business for the past 30 years. Along with her children, she makes clothing for young girls – dresses, shirts, nightgowns, and anything else that the customer requests. She manages the shop with much enthusiasm and energy, despite suffering from a leg impairment. She hires seasonal help for the embroidery of the garments, especially at the end of the year when she has the most requests and sends her garments abroad. Juan Sebastian Curiti is her right-hand man since he sews the garments in the industrial sewing machines with agility. The work that he does is redeeming because he also studies at the university in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Betty Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Betty tiene 32  años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios  hasta 3ero de secundaria porque por falta de recursos económicos se fue a trabajar de empleada domestica a la ciudad de Lima, es soltera y no tiene hijos, pero tiene una sobrina de 4 años de edad a su cargo quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, atún, galletas, golosinas, leche, etc en la tienda que tiene en su casa. Con su primer crédito  de 200 nuevos soles compró lo andamios para su tienda.
Con este crédito de 200 nuevos soles comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, leche, jugos, etc para surtir su tienda que tiene en su casa y así poder aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias.
Betty sueña con hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Betty, 32, lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the Las Empresarias al Éxito II Communal Bank. She went to school until her third year of high school. Due to the lack of economic resources, she went to work as a domestic employee in the city of Lima. She is single, and she does not have children. But, she is raising her four year old niece who is economically dependent upon her. She sells food like rice, sugar, tuna, crackers, sweets, and milk in the store that she has in her house. With her first loan for 200 PEN she bought scaffolding for her store. With this loan for 200 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, milk, and juice, etc. to stock the store she has in her house. This way she will be able to increase her sales and her earnings. Betty dreams of making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, milk, and juice, etc.

loans.name: Ekrema

texts.en: Ekrema is a 24-year-old, single young man living with his parents in Ramallah city of Palestine. He has a small computer repair shop. Ekrema is requesting a loan of $2,500 to buy computer parts in order to develop his work and, therefore, his income. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy computer parts

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Marcos Antonio F. Téllez, el tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, es el primer créditos que Trabajado con CEPRODEL, este lo ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, zinc, cemento etc. para la construcción de la cocina en la  vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Marcos Antonio F. Téllez is raising three children. Two of them are school age. He is married. The first time he worked with Ceprodel he used the loan to improve the condition of his house. The loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials like iron, zinc, and cement to build a kitchen in the house where he lives. This is to give his family a better living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like cement, zinc, and iron

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora  ANA MARIA O. R. tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 5to de secundaria, está separada y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en la bodega que tiene en su casa. Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para la compra de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio para lo cual esta ahorrando.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Maria is 38 years old and lives in the Porvenir district in the Trujillo province in the Libertand area of Peru and is part of the Caridad II communal bank. She has a high school education, is separated and has one 5 year old son who depends on her. She sells food products out of her home-based store. This is her first loan of 300PEN ($125 US) which she will use to invest mostly in soft drinks and beer for resale. She is saving up and hopes to be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She runs a small business selling plastic dishware in “Yubileinyi,” one of the local markets. Valentina sells a variety of assorted merchandise and has her own loyal clientele. She has been working in this market niche for 7 years. Currently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Valentina is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to expand her business and open additional vending locations in the future. Valentina likes working with disposable items and believes this business will continue bringing her stable income.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Damou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  Damou sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec en moyenne 42 ans  et 5 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koko, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt. Les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font comme activités la vente  des condiments, de Sounbala, la restauration etc.  
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 paquets de condiments, 150kg de graines de néré pour faire le Sounbala, 50kg de graines d’haricots, 50kg de riz, 100kg d’atiécké, 10 litres d’huile (pour la restauration). Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché  de Kadiolo, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  aménager leur point de vente.
texts.en:
The five members of the Damou group are essentially married women 42 years old on average, with an average of five children. Most live in polygamous families in Koko - one of Kadiolo’s neighbourhoods - in the third administrative region of Mali. They cooperate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customer’s needs, and have been granted three loans to date. The preceding loans were fully reimbursed. Their activities are selling food condiments (among which Sounbala), catering, etc. With their new loan, they want to buy: • three packages of condiments • 150 kilos of néré seeds to make Sounbala • 50 kilos of bean seeds • 50 kilos of rice • 100 kilos of atiécké (manioc-based foodstuff) • 10 litres of oil (for catering) They get their supplies from the market in Kadiolo and from nearby villages. They sell either in the Kadiolo market, as itinerant retailers, or from their home. They are paid directly or quite often on credit, from a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach individual monthly earnings of 25,500 FCFA on average, part of which will be used for savings and family expenses, and the remainder reinvested in the business activities. They would like to have more working capital to better satisfy their customers and properly set up their sales outlet.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Anna Amagoye

texts.en:
Anna Amagoye E. is a tailor in Migori. She is married to Jotham Kidima who is a teacher and they have five children.

Anna has been in the tailoring business for the past 13 years and has thus created a big clientele due to the fact that she normally looks out for the latest designs and tries them out. The niche she has created makes it possible to beat out her competitors.

Anna is looking for a lender through Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more fabric to add to her stock and to buy another sewing machine. She is a well-known tailor in the village as she gets orders for school uniforms from the local schools in her area. There is also a high demand for more different fabrics/materials right now. She has a good credit history with Kadet Ltd as she has repaid her previous loans well.

She hopes to use the money to buy school uniform materials since they are in high demand as schools open this month.

loans.use: Buy materials/fabric to add to her stock

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: JamA. is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and 2 brothers. He cooperates with his father and brothers towards the family’s income. He has been working as an electrician for the past 4 years. During those 4 years, he has built up his experience and he has become able to take on more projects and electricity maintenance work. Today, JamA. is asking to borrow $1,200 to renovate his shop and to buy new electric tools needed to meet the need of the market and to develop his work.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to buy new electricity tools

loans.name: Gustavo Asad

texts.es: Gustavo Asad R. R. de 67 años de edad reside en Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa de 66 años de edad, la cual se dedica a trabajar como empleada domestica y junto a sus dos nietos de 20 y 17 años de edad, los cuales dependen por completo de Gustavo y que se dedican a estudiar. Gustavo se dedica a la venta de medicinas, las cuales comercializa desde su automóvil, ofreciéndolas de forma ambulante por las calles de Soyapango. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a este tipo de trabajos, obteniendo muchos clientes fijos los cuales esperan a que el pase por sus hogares ofreciéndoles su producto. Gustavo solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar la cantidad de medicinas, esto con el fin de poder abarcar nuevos sectores, con el fin de contar con más clientela y así obtener más ganancias. Gustavo es un señor que cuenta con muy buenas referencias, ya que tanto él como su esposa son personas muy trabajadoras quienes se han esforzado por años por tener una vida digna en la cual cuenten con todo lo necesario para vivir de una forma adecuada.
texts.en:
Gustavo Asad R. R. is 67 years old and lives in Ciudad Delgado in the department of San Salvador. He lives with his 66-year-old wife, who makes a living working as a domestic servant, and their two grandchildren, who are 20 and 17 years old respectively and are in school. Their grandchildren are completely dependent on Gustavo. Gustavo makes a living selling medicines from his car on the streets of Soyapango. He has made a living doing this type of work for 20 years now, and in that time he has acquired many loyal customers who wait for him whenever he passes by their homes offering his products. Gustavo is requesting a loan so that he can increase the amount of medicines that he has on hand, which would allow him to cover new sectors of the market and have more customers, and thus increase his earnings. Gustavo is a man who has very good references, since both he and his wife are very hard workers who have tried for years to have a decent life in which they would have everything they needed to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing medicines

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel B. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Liezel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Liezel owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Liezel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Liezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Liezel is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a forty-seven-year-old woman who lives in Saida, which is in southern Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Lina has owned a grocery store since 2002. She carries all types of canned food, pasta, home cleaning products, beverages, and more. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Lina has been a microcredit client for seven years, and she has always paid on time. 
Lina is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients; she also has a good reputation. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of merchandise. She decided to begin her business to supplement her husband’s income and because she always wanted to open a shop for herself. In the future, she plans to expand her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Narankhuu

texts.en:
Narankhuu is 42 years old, is married, and is the father of two daughters. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a ger. His two daughters, Enkhjargal and Altanshagai, attend a local secondary school. His wife works as a cleaner in a company.

From 2002 to 2008, Narankhuu operated with his wife a products-trading business at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. In 2008, he started his taxi business.

Narankhuu’s family is the most important thing for him and he says, “As a father, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children until they grow up.”

Narankhuu requests a loan to buy a computer and a television for his daughters.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a television for his daughters

loans.name: Amone

texts.en:
Amone C. was born in Chibuto, Gaza province, Mozambique. He is 46 years old. He studied until 4th grade but had to stop because he did not have anyone to support him. He is a widower. He has five children, aged 21, 19, 14, 14 and 10. The ones aged 14 are twins. All of them go to school and he supports them. Additionally, he also sends money to his father in Chibuto to help with health, energy and water costs. 

He left his hometown in 1980 on his own to pursue better life conditions. He has been a guard in "Casa do Gaiato" for five years. "Casa do Gaiato" is a social-services center in the Boane area, where loads of cooperation projects take place. He works eight hours per day and learned the job on the spot. He makes only 3,600 meticais a month and he still manages to feed all his family and save some money.

He is asking for a loan to buy blocks, stone, cement, sand and iron for the ongoing construction in his home. He dreams of having a decent house for his family, big enough so they do not have to live cramped. He plans on working hard and asking for subsequent loans until he achieves it.

loans.use: Blocks, stone, cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married. He is a bee farmer from Kherson. He breeds bees and sells honey and his apiculture has been bringing him a stable income for about seventeen years. He is a real professional: within the last few years he has invested over 15,200 Grivnyas in his business. His net profit amounts to 7,500 Grivnyas a month in high season.

Victor is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to purchase bee families and beehives, as well as to cover expenses related to the migratory beekeeping business he runs.

Victor is a typical entrepreneur who desires to see his business grow and expand further. He is in the process of constructing a new private house for his family which is why he is hoping to use a portion of the generated income as an investment in this project.

loans.use: To purchase bee families and hives

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
38-year-old Rosalyn B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married to Arnel and they have two children aged 17 and 18.

Rosalyn owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of field where she plants and harvests rice crops to sell. She also grows hogs for fattening. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years now and hopes that someday she will succeed in all her ventures.

Rosalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and also feed for her hogs. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and also feed for her hogs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda A.'s main source of income comes from selling fresh and dried fish in her community. She is 62 years old, married and has 13 grown-up children. She is from the village of Calamba. Erlinda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be her ninth loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirna O. tiene su negocio de venta de productos de plástico ubicado en el mercado la estación, tiene su negocio bien establecido y realiza sus compras 2 veces por semana en Managua, donde compra su producto al por mayor y así obtiene mayores ingresos.

Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de bolsas plásticas, vasos, cucharas, platos desechables, entre otros. Cabe mencionar que la Señora O. M., está agradecida con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL, porque anteriormente ha hecho uso de los créditos y han incrementado su capital de trabajo y mejorado su nivel de vida.

Hoy, una vez más confía que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorará su condición familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirna María O. M. has a well-established business at the station market. She travels twice a week to Managua to buy her inventory in bulk so that she can generate more income. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy plastic bags, glasses, spoons, disposable plates, and other products. It should be mentioned that Sra. Mirna is grateful for the loans that CEPRODEL has provided because they have increased her operating capital and improved her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic bags, glasses, spoons, disposable plates, and other products

loans.name: Sonnie Kamara Group

texts.en:
Sonnie K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United'.  Sonnie is 39 years old, married, and has three children who range from 7 to 20 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. She cares for one sibling. 

For 12 years, she has been selling a locally produced milk called 'sour milk' in Duport Road Community, Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 51,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more milk.


She describes herself as a serious- minded woman. Her dream is to expand her business and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Grace P. is inset because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more milk

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson wants a loan to enable him to buy a car for his transport business. He is a 35-year-old man who is married with three children.

Wilson started with a motorcycle transport business from which he saved money to buy a car for the business. With the loan, he will be able to have another car for his transport business.

Wilson lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and owns the house in which he lives. He dreams of acquiring more land to build a commercial building.

loans.use: To buy another car for his transport business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita B. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old and is married with three adult children. Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Teresita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Limachi

texts.es: La Sra. Salome Vive en la ciudad  La Paz, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, la casa donde vive es propia, ella y su esposo se esforzaron mucho para adquirir su casita , la cliente es casada con el señor Miguel Ángel de ocupación transportista. Doña salome se dedica a la venta de flores en el cementerio, cuenta con un puesto propio, lleva con esta actividad mas de 10 años. El crédito será destinado para la compra flores por temporada además de aprovechar la oferta de uno de sus proveedores, es una persona trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Salome lives in the city of La Paz, in the Villa Nuevo Potosi district. The house where she resides is her own. She and her husband worked very hard to acquire their little house. She is married and she lives with Mr. Miguel Angel, a taxi driver. Salome sells flowers in the cemetery from a stand that is her own. She has had this business for more than 10 years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of flowers for this season and to take advantage of a special offer made by one of the growers.
