She is a hard working person and she is very grateful for the support she receives in the form of a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flowers for the season.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina;   ella tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda; y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica ahora que esta jubilada la atención a turistas en su casa, ella poco a poco con los dineros que recibe de la asociación de bancos comunales ha trabajado implementando su casa y acomodando para turistas, ella mejoro sus baños y siempre invierte en su casa para seguir recibiendo en forma familiar a turistas que vienen de todo el mundo. La socia solicita en esta oportunidad el dinero para invertir en la azotea de su vivienda, ella quiere mejorar el espacio que tiene en el último piso para que los turistas puedan gozar de una buena vista y descansar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en mejorar su azotea.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank, located in San Sebastian district, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Luz is 65 years old, a widow, and has 3 children.  Now that she is retired, she devotes her attention to tourists who stay in her house.  Little by little, with the money she receives from the association of communal banks, she has worked to improve her house to accommodate more tourists.  Luz upgraded the bathrooms and always invests in her house in order to continue receiving, in family style, tourists from all over the world.

On this occasion, Luz requests the money to invest in improving the terrace on the roof of her house.  She wants to improve the space on the top floor and the roof so that tourists can enjoy the good view and relax.  Luz appreciates and values the loan offered by this means and at the same time, she promises to comply with the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO IMPROVE THE ROOF AREA OF HER HOUSE

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme de 22 ans, célibataire et très dynamique. Elle a appris le métier de la coiffure. Elle  a ouvert on atelier de coiffure qu’elle a appelé «  JESUS T’AIME ». Elle a 3 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce. Elle a besoin de matériel de coiffure  pour exercer correctement son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite de va lui permettre d’acheter 2 séchoirs, 1 porte rouleau, 1  carton de shampoing et basalm.
texts.en: Akou is a 22-year old woman who is single and very dynamic. She trained as a hairdresser and has opened a hairdressing salon, which she has named "Jesus t'aime". She has three years' experience in this business. She needs hairdressing equipment to carry out her business properly. She gets her supplies in Lomé. The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy two hairdryers, one hair-curler holder, and one carton of shampoos and balsam.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryers, hair-curler holder, shampoos and other items

loans.name: Cisne Azul Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Cisne Azul. Se encuentra ubicado en el Estado D. PuebL.. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Georgina Elena L. es L. presidente del grupo. Tiene 44 años, estudió hasta el 6to año  D. primaria, se dedica a L. venta D. Durazno y Chiles Secos.  ElL. se dedica a cultivar el durazno, chiles secos  y venD. en diferentes poblaciones que inició hace 20 años. Solicita el préstamo para compra D. fertilizantes. Sus clientes son el público en general.  Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas D. sobresalir.   Quiere este crédito para L. compra D. fertilizantes ya que debe D. tener en buen estado sus árboles D. durazno. También espera con este préstamo obtener mejores ganancias y así obtener más clientes para poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Cisne Azul' (Blue Swan).  It is located in the state of PuebL..  The group has 9 members.  Georgina Elena L. is the group's president.  She is 44 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She works selling peaches and dried chilis.  She grows the peaches and chilis and sells them in different towns.  She began this business 20 years ago.

She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers.  Her customers are the general public.  As she requests this loan she is feeling very enthusiastic and has a great desire to succeed.  She would like this loan to buy fertilizers since she must have her peach trees in good condition.  She would also like to use this loan to obtain more customers and thereby make better profits so that she can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
Vendeuse des produits divers, comme les ustensiles de cuisine, habits, chaussures, sandales , les produits cosmétiques et alimentaire.Ce prêt a été bénéfique pour elle,ces recettes se sont accrus cela  lui a permit de rembourser sans problème et d'épargner
Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 5ans, ses ventes journalières  ont augmentées de 15000f à 25000f .

Avec le nouveau  prêt ,elle pense continuer dans le même  élan pour aller de l’avant en  renforçant  son activité en effectuant des voyages afin d’aller acheter a Kinshasa, pointe Noire,elle compte aussi élargir en ouvrant  son restaurant
Orpheline et célibataire elle s’occupe de ses deux sœurs en les soutenant dans leurs études ainsi que de son fils tout en améliorant leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Marthe M. is a seller of various products like cooking utensils, garments, shoes, sandals, cosmetics, and basic foodstuffs.  This loan will be beneficial to her.  Her earnings will accrue and it will allow her to reimburse her payments without issue and continue to save.  She has been running her business for five years.  Her daily sales have increased from 15,000f to 25,000f.

With this new loan, she intends to continue in the same manner in order to strengthen her business and make trips to Kinshasa and Pointe Noire to purchase goods.  She also intends to expand her business by opening a restaurant.  Orphaned and single, she takes care of her two sisters by supporting them in their studies along with her son, this will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Buying cooking utensils, garments, sandals, and cosmetics

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation. 

She has been selling firewood for over two years. She supplies at wholesale to Pwani Oil Company. Elizabeth faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She hopes to establish a company selling cars in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase firewood logs and pay for a business permit. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase firewood logs and pay for a business permit.

loans.name: Dondon

texts.en:
Dondon C. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. He is 22 years old. Dondon is single. To make a living, Dondon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Dondon has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dondon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dondon is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dondon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a young woman who is newly wedded. Her husband is an employee. The couple had to borrow money from relatives to pay for their wedding expenses. Mariam came to FATEN and borrowed $1500 to pay back the relatives. Then they only have to pay back FATEN on a monthly basis. Repaying FATEN is much easier for Mariam and her husband, as it is a fixed amount and on a monthly basis.

Mariam's husband appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: To pay back relatives the money she borrowed for her wedding

loans.name: Pab

texts.en:
Pab B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old. Pab is married and has three children aged 9, 4 and 2. To make a living, Pab owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Pab works hard to build his business.

Pab joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pab has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Pab is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Ашурматова Хайринисо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Сыновья занимаются строительными работами. Сама Хайринисо имеет среднее образование. Более 7 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу. Она в основном сеет пшеницу для продажи. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора. Она хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: A. Khayriniso lives in the Shahrituz region. She's fifty years old, married and has four children. Her sons are construction workers. Khayriniso has a high school level of education and, for the past seven years, has grown wheat on a plot of land adjacent to her home. She's asking for a loan in order to purchase some mineral fertilizers and fuel for a tractor. She wishes to reap a bountiful harvest intended for sale.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and fuel [for a tractor]

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
The four people shown in the photograph above are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. One of them, Kav C., age 42, has been selected by the other group members to be the leader. 

Kav C. and his wife now have a fishing business in and around the Tunle Sap River. They have been fishing in the river for more than ten years. They earn a profit of $4 per day to contribute to supporting their three school-aged children, including school fees. Kav C. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so that he can catch more fish.

There are three other borrowers who have requested a loan as follows:
Mr. Say L. will be using her loan to better support her fishing business.
Mrs. Ry S. is applying for a loan to expand her grocery business.
Mrs. S. S. will be using the Kiva loan to buy a new boat to replace a broken one.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Luon

texts.en:
Luon R. is 58 years old.  She is the mother of seven children –  four of whom are single, and three are married and now live in their own houses. 

To make a living, Luon R. grows rice crops on her farmland, which has belonged to her since 1979.  On average, she can earn a profit of approximately $1 each day.  Luon R. has a life partner in her husband who is a recycling seller.  He earns an income about $2 each day.  He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells them in bulk to other countries.  

Luon R. is looking for a loan to buy used goods to sell, and to buy a used motorcycle to transport them to the buyers.

loans.use: To purchase used goods to sell & a motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a married woman who lives in Cebu. She earns her living by operating livestock and buying and selling of RTW (clothing)businesses. Her husband Rosalito, who is 58 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  They have six children who are between 18 and 35 years old. 

Florentina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florentina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to purchase feed for her livestock and clothes for her RTW clothing business so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her businesses. Florentina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock and clothes for her RTW business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 20 years old and single. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to pay for her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. He has been working in implanting solar energy systems in customers' houses since 2006. He works on a freelance basis.  He has two full-time employees helping him since his business founding, because he was unable to manage his business alone as he is working at the same time in a local hospital. 

This young man works hard in cooperation with his father to reach the necessary financial level where the family can afford the heavy life expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tools and products in order to expand his business operation further. He is certain that he will achieve nearer remarkable growth thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and products.

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn G. is from the village of West Kibawe in the Kibawe Municipality of Bukidnon Province. Judilyn is 29 years old. She is married and has two young children. To make a living, Judilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, beverages, powdered juice drinks, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Judilyn has been engaged in her business for over four years, and she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Judilyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and breads. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Judilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages, and breads.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris casada, su esposo es jubilado tienes dos hijos, los planes que se terminen de preparar profesionalmente. Al ver la necesidad de otro ingreso económico inicio su propio negocio con fondo de micro crédito tiene una comideria en su caja de habitación tiene la opción de repartir comida a los puestos de trabajo cércanos siendo un servicio.  Requiere comprar materia prima para utilizarlo en el negocio y aumentar la variedad de platos. Con el préstamo comprara arroz, frijoles, aceites, café, azúcar, verduras, carne de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado entre otros productos. Agradece por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is married.   Her husband is retired.  She has two children and her plan is that they complete their professional training.

When she saw the need to have an additional source of income, she started her own business with help from a micro loan.  She has an eatery at home and also has the option of providing food delivery services to nearby workplaces.  

She needs raw materials for the business to increase the variety of dishes.  She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, coffee, sugar, vegetables, beef, chicken, pork and fish, among other products.  She is grateful for the help developing her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: Prudencio tiene 39 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Janeth de 31 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Prudencio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia. Sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar cacao, café y raíces de barbasco son de buena calidad y por lo cual sus productos son vendidos a muy buenos precios. Procura siempre cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus frutos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de sus cultivos que son muy pesados. Tiene planeado posteriormente comprar una camioneta para realizar el servicio de taxi trayecto Santa Rosa  y San Francisco. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo por el cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono para mejorar sus tierras y así posteriormente cosechar frutos en abundancia.
texts.en:
Prudencio, 39, is a cheerful, hard working man living in his own house with his wife, Janeth, 31, and his three beloved children who he wants to provide a better quality of life for.  His farmland that he’s acquired with so much effort is Prudencio’s main source of support for his family.  His products are in very high demand in the city of San Francisco since he’s well known for producing good quality cocoa beans, coffee and “barbasco” (an evergreen shrub) and they are sold for very good prices.  He strives always to protect his crops from the insect infestations that can affect the fruit.  He’s been in this line of work for 15 years and considers the most difficult part transporting the sacks of product which are very heavy.  He plans later on to buy a van to provide taxi service between Santa Rosa and San Francisco.

This is his second loan with MFP.  He knows that the contribution will be very beneficial for his work’s development so he commits to repay punctually.  He is a very cheerful member of his communal bank and he always maintains order during the meetings.  He will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure to improve the soil so that he can harvest fruit in abundance later.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María Raquel tiene  21 años de edad, ella es soltera, vive en casa propia,  La cual está ubicada en el distrito de Catacaos, María vive en Catacaos en la parte rural del distrito de y cuenta con los servicios básicos.

María Raquel se dedica a la venta cerveza y la elaboración y venta de chicha (bebida oriunda del Perú, hecha en base a maíz y jora), ella a instalado su negocio en su domicilio donde ella atiende personalmente a sus familiares, clientes  y amigos que frecuentan su negocio. 

María Raquel está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para poder compra de una congeladora la cual es necesaria para la venta y conservación de las bebidas anteriormente mencionadas.

María Raquel cuenta con buenas referencias, por parte de las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona, tranquila y trabajadora.
texts.en:
María Raquel, 21, is single living in her own house which is located in Catacaos District.  María lives in Catacaos in the rural part of the district and she has basic utilities.

María Raquel sells beer and she makes and sells chicha (a Peruvian beverage made from corn and jora).  Her business is home-based and that’s where she personally takes care of her relatives, customers and friends that frequent her business.

María Raquel is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy a freezer that’s necessary for the sale and storage of the aforementioned beverages.

María Raquel has good references from people who know her that describe her as being a calm, hard working person.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Isisekelo Group

texts.en:
Siphiwe is 60 years old and single with six children between the ages of 21 and 39 years old, one of which attends school. She runs a clothing business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured rasing her hand.

She has been in this business for 7 years selling clothes to people who are working in farms. She also receives income from the goverment old age pension fund. Siphiwe requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that the extra income form this loan will help her improove her life and her famillies buy putting food on the table and paying for her children's school fees. She faces a challenge of customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. In the future, she would like to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Don Nicolas tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y junto a su familia vive en la Comunidad El Triunfo. El inició su negocio criando y destazando cerdos, luego de un tiempo cambió de giro comercial y se dedicó a la venta de abarroteria en una pequeña pulperia que instaló en su casa de habitacion y como éste negocio no le fue rentable ahora se dedica a la compra-venta de ganado y al cultivo de café. Con la ayuda de algunos mozos, Don Nicolas puede atender sus negocios desde las 6:00 am hasta la 1:00 pm. Con el prestamo solicitado comprará abono, urea y pagará mano de obra. Espera que su negocio sea mas productivo y que le permita obtener ganancias y con eso podrá proveer de lo necesario a su familia. Gracias a Dios ni mi familia ni yo presentamos enfermedades, pero si estamos teniendo un poco de problemas con el cultivo de café, ya que la tierra no está tecnificada y por eso debemos tener mas cuidado. Su sueño es convertirse en un gran productor de Café, el año que viene piensa sembrar 2 manzanas mas de tierra y espera que FAMA le siga apoyando con los prestamos para conseguirlo. Este es su segundo prestamo y es muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 63 years old, married, and has five children.  He lives together with his family in El Triunfo community.  He started his business raising and butchering pigs then, after a while, he changed direction and started selling groceries from a small grocery store that he set up in his home.  As this business was not profitable, he now buys and sells cattle and grows coffee.  With the help of some young men, Nicolas is able to work in his businesses from 6.00am to 1.00pm. 

Nicolas will use the loan that he has requested to buy manure and urea (fertilizer).  He will also pay labor costs.  He hopes that his business will become more productive and enable him to make a profit so that he can provide his family with what they need.  "Thanks to God, neither my family nor myself are sick but we are having a few problems with our coffee growing since the land is not being farmed using modern technology and so we must take more care".

Nicolas' dream is to become an important coffee producer.  Next year he plans to sow two 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of additional land and hopes that FAMA will continue supporting him with loans so that he can achieve this.  This is his second loan and he is very punctual in making his repayments.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus, aged 50, is married to Juliana and are blessed with four children aged between twelve and twenty one years. He runs a boutique which has been in operation for twenty years.The business earns him a monthly profit of KES11,000.

This is his third loan term with KADET LTD and has a good credit history. He will use the funds to buy more clothes for resale. He intends to buy a residential plot using the anticipated profits and hopes to import new clothes in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Asmahou

texts.fr:
Asmahou est née le 23 Novembre 1985 à Sikasso, elle est mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle  vit avec son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Asmahou est tailleur de formation, à défaut de pratiquer cette profession elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des  fruits (mangues, oranges,  bananes, etc.) depuis quelques années. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de  Sikasso et de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt individuel dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter des chargements de charrettes en régimes de bananes pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Asmahou is born on November 23, 1985 in Sikasso. She is married and the mother of one son. She lives with her husband in a large traditional extended family in Bougoula-Ville, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Mrs Asmahou is a tailor by training. Unable to engage in this profession, she got introduced to the fruit trade (mangoes, oranges, bananas, etc.) a few years ago. She conducts business in the great market in Sikasso and as a street vendor.
In order to better satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso about one year ago. She is requesting this first individual loan with the objective to increase her working capital to purchase cart loads of banana bunches to better satisfy her increasing number of customers.
With this loan, she is planning on a monthly benefit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used mainly to increase her working capital, contribute to the family's expenses, and pay her loan's interests.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.en:
Anjelika is married with two daughters and lives in Melitopol where she owns a men’s and women’s underwear kiosk in the central marketplace. Anjelika, who launched her small enterprise 12 years ago, now has 25,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory and earns a monthly net profit of 6,500 Grivnyas.
 
Anjelika is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted merchandise for sale in her kiosk. She is planning to continue developing her trade and re-investing in its further expansion. Anjelika is hoping to use a portion of the generated profit to improve her housing situation.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Abaticumugambi/ Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Venuste fait partie du groupe Abaticumugambi. Il est né au Rwanda et a 45 ans,il est marié et il a 3 enfants de 1 à 9 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire. 

Venuste est agriculteur du riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des fertilisants(NPK,Urée), utiliser dans les champs du riz et payer la main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’accroitre des champs en utilisant le système d’irrigation en vue d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Venuste voudrait devenir une grande agriculteur du riz , payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Venuste is a member of the Abaticumugambi group.  He was born in Rwanda and is 45 years old.  He is married and a father of three children ranging from one to nine years old, one of whom attends school.  He himself completed four years of elementary school.  
Vénusté is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He plans on using his loan to purchase fertilizers (NPK, urea) to use on his rice fields and pay workers.  
His business growth strategy is to increase his farming land by using irrigation systems, with the ultimate goal of increasing production.  In the next few years, Venuste would like to become a large-scale rice producer, pay tuition fees for his children and pay his family’s medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers (NPK, urea) to use on his rice fields and to pay workers

loans.name: Hermandad Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Hermandad” está conformado por 16 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran local de ropa nueva, comercio, ferretería, venta de perfumes y venta de comidas preparadas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago. 
Astrid integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, en el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una bufanda color fucsia. Se dedica a la atención y venta de productos de paquetería en un bazar que tiene ubicado en su casa desde hace 6 meses. Ahí cuenta con un letrero y una vitrina. Su horario laboral es durante todo el día, de lunes a domingo. Comenta que el sector donde vive no hay competencia, por lo que le va muy bien en su negocio. 
Comenzó en el rubro del comercio vendiendo perfumes por catalogo.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en el barrio “Meiggs” sector popular de ventas para comerciantes.
Con el crédito comprará artículos para la temporada de fiestas patrias, específicamente; banderas, volantines, artículos de paquetería y ropa interior. 
Sus metas son tener un kiosco y ubicarlo afuera de su casa, para surtirlo de mercadería. También se dedica a preparar empanadas a pedido, algunos fines de semana, por lo que otra de sus metas sería establecer éste negocio que también le brinda ganancias. 
Astrid vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 14 y 7 años de edad, además de dos nietos. Sus sueños son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, por la ayuda y transparencia entregada por la institución. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece es unido y solidario. Respecto a las capacitaciones, éstas le han servido para administrar mejor su negocio. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Hermandad" and is composed of 16 entrepreneurs who have different businesses, including a new clothing store, retail sales, a hardware store, selling perfume, and selling prepared food. All the members live in the neighborhood of Independencia, in the city of Santiago.

Astrid, a member of the communal bank, who is in the photo on the very right in the second row, wearing a fuchsia scarf. She works serving customers and selling packaged goods in a shop that has been located in her home for 6 months. There she has a sign and a shop window. Her work schedule is every day, Monday through Sunday. She says that there isn't competition in the area where she lives, so her business is doing very well.

She began in the business of retail sales, selling perfume from a catalog.

She usually buys her merchandise in the Meiggs neighborhood, a popular place for selling to merchants.

With the loan, she will be items for the Fiestas Patrias (independence day celebrations), specifically flags, kites, packaged goods, and undergarments.

Her goal is to have a kiosk located outside her house, supplied with merchandise. Some weekends, she also prepares empanadas to order, so another goal would be to establish this business, which also provides income.

Astrid lives together with her husband and their four children, who are 22, 20, 14, and 7 years old, as well as two nephews. Her dream is to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very satisfied and thankful for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza, for the help and transparency provided by the institution.

She comments that the communal bank to which she belongs is united and caring. Regarding the trainings, they have helped her manage her business better.

Independencia is one of the 34 neighborhoods that make up the city of Santiago (Chile's capital). It is located in the city's center-north area and grew at the end of the nineteenth century as a traditional part of the city. Its main street is Avenida Independencia, which follows the old Inca Trail, the northern entry to the city of Santiago. Given its ample indigenous population, the Centro Cultural Indigena de Chile (Chilean Indigenous Cultural Center) is located in Independencia. It also has important historical monuments, among them 6 of Chile's historical monuments.

loans.use: to buy items for the Fiestas Patrias (independence day celebrations), specifically flags, kites, packaged goods, and undergarments.

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Shella has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Shella is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Shella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Esperdion

texts.en:
Esperdion is 59 years old, and runs a hog fattening business.  He is married and blessed with five children, two of whom are married, two are  construction workers and one is a student. 

He has been managing his hog raising business for 15 years.  For 20 years he has also been a maker of water pump in their community.  He is a very patient and industrious father.  He operates two businesses to provide for the needs of his family.  It is quite difficult, but his willingness to lift his family from poverty motivates him to do the work.

He is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccine for his hogs. He wants to develop his hog fattening business further to earn a higher income, so he can provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccine for his hogs

loans.name: Finah

texts.en: Fina, aged 31, has two children; they are 4 and 13 years old. All the children are enrolled in schools. Fina owns a canteen, selling different things like milk and andazi (doughnuts) for students. The profits from the business will be used to buy her residential house. She would like to own a big store like a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Komayli

texts.en:
Komayli is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been working in selling beauty cosmetics and wedding dresses since a year ago. Komayli started this business in order to help her husband earn their living.
 
Komayli is a woman with a very good reputation. Most of her customers are neighbors, nearby villagers and many other friends, in addition to passing-by customers. Komayli is working on improving and developing her business as much as she can; that’s why she requested a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to increase her business merchandise through buying new cosmetics collections in addition to wedding dresses to increase her customers’ choices.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise through buying new cosmetics collections and wedding dresses.

loans.name: Thao's Group

texts.en:
Thao was born in 1960. She lives in Tuan Le village. She has two children (a daughter and a son). They have monthly income. 

Thao has a general store. She and her husband work there. They sell groceries (candy, cakes, cigarettes, sugar and many other goods). They have had this job for five years. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

This is the second time she is borrowing money from SEDA. The last time she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy more groceries to sell with the purpose of earning more profit.

About other borrower in her group:
Tam is 29 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy a camera for her shop.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erich Miguel

texts.es:
El joven estudiante Erich Miguel, de 20 años de edad, está cursando la carrera de Ciencias Contables y Administrativas, se halla en el primer año. 
Cuenta con el apoyo moral de sus padres, su madre es Docente, y muy dedicada a su familia, su padre es Contador Público Nacional. 
Erich, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación está logrando estudiar ya que trabaja de mañana y tarde, y como todo estudio superior universitario conlleva un costo elevado tanto con la matricula, los materiales didácticos y otros gastos.
Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera y ser un buen profesional y lograr ingresar en alguna Empresa Pública como contador, su fiel ejemplo a seguir es su padre, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar apoyo mediante un crédito para solventar esos gastos.
texts.en:
The young student Erich Miguel, 20 years old, is in the first year of his program in Accounting and Administrative Sciences.  He enjoys the moral support of his parents.  His mother is a teacher and very dedicated to her family.  His father is a national public accountant.

Erich, with great effort and dedication is managing to study, since he works in the morning and the afternoon.  Like all advanced university study, it entails a high cost for tuition, learning materials, and other expenses.

His biggest dream is to finish his studies, be a good professional, and manage to become an accountant in some public enterprise.  His father is his exact example to follow.

He approached Fundación Paraguaya to ask for help through a loan to pay for those expenses.

loans.use: to pay for learning materials and for access to the library.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma de 36 años de edad, está felizmente casada con Clemente, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 19, 16, 10 y 8 años. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia en la ciudad de Tarma.
Norma nació en el anexo de Ricricán – Palcamayo, al igual que su esposo, ahí tienen una casa propia y terrenos de cultivos. Pero por la educación de sus hijos tuvieron que salir de su lugar natal hacia la ciudad de Tarma. Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de papas de las variedades: “Yungay” y “Jilguero”. Producción que vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. “El trabajo en la chacra (terrenos de cultivos), es duro, yo y mi esposo sembramos, limpiamos, abonamos, de todo hacemos”, comenta.
Norma distribuye bien su tiempo para que pueda atender su hogar y a sus hijos, quienes también apoyan en las labores de la casa.
Con esta actividad, Norma espera brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia, y más adelante ver a sus hijos desarrollarse profesionalmente.  “Quiero que ellos logren lo que yo no pude en mi tiempo”, puntualiza esperanzada. Con su apoyo, ella podrá acceder a su préstamo número 15 de MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. Por su parte se siente contenta y alentada con el trabajo en equipo de su banco comunal. De recibir el dinero, podrá adquirir alrededor de 10 bolsas de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus terrenos de papas, para la cosecha de mayo, junio y julio.
texts.en:
Norma is 36 years old and happily married to Clemente. They have four children (ages 19, 16, 10, and 8). She and her entire family live in their own home in the city of Tarma.

Norma was born in the annex of Ricricán – Palcamayo, just like her husband. There they have a house and farmland. However, they had to leave their birthplace so that their children could pursue their education in the city of Tarma. Norma is a farmer who grows potatoes of the “Yungay” and “Jilguero” varieties. She successfully sells what she produces at the wholesale market in Tarma. Norma says, “The work on the farm is hard. My husband and I plant the seeds, clear the weeds, fertilize, and perform all of the work.” Norma successfully manages her time between looking after the home and taking care of her children, who also help with the household chores. Through her business, Norma hopes to provide a good quality of life for her family. Going forward, she would like to see her children develop professionally. “I want them to achieve the things that I was not able to have,” she emphasizes with great hope.

Norma will access her 15th loan with MFP. She gives her word that she will be punctual with her monthly payments. Norma is pleased and encouraged to be part of her work team with the Communal Bank. The money she will be receiving will be used to acquire approximately 10 bags of organic fertilizer that she can apply to her potato fields, which will be harvested in May, June, and July.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina, a married mother of six children, all of whom go to school, lives in Kampala, Uganda where she takes care of two additional family members, her grand children. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Safina's monthly expenses include food and school fees.

The operator of a retail shop at the market for seven years, she works six days a week, and also sells water and boiled milk for an additional source of income. Safina has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, and flour. Her major business challenges are thieves and costly commodities. Her goal is to expand her retail shop into wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more suagr, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 46 años, está casado con Amelia, tienen 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Juan se dedica al macate(venta ambulante) hace más de 3 años, con la ayuda de su señora, cuenta con clientela formada y en lo cual le va muy bien gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, los cuales consisten en sabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas y demás.
Juan es una persona muy admirada por el gran sacrificio que demuestran por mejorar su calidad de vida, diariamente recorren varios kilómetros para ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo realizar sus cobranzas.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra desabanas, frazadas, sobrecamas para su negocio, ya que dese poder estar abastecido para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 46 years old, he is married to Amelia and they have two children who are grown up and independent. Juan has worked as a travelling salesman for more than 3 years with the help of wife. He relies on regular customers and it is going very well for him thanks to the good quality of his products, which consist of sheets, blankets, bedspreads and more.

Juan is much admired for the great sacrifice he is making in order to improve his quality of life. Every day he travels several kilometers to sell his products and cover his costs.

He plans to use the loan to buy sheets, blankets and bedspreads for his business as he would like to be well stocked in order to meet his customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets and bedspreads to sell on.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 40 years old, married to Janet and has two children.

He has been a welder at Kapsabet trading center for 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Ben has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. as his third  loan after repaying the previous one successfully. He plans to use this amount to purchase welding rods and welding gas for his workshop. He plans to plow back the profits to improve the business that his wife is operating and also to repay the loan.

His dream is to educate his children to greater heights.

loans.use: To purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le l’arachide  avec   NANA , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de FIGURA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five entrepreneurs from the Diama association in the village of Oussouye in southern Senegal. Represented by Alpha D., the group describes their business:

“The Diama association is a group of young people in Oussouye who have been working in the community development field for a long time, and are now launching a small store that sells cosmetic products and other miscellaneous goods. Our purpose is to combat migration from rural areas and create employment for the young members of our group. Our business activities include the purchase and retail sale of cosmetic products such as lotion, perfume, and other beauty products. These products will be purchased from wholesalers in Dakar, then sold in Oussouye in order to serve the rest of the county.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le groupement Diama est un groupement de jeune de Escale à Oussouye qui travail depuis très longtemps dans le cadre de développement et créant une centrale d’achat de vente de produits cosmétique et divers.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre l’exode rural et créer de l’emploi pour les jeunes membres du groupement.

Activités : Achat et vente de produits Cosmétique tel que : lait de toilette, parfum, et autres matériel de beauté. Ces produits seront achetés à Dakar chez les commerçants grossistes puis vendus à Oussouye afin de pouvoir servir le reste du département. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of lotion, perfume and cosmetic products; transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is 21 years old. She is engaged in trading of seeds of various plants and vegetables. Her hobby is to grow flowers and garden products, so it is very easy for her to interact with her clients and give advice. At the current time she works at the market but her goal is open her own shop where she could sell different kinds of seeds, spices and flowers. She has seen very beautiful flower shops in foreign movies and she thinks she could manage a shop like that. Currently there is no such shop in her town and since she already has many regular clients she is sure her shop will be a success. 
Another dream that she has is to study at biology  in the University. But her parents do not have enough money to pay for her education. Dilorom has three brothers and two sisters.
She will use her loan to rent the premises and repair it for her future shop and she will save the profit for her future education.

loans.use: Rent and repairs of the shop

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama in 36 years and the mother of 4 children. Her husband works as a mechanic. The income from her business helps suppliment the family income. She sells clothes for both adults and children in the local market. With her first loans from SMT, Adama has been able to increase her stock and overall profit. She will use the new loan funds to increase her stock even more and to also increase the selection to attract more customers.

loans.use: Increase and diversify stock of imported clothes

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz lives in Apodaca, Nuevo León. She is married and her husband works as a driver. His income is not enough to cover all the family’s needs, which is why she began selling lingerie from catalogs four years ago. In this way, she has helped her husband with the family expenses while still being able to take care of their home. It is the faithful bond she feels toward her husband that motivates her to work hard every day to grow her business.

She is requesting a loan of $375.00, which she will use to buy merchandise to cover the demand from her customers and to improve the quality of service she provides. She promises to repay the loan in 4 months. Contribute to the growth of this business and the improvement of this family’s life. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León vive Maria de la Luz, ella es casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer pero su salario es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que desde hace cuatro años Maria inició con la venta de ropa interior por catálogo, de esta manera es como ha apoyado a su esposo con los gastos familiares sin descuidar su hogar. El fiel compromiso que siente con su esposo es lo que la motiva día con día a esforzarse por hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora está solicitando un crédito por $ 375 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar la de vida de esta familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth's business foresight and enterprising spirit have led her to construct a well in her home to store water and distribute it to her clients by way of a piping system. As we all know, this liquid resource is of vital importance for the survival of humans and facing a continual lack of this service in the homes of many people around her community, Ruth decided to start this business. The contribution that each member provides to carry out this activity is important. Since establishing this business at home, demand has increased daily but with the moving of many families to the area, service has become inadequate. Therefore, Ruth is asking for a 400 dollar loan which she promises to repay in 6 months. With the loan, she plans to buy more pipes and a water pump to facilitate distribution and be able to supply more families in less time. Let's help Ruth's business be able to continue to contribute to the well-being of many families in Pucallpa.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La visión de Ruth para los negocios y su espíritu emprendedor han hecho que lleve a cabo la construcción de un pozo en su domicilio para almacenar el agua y poder distribuirlo a sus clientes a través de redes tubulares. Como todos sabemos este líquido elemento es de vital importancia para la sobrevivencia de los seres humanos y ante la falta continua de este servicio en los hogares de muchas personas dentro de su localidad, Ruth decidió iniciar este negocio. La contribución que cada uno de los miembros brinda para desarrollar esta actividad es importante. Desde que estableció este negocio en su hogar la demanda se incrementaba diariamente pero es con el asentamiento de muchas familias en esta localidad que el servicio se ha vuelto deficiente. Por esta razón Ruth solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares y se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses; para poder comprar más tubos y una bomba de agua a fin de agilizar la distribución y poder abastecer a muchas familias en menor tiempo. Hagamos que el negocio de Ruth siga contribuyendo con el bienestar de muchas familias en Pucallpa.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and pipes in order to offer better service to the community where Ruth and her family live

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Mr. Diego Martinez, 25, is single and lives with his parents in San Ignacio, Paraguay. Since 2005, Diego has had a shop that rents DVDs. Additionally, Diego has a small recording studio where he makes CDs and DVDs. He began in this area by working as a DJ for the local radio station. After gaining some experience as a DJ he was able to move up and become a DJ at a club. Today he is a DJ at one of the bigger clubs in the zone.

He has worked hard to learn everything he can about recording and sales. He already owns all of the equipment necessary to have a well-run recording studio, including computers, a soundboard, and a multiplicity of international films, which he rents through his store.

He has asked for a loan so that he can buy a new computer for his mixing studio. The computer he has currently is quite old and breaks frequently. The large demand for his services requires that he have a machine that functions smoothly. At this time his goal is to continue growing his business and increase the number of clients he can serve on a weekly basis. A new computer will allow Diego to pursue his goals and better his daily life.

loans.use: To buy a new computer

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline M. is 43 years old, is married, and has four children. She lives in the Kawangware area in Nairobi. Besides her immediate family, she takes care of her 22-year-old sister-in-law, whose mother died. Because Jacqueline’s husband is the eldest in his family, it is therefore his responsibility to take care of his sister, till she finds a job in order to support herself.

Ever since she can remember, Jacqueline had been interested in becoming a tailor. To accomplish this, she joined a training class at Redeemed Gospel Church at Huruma in Nairobi for classes and practical training, which lasted for two years. After training, she started her business in 1996 with about US $147, which she borrowed from her sister. She has since paid that off. She started by making petticoats, which she sold from house to house for a period of six months. The business picked up very well, and with this income she built a stall of her own in Kayole, where she could carry out her business more effectively. She later expanded her business and started making clothes and curtains. And she started offering training; at the moment she has three trainees. Jacqueline was doing well, but unfortunately, her stall was broken into and two of her sewing machines were stolen. Because of this, she had to rent two machines for four months, at about $7 per machine per month. This eventually became too much of a burden and made her business shrink, and she even lost customers. Later she moved from Kayole to Kawangware, and with the money she got after recovering from her loss, she bought a sewing machine.

Jacqueline is now asking for a loan of US $475 to enable her to buy materials and a sewing machine. She says this will enable her to get more students and will also enable her to get back her customers and be able to finish her orders on time. The repayment period for her loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and an assortment of sewing materials

loans.name: Onah

texts.en: Onah is a 62-year-old widow who has a son. Her husband passed away a long time ago, so she has to earn income to support her family by herself. She sells fresh milk door-to-door, earning US$4 a day. She also sells clothes and sandals, earning US$16 a month. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$100 to add to her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her business capital

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
Saboat A. is 42 years old. She and her husband, who is an entrepreneur, have one child of school age.

For the last 4 years, Saboat has been selling children's clothing in the central local market. Each month, Saboat travels to Bishkek, a city located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan, to buy children's clothing, and diversify the range of goods of her business. Saboat tries to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. Saboat's business is stable and generates a considerable income towards the family's budget.

Saboat became a client of IMON last year. However, even over such a short period of time she has proved to be a reliable client by managing her loans with accuracy. Saboat is now requesting a loan of 900.00 US Dollars to purchase new children's clothing for the summer season of sales. Saboat thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: Purchase of new children's clothing for the summer season of sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more supplies, specifically gas / Invertir en mas mercaderia, especifiamente tanques de gas

loans.name: Teuth

texts.en: Teuth L. is 24 years old  and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and their two young children. Both she and her husband work in the rice fields, where they earn a combined $2.50 a day. She wants to buy a grinding mill that she can use to prepare her own food, as well as rent out to local farmers. With their increased income, she hopes to buy additional farmland and possibly even a generator for their home.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz is a very enterprising woman and has a beautiful personality, a quality that helps her to win over her customers. The ability to be convincing in her sales has helped Luz very much as she goes out daily selling her various lines of cosmetics, and later collecting installments of her revenues. She is always motivated in her work due to the great love that she has for her children who are in school. Her husband also works but many times the income is low and with the work that Luz performs their financial condition has greatly improved. To continue moving forward, Luz is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing wholesale cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Luz, es una mujer muy emprendedora y de un hermoso carácter y precisamente esta cualidad le brinda ayuda para conquistar a sus clientas, ese poder de convencimiento para obtener las ventas le favorece bastante a Luz que diariamente sale a ofrecer sus cosméticos de las diferentes líneas de belleza, luego va a cobrar por partes lo que vende, siempre está motivada a realizar su trabajo por el inmenso amor que tiene hacia sus hijos que están estudiando, su esposo también trabaja pero muchas veces los ingresos son bajos y con el trabajo de Luz la economía de su casa ha mejorado mucho.Para seguir adelante Luz está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de cosméticos al por mayor.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Isabel del Carmen L. M. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 66 years of age and is married to Humberto García; together they have 3 adult children. Mrs. L.’s sole source of income is her small grocery store, which she has owned for the past 30 years and is situated in the main dock of the city. Among her clients are those who travel to the communities and foreign visitors who favor her thanks to the variety of products she offers (basic grains, juices, soups, sodas, natural fruit beverages, disposable diapers, paper plates and cups, among other items). The items she offers have not diminished in demand because they are of high consumption to the population.

This is the second loan that Mrs. L. has requested, and she intends to use it as follows: 3 hundredweights of rice at $45 each, 2 hundredweights of sugar at $30 each, 2 drums of oil at $44 each, 4 boxes of laundry detergent at $11 each, 2 large packages of bathroom tissue at $9 each, 2 cases of coffee at $19, 1 case of powdered milk at $60, 2 large packages of detergent at $12 each, 3 cases of juice at $11 each and 6 packages of disposable diapers at $8 each. With this investment, she will be able to increase her earnings and meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Isabel del Carmen L. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 66 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Humberto García, ambos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, cabe mencionar que el único ingreso de La Sr. L. es el de la pulpería. La Sra. L. es propietaria de una pulpería por más de 30 años ubicada en el muelle municipal de la ciudad, teniendo como clientes a las personas que viajan a las comunidades y visitantes extranjeros que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pañales descartables, vasos y platos descartables entre otras cosas), cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población.

Este es el segundo crédito que solicita la Sra. L. para comprar: 3 quintales de arroz a $ 45.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 30.00 dólares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a $ 44.00 dólares el bidón, 4 cajas de lavar ropa a $ 11.00 dólares cada caja, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 9.00 dólares el bolsón, 2 cajas de café a $ 19.00 dólares cada caja, 1 caja de leche en polvo a $ 60.00 dólares la caja, 2 bolsones de detergentes a $ 12.00 dólares cada bolsón, 3 cajas de jugos a $ 11.00 dólares cada caja y 6 paquetes de pañales descartables a $ 8.00 dólares cada paquete, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, laundry detergent, bathroom tissue, coffee, powdered milk, detergent, juices and disposable diapers to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth S. is a subsistence farmer in Ta Yuos Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her rice revenue is very minimal. Thus, Mrs. Reth S. decided to request a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice more rice  and expand her revenue. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sim, sells firewood door to door. Mrs. Reth S. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Last year, Mrs. Reth S.’s husband suffered from a severe stomach ache and Mrs. Reth S. spent $500 to on medical attention to cure him. The medical expenses drained Mrs. Reth S. savings and she no longer has enough money to spend on the rice field. Mrs. Reth S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice and expand her rice revenue.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.en:
Adilia is a married woman with a six-year old child. She sell clothing. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Adilia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business to increase sales

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mercedes lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She is 36 years old, married, with 4 daughters and 2 sons, all of whom study. Her husband receives a pension but he works as a security guard in order to provide additional income and support the children and their studies. Mercedes has been selling food for 5 years, and she also sells cosmetics. Previously she only sold food but the seeing need to ensure her family’s future, she decided to enter cosmetic sales. The loan she seeks is to buy construction materials to build a bathroom because they presently have a latrine and would like to buy a toilet as it is more hygienic and comfortable for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Mercedes habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, con cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos hombres, todos estudian, su esposo recibe una pensión, pero él trabaja como guarda de seguridad para tener más ingreso y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Doña Mercedes tiene cinco años de vender comida, y también vende cosméticos, anteriormente solo vendía comida pero ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, decidió incursionar en la venta de cosméticos. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar material de construcción y construir un baño por que actualmente tiene una letrina y ahora quiere comprar su inodoro ya que es más higiénico y más cómodo para su familia.

loans.use: Buy materials to construct a bathroom

loans.name: Sipule

texts.en: Sipule H., 55, is married with 10 children. She has many years of experience in the vegetable farming and flea market businesses. She sells to the general public and villagers 4 days per week. She has 6 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Sipule's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. As a mother of 10 children, running small businesses to try to support them, she has paid off her previous loans with SPBD and is now requesting her next one.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, weed killer chemicals, knives, vegetable seeds, rake, hose, pucket, axe, and gloves

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem O. is a villager in Deum Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer, and her husband, Mr. Hang Meng, uses a boat to ferry people. Unfortunately, he now faces an obstacle because his boat is too old and uncomfortable, so his wife decided to ask for a loan and combine it with her savings to buy a new boat. Mrs. Khoem O. is 45 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new boat for a ferry service

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. was born in 1947 in Abomey. She is a widow who has 3 children in school. She began her business 2 years ago. She has also sold akassa (a snack that includes pate, the staple food of Benin) for the past 8 years and lived in Cadjèhoun for the past 20 years. With her first loan she grew her business, and now she would like to buy more rechargeable cards to satisfy growing demand.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née vers 1947 à Abomey, elle est veuve. Mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés, elle mène cette activité depuis 02 ans. Elle vend également l’akassa depuis 08 ans et réside à Cadjèhoun depuis 20 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 150000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable cards for public telephones.

loans.name: Tang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tang S. is a group leader of four, who are all living in Korng Keb Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a cake seller who can make a small income to support the household. She is a 54-year-old widow with a child who helps her on the plantation. Although she and her child try to work hard, they still cannot support themselves well. Thus, Mrs. Tang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets to start a breeding business and she hopes to improve her living conditions after she sells the pigs.

All members in this group have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Hector Eduardo

texts.es:
Héctor Eduardo A. B. va hacer padre pos segunda vez, su esposa en el embarazo ha tenido algunas complicaciones le han pedido reposo. El quiere llevarla aun doctor particular el cual le daría mejor atención y mayor información de su estado y también se ve en la necesidad de preparase para el parto. El solicita la cantidad de $7,000 pesos
El es el único sostén de la casa y trabaja como promotor de  ventas de sistema de cable.
texts.en:
Héctor Eduardo A. B. is going to be a father for the second time. His wife has had some complications with her pregnancy and has been ordered to bed rest. He wants to take his wife to a private doctor so that she can receive better care and information on her condition and he also needs to prepare for the birth. He is requesting 7,000 pesos. He is the only support for his household and works as a sales promotor for a cable television company.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for medical expenses

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice P., currently in the business of selling bread, is requesting a loan to expand the business. Twenty years old and married to a businessman, she has two children, both attending school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, all delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand  the business,

loans.name: Razia M. Yousaf Group

texts.en:
Razia Baji has been a citizen of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 50 years. Her husband, M. Y., is a professional mason. Razia Baji is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. Her daughters work in a clothes knitting business. Razia Baji helps her daughters with knitting clothes. In addition, she goes to the market to sell them to earning additional money. Razia's son runs a grocery shop in the community. Razia Baji successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her son’s grocery shop. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her community. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo to help her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. If one member of the group does not repay their loan, then other members are responsible to help that member repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Kuami Yves Elom

texts.fr: Monsieur K.  a exercé pendant une année la profession de comptable, mais il a finalement cessé d’exercer parce ce qu’il n’arrivait pas à couvrir ses charges, il s’est lancé depuis 2007 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, ce commerce lui réussit très bien parce qu’il a la notion de gestion. Voulant agrandir son stock afin de profiter d’un nombre plus élevé de clients il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 8sacs de riz, 1 cartons de tomate, 1 bidons d’huile  et des pâtes alimentaires.
texts.en:
For a year's time, Mr. K. worked as a professional accountant, but he has in the end stopped because he was unable to meet his expenses. In 2007, he got started in the grocery business, which is very successful for him because he has the right idea about managing. Wanting to expand his inventory, so as to take advantage of a larger number of customers, he's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying eight sacks of rice, one box of tomatoes, one drum of oil, and some pasta.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariame D. est une dame de 57 ans, veuve et mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge.  Elle achète des graines d’arachide afin d’en faire de la pâte pour la vendre. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt promouvoir son activité qui lui permet d’assurer la nourriture à sa famille
texts.en:
Mariame D. is a 57-year-old woman, a widow, and a mother of three children, who are in her care. She buys peanuts to make peanut butter from them to be sold. She would like to use this loan to promote her business, which enables her to ensure food for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To process and sell peanut butter

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a native of Cagayan province and she is now 58 years old. She is a widow with five children, four of them are already married and their youngest is 13 years old and living with her. Her youngest is in the elementary level in the public school in their village.

She operates a small store in their village. Her store is usually open from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening. Her income is quite small to support her family's needs, thus, she wants to borrow a loan of 17,000 Philippine Pesos to improve her business and be able to save something for the high school and college education of her youngest child. The loan will be of great help for her store to become productive. She dreams of having a more convenient store someday. She is striving hard to send her child to school and have a better future.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Martínez de 59 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Batahola Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa trabaja de enfermera, la cual aporta a los gastos del hogar, sus hijos son independientes, el se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos y puros, desde hace cuatro años, que inicio con ahorros propios, con la elaboración y comercialización de puro pudo sacar buenos ahorros para invertir en repuestos de vehiculo. Con este crédito va a comprar repuestos de vehículos para ofertar a sus clientes y poder cumplir con la demanda. Sus planes es poder heredar un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel M. is 59 years old, is married, and lives in the neighbourhood of Batahola South in the capital city of Managua. His wife works as a nurse and she helps out with the household expenses. Their children are independent. He repairs vehicles and sells cigars, and since he started out four years ago with his own savings from the making and sales of his cigars, he managed to save enough to start investing in a mechanic shop. With this loan he will purchase spare parts for cars to supply his clients and to fill the demand. His dream is to be able to leave a good inheritance to his children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Mutriba
