texts.ru: Мутриба молодая женщина, мать двоих детей, самостоятельная бизнесменка, которая сама ездит за товаром в Бишкек и продаёт на рынках города Худжанда. Она продаёт все постельные товары, подушки из лебяжьего пуха, покрывала из верблюжьей шерсти, полотенца высшего качества и.т.д. Для расширения ассортимента бизнеса Мутриба хочет получить очередной кредит. На снимке Мутриба в день подачи заявки на займ.
texts.en:
Mutriba is a young woman and is the mother of two children; she is an independent businesswoman who travels by herself to Bishkek for products and sells them at the markets in the city of Khujand. She sells all kinds of bed products: pillows made with swan feathers, blankets made from camel wool, the highest quality towels, etc. In order to grow the product assortment of her business Mutriba would like to get another loan. Mutriba is in the photo on the day that she applied for the loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of pillows, blankets

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando G. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. He is 42 years old, is separated from his spouse, and has three school-aged children. Fernando owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily buying and selling scrap materials in his village. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fernando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
K. Bahrom is 25 years old and is married. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 8 years. The income he earns allows him to support his family, including his parents, too.

To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Bahrom would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Bahrom’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for mopeds

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Beatriz M. nasceu na cidade de maputo tem 41 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais dois freqüentam escola e com idades compreendidas entre 7 e 24 anos.

Beatriz interrompeu os estudos na 7 classe devido à gravidez precoce. Actualmente vive sozinha na casa própria juntamente com os filhos depois que o marido lhe abandonou por muito tempo. Foi nessas circunstancias que os pais dela decidiram pedir lhe para que voltasse a casa para fazer o negocio de restaurante, trabalho que faz ate data hoje. É dona do negocio que exerce nessas instalações cedidas pelos pais, a mais de 7 anos. Aprendeu fazendo e tinha sempre o apoio por parte dos pais.

É primeira vez que solicita empréstimo bancário. Com o credito de 14.000,00MT pretende comprar produtos, para reforçar o negocio.teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas que também são clientes.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder outros empréstimos para realizar o grande sonho de construir um estabelecimento próprio.
texts.en:
Beatriz M. was born in the city of Maputo, she is 41 years old and has 3 children, two of them are in school and their ages are between 7 and 24 years old. Beatriz interrupted her studies when she was on the 7th grade because she got pregnant. Currently she lives alone with her children after her husband left. It was under these circumstances that her parents asked her to come back to start the restaurant business, where she works until now. She is the owner of the business now after her parents gave it to her 7 years ago. She learned by doing and always has her parents support. This is the first time she is requesting a bank loan. With the 14.000MT loan she wants to buy products to improve her business. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends who are also clients. She expects to pay the credit without problems to access new ones and fulfill her dream of building her own restaurant.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy first necessity products

loans.name: Nesta

texts.en:
Nesta is a member of the Mafifi borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is 20 years aged.

Nesta started her own shop business selling commodities like sugar,blue band,salts etc 3 years ago.She works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Nesta first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her shop.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Nesta hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more commodities

loans.name: Madeley

texts.es:
Madeley es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Madeley es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Madeley se dedica a la venta de bebidas, pero en los últimos meses tuvo que cerrar su negocio, ahora esta buscando un nuevo local donde implementar su negocio.
Madeley necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la implementación de un nuevo local.
Los sueños de Madeley son que sus hijos estudien fuera del país.

loans.use: Para la implementación de un nuevo local.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 29 years-old and married with three children in school. She lives with her family in a small village in the western region of Ghana.  For the last 15 years, Faustina has owned and operated a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is a skilled and talented hair dresser who believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc. in order to better serve her customers. She purchases her supplies from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy hair products

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 04 hijos, vive en el Barrio Alto Alianza, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar gaseosas al por mayor y jugos los cuales los comercializa en la feria semanal de Yunguyo.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes grande.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones para compartir con sus compañeras.

loans.use: Para la compra de gaseosas al por mayor y jugos

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita B. is from the town of Malibangcao in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old and married. She has three school-aged children and a baby. To make a living, Anecita operates a snack shop. She has been engaged in this business for 5 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month. In October 2005, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP to buy building materials needed to repair her house, such as cement, hollow blocks, nails, and other building materials. Anecita dreams that with PMPC and Kiva funds, their house will improve so that they can live comfortably.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mot R. is a 54-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Mot R. is a Khmer cake seller in the market, selling the cake that she produces in her home. She is married with six children, three of whom are married and have already started new homes. Another source of family income comes from her husband's driving a motorbike taxi.

Mot R. said that her current income is now not adequate. To better meet her family's living expenses, she wants to operate another business but she doesn't have the money to invest in it. Therefore, she would like a loan of US$1,000 to be used as capital to begin selling snack food.

loans.use: To be used as capital to begin selling snack food

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla C. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Perla is married and has 6 adult children. Perla owns & operates a business making & selling food The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked snack food in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Perla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials for the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional materials for the business

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es: Hilda es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo por los que siempre ha luchado. Hace más de 31 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras. Este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita ya que anteriormente ya había tenido una  buena experiencia  porque son muy importantes. Los inicios de su negocio se dan por que su Mama era quien se hacía cargo del negocio y se lo heredo a Hilda para que tuviera su propia fuente de ingreso. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de naranjas, mandarina, melones, repollo entre otros. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado esta actividad económica en donde interactúa con sus clientes. Ella sueña con ampliar cada día más su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Hilda is a single mother with two dependent children. She has always fought on their behalf. Hilda has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 31 years. This is not the first time she has applied for a loan, but she has had good experiences with her previous requests because the funding is very important to her.

Hilda’s mother passed this business on to her so that she could have her own source of income. The proceeds from this loan will be used to buy oranges, tangerines, melons, cabbages, and other types of produce. She likes this line of work because it requires frequent interaction with her customers. Hilda hopes to expand her business a bit more each day and provide her customers with good service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
El señor José A. es casado y con tres hijos a los que debe mantener y  proporcionarles excelentes condiciones de vida ya que ellos están en edades escolares y necesitan una vivienda en perfectas condiciones para que se desarrollen.

Se ha caracterizado por ser un caballero muy trabajador y ha tomado la decisión de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener los materiales de construcción y de esta manera brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde habitar y vivir en familia juntos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor José A. is married and has three children whom he must support and whom he must furnish with excellent living conditions since they are of school age and need a dwelling in faultless condition so that they may develop.

He has characterized himself as a very hardworking gentleman and has made the decision to invest in the improvement of his housing. For that, he is soliciting a loan from CEPRODEL with the aim of obtaining the construction materials and in this way offering his children a decent roof over their heads and a home where they can live together as a family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is a 69-year-old widow with eight children between 26 and 40 years years of age. None of her children goes to school. She owns a three-room house where she is staying with four people. Salima takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying chicken feed at Kalerwe in Kampala district. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week .She receives an average of 10 customers a day and sells at retail to all categories of people. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season (which hinders her customers from reaching her). Salima has been in this business for 10 years and with MCDT for six years. She has had 14 loans, working with the same group mates. Salima joined MCDT because it was near her home and it worked with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed and chicks. She hopes to see her business grower bigger and start selling at wholesale only

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 42 years old; she is a divorcee with 2 children and resides in Lagos state, Nigeria. Life has not been easy for her, caring for her children alone. Her youngest child is 15 and is doing well in school. She sells drinks and pepper soup to her customers. She hopes for a standard restaurant in future. She hopes for loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Force To Go # 2 Group

texts.en:
Force To Go #2 is a group of five borrowers led by Nagbe W.. He is 26 years old and is single with one child who is four years old. Nagba could not continue his education through 12th grade due to poverty.

Nagbe’s business is the sale of shoes. He buys his shoes wholesale and sells retail on a table in the Waterside Market in Monrovia. He has been running this business for six years and hopes to open a shop in the future.

Nagbe keeps his shoes in good condition in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him. Nagbe will use this loan to purchase more shoes to serve customers. He dreams that he and his child will one day live in better conditions.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nagbe is the one holding the sign. Hagar M. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Patricia Elena

texts.es: Patricia Elena R. Q. de 44 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su madre de 84 años de edad, y junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Patricia se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, así mismo comercializa flores artificiales. Ella comercializa su producto de manera ambulante por los pueblos de Ilobasco, San Martín, en el centro de San Salvador y otros lugares más. Patricia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ropa, zapatos, flores artificiales y cortinas. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar su venta, ofreciendo mayor cantidad de productos de manera que abarque mayor cantidad de gustos y necesidades. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y es una madre soltera muy responsable con sus hijos, quien depende por completo de su trabajo diario.
texts.en:
Patricia Elena R. Q. is 44 years old and lives in the Cojutepeque area of Cuscatlán. She lives with her mother, who is 84 years old, and her four children who are in school. Patricia dedicates herself to selling clothing for children, women, and men. In addition, she markets artificial flowers. She sells her products as a street vendor in the town of Ilobasco, San Martín, located in central San Salvador, and other areas. Patricia is requesting a loan with which to buy clothing, shoes, artificial flowers, and curtains. She does all this with the aim of increasing sales, by offering a variety of products in order to better meet her needs. She is a hard-working woman and a very responsible single mother who depends completely on her daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes, and artificial flowers.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal sells medicines at retail prices to his customers who are usually friends, neighbors and residents. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers.

Micheal is 35 years old and is married with five children, his eldest child being 19 years old. His children are still young and they attend school. Micheal’s wife sells foodstuffs to support their home.

Micheal is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar C. est marié à une femme et est père de 2 enfants (1garçon et 1 fille). Il est né vers 1975 dans la sous préfecture de Loulouni, préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Il vit dans une famille monogame avec son épouse et leurs enfants à Kaï.
N’ayant pas fait l’école très tôt il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment les activités de boucher et de rôtisseur de petits ruminants et de bœufs depuis  maintenant 15 ans. 
Dans la matinée, c’est la vente de la viande crue et dans l’après midi c’est l’activité de rôtisseur qui commence jusqu’à des heures tardives dans la nuit. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activités, il le fait avec réussite. 
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt passé a été bien remboursé. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 1boeuf et 7 petits ruminants. Il s’approvisionne à Loulouni ville  et environnants. Il vend au comptant et souvent à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar C. is married and the father of two children (a boy and a girl). He was born around 1975 in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, part of the Kadiolo Prefecture, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in Kaï. Not having attended school, he was attracted from an early age by revenue-generating activities, and for the past 15 years has been a butcher and roaster of small ruminants and beef. The mornings are devoted to the sale of fresh meat, and the roasting activity begins in the afternoon until late at night. He succeeds well in his business, thanks to his years of experience. This is his second collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, the first having been fully reimbursed. With his loan he will buy one ox and seven small ruminants. He gets his supplies from Loulouni and the surrounding area. He sells for cash and often on credit (wholesale and retail) to both men and women customers. He expects an average monthly income of 105,000 FCFA of which part will be used to increase his working capital. The remainder will be put into savings as his ambition is to build a home in the town of Sikasso.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oxen and small ruminants

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is married with four children and all her children go to school. The family resides in and rents a house where they stay with additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Sylivia owns a retail shop in Mengo Mackay selling all kinds of merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, bread, milk, soda and other cold drinks.  Besides this retail shop business, she also owns a boda-boda (motorcycle) which brings in additional income for the family. Sylivia works seven days a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, cooking oil and crates of soda and mineral water. Her monthly expenses includes utility bills, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital operations (tools for manufacturing furniture)

loans.name: Boya  Nestor

texts.fr: D. Boya  Nestor est né en 1968 et est marié à KOUAKANOU Anne. Le couple a sept enfants à charge, dont six sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Nestor s’est installé depuis quinze ans environs à Djèrègbé, sur la voie allant à Porto-Novo, où il vit avec sa famille. Le couple se partage les charges de la famille. Nestor a arrêté les études au cours secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Nestor exerce cette activité depuis dix ans, activité qui l’aide à subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Nestor sollicite pour une première fois, un concours financier auprès de ALIDé, afin d’acquérir certains équipements nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son atelier de coiffure, ce qui lui permettrait de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Plus tard, Nestor ambitionne ouvrir d’autres ateliers de coiffure, pour accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Boya Nestor was born in 1968 and is married to KOUAKANOU Anne. The couple is raising seven children, six of whom are their biological children. All the children are enrolled in school. About 15 years ago, Nestor settled in Djèrègbé, on the road to Porto-Novo, where he lives with his family. The couple share in supporting their family. Nestor left school at the secondary level, then learned barbering. He has been working at this business for 10 years; the income from it allows him to support his family only with great difficulty. Nestor is asking for a loan, for the first time, from ALIDé, so as to acquire certain necessary materials that will allow his barber shop to function better so that he can satisfy his clientele. Later on, Nestor would like to open other barber shops so as to grow his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clippers and adjustable chairs

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Preaek Anhchanh village in Kandal province. Mr. Sophea S. has been selected as the group leader. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 


Mr. Sophea S. is 29 years old. He is a motorbike taxi driver. He has a problem in that his motorbike is broken. To rectify this situation, he is applying for a loan to fix his motorbike. 


His wife, Mrs. Gnagn Sem, is a seamstress in a garment factory who gets a low salary with which to support her family. He has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the youngest is one year old.

loans.use: To fix his motorbike

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. He is 38 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Rene owns and operates a business providing motorsikad or habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old. He is married and has one child who is 8 years old. Joseph is commonly known in the business of selling men's jeans and t-shirts.  He has been in this business for about 10 years, and the hours of his business are from 6 am to 7 pm daily.

Joseph is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With the use of this loan, Joseph hopes that he will be able to increase the profits of his business. These profits will allow him to ensure the security of his business, as well as create many other sources of income. In addition, Joseph will continue providing better care for the future of his child.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Mercedes Nicolasa

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 62 años, su actividad es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 43 años que tiene que inicio pues gracias a su Mama, pues ella le ayudaba desde muy joven Mercedes llegaba muy contenta a atender a los clientes, fue así que ella obtuvo experiencia necesaria después fue que decide hacerse cargo del negocio, con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado dedicarse a esta actividad que es su medio de vida. El sueño de Mercedes es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de mangos, cocos, naranjas y otras frutas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 62 years old. Thanks to her mother she has been selling fruit and vegetables for over 43 years. When she was very young, she helped her mother. Mercedes came to be very pleased taking care of the customers. That is how she got the necessary experience. Later she decided to take charge of the business. In time she managed to devote herself to this activity, which is her way of earning a living. Mercedes’ dream is to make improvements on her house. The requested loan is to buy mangoes, coconuts, oranges, and other fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George would like a loan to buy better breeds of cattle for his livestock business. He is 65 years old and is married with eleven children.

With pension money, George started his livestock marketing and hardware business after he had retired from formal employment with the civil service. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and owns the house in which he lives.

George dreams of acquiring a milk-processing plant which he says can be very profitable, given the fact that there is no other local milk processor in his area.

loans.use: To buy better breeds of cattle for his livestock business

loans.name: Mrs. Sar Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people make up a village bank located in Pou Roung village in Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Sar M., born in 1971, to be the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their businesses in this current year. 

Mrs. Sar M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Kha Chiv, is a recyclable goods seller and he is also a construction worker. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve his business, Mrs. Sar M. is requesting a loan to buy more recyclable goods to sell. She is a mother of three children who are all studying in school, and they are also helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable goods to sell

loans.name: Jose De Los Reyes

texts.es:
Don Jose de los Reyes de 62 años de edad es casado,vive en la zona # 4 de Nueva Guinea desde hace 30 años junto a su familia compuesta por sus 2 hijos mayores de edad y su esposa, la cual labora como conserje de una financiera, ambos son bien trabajadores y bien responsables con sus compromisos adquiridos. Don Jose  trabaja para el MARENA desde hace 11 años como guardabosque de las areas protegidas del municipio.

Està solicitando su 6to crèdito para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda como es arreglar una pared en cocina y pagar la mano de obra de la misma, su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José de los Reyes, 62, is married and has lived in Nueva Guinea’s Zona #4 neighborhood for 30 years with his family which is composed of his wife and two adult children. His wife works as a caretaker at a financial institution. Both are hard workers and quite responsible with acquired commitments. José has worked for MARENA (Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources) for 11 years as a forest ranger in protected areas of the municipality. He is asking for his 6th loan to invest in home improvements. He wants to repair a kitchen wall and pay labor costs for the project. His greatest wish is to provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a kitchen wall.

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Francisco es uno de los miembros del grupo Vecinas unidas 1 y 2. Las actividades economicas de estos microempresarios son las ventas de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos y carniceria, etc. Su familia está compuesta por  su esposa y dos hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es comprarse una camioneta y sus actividades favoritas son evangelizar y trabajar. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en la Peninsula de samana, una ciudad turistica en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Oceano atlantico y rica en recursos naturales.

Francisco está muy emocionado de recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. El ha tenido su negocio por casi 2 años, el cual inició comprando un cerdo para venderlo asado, en un puesto al lado de la carretera principal. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de diferentes tipos de carne, su negocio es una carniceria y planea utilizar sus ganancias para mejorar su vivienda, la cual espera poder construir en un tiempo no muy lejano. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida, y ofrecerle a su familia mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is one of the members of the Vecinas unidas 1 y 2 (United Neighbors 1 and 2) group.  The economic activities of these microbusinesspeople are sales of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, a butcher shop, etc.  Francisco's family is made up of his wife and two children.  He tells us that his most difficult challenge is buying a pickup truck, and his favorite activities are evangelizing and working.  This group is located in the Samana Peninsula, a developing tourist destination, bordered by the coasts of the Atlantic Ocean and rich in natural resources.

Francisco is very excited to receive his third loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off his previous loans satisfactorily and having taken a step in his business' growth.  He has had his business for almost two years, and he started it by buying a pig to sell roasted at a stand on the side of the main highway.  He is planning to invest his new loan in the purchase of different types of meat.  His business is a butcher shop, and he plans to use his earnings to improve his home, which he hopes to build soon.  His dream is to improve his family's quality of life and offer them greater stability.

loans.use: To buy several animals

loans.name: Marianita Isabel

texts.es:
Marianita Isabel V. R. tiene 48 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 22-11 anos. 

Marianita es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Marianita es maestra auxiliana y su esposo es profesor. Los dos cultivan pina también. Venden sus pinas en Babahoyo cada 1 ano y medio después de la cosecha. Solicita el crédito para comprar los líquidos y abonos para el mantenimiento de pina. Con el apoyo del préstamo, podría mejorar sus pinas. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es tener mas cultivos y empezar a sembrar cacao y maracuya, o lo que da la tierra. 

Le gusta jugar el basketball y el fútbol en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Marianita Isabel V. R. is 48 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Chillanes, located in the Bolívar province. She has 4 children aged 11 to 22.

Marianita is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos (The Pleasure of Being friends), a rural bank located 20 minutes far from the parish of San José del Tambo. 15 is the total number of its members, who mainly engage either in growing cocoa or in running small shops.

Marianita is a teaching assistant and her husband is a professor. They also grow pineapple. They sell their pineapples in Babahoyo every 1 and a half year after the harvest. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy the liquid fertilizers to preserve the pineapples. The support provided by the loan will help her improve her pineapples. Her dream for the next 5 years is to increase her crops and to begin planting cacao and passion fruit, whichever takes root on her land.

She likes playing basketball and soccer in her free time.

loans.use: To buy liquid fertilizers to preserve her pineapples.

loans.name: Zaib's Group

texts.en:
Zaib lives in a three-room brick house in Farid town which is a small housing colony of the city of Gujranwala. She moved here 10 years ago with her family. She is 41 years old and married to M. A. who is an employee in a factory earning a low income.  She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her elder son left his education after 10th class and started an embroidery business. He runs an embroidery shop in the market and makes good money from his work. Her other children are enrolled in a school and are getting their education.
 
Zaib supports her family by doing sewing. She is very talented in her art and receives a good number of orders every month. Her income allows her to pay the education expenses of her children. She also trains girls in her area in sewing skills. She has been training girls for over 5 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine that will help her train more girls and make more income.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year she proved herself a responsible client who always paid installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Zaib.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine to train girls in sewing

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Sabina B..  She is married and has one child, aged 3.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizer for her farm.  

In the future, Sabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.  Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Somnang

texts.en: Somnang K. is 29 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She and her family live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh.  Somnang and her husband are garment factory workers. They do not have transportation to get work so they pay a lot of money to commute. Somnang is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional fertelizer and seeds to raise. Fe is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and crop maintenance. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Bertha Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Bertha L. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por el sector del Cristo del Consuelo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por mantener su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es muy hermoso, su gente es cordial y amable.
 
Doña Bertha tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 5, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian. Su esposo es de profesión gasfitero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Bertha tiene un taller propio de costura, actividad que la realiza hace 6 años, para tener su taller estudió y  tiene el titulo de maestra de confecciones industriales. Confecciona ropa de niño, camisetas, etc., no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y labora de lunes a sábado.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para su negocio como  tela, hilo etc. Su meta es tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
Bertha L. is a member of the community bank, Nueva Juventud (New Youth). She lives in the Cristo del Consuelo area of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for having preserved its culture and traditions. Its historic downtown is very beautiful and the people of Cuenca are friendly and kind.

Bertha is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children who are five, four and two years old. Her elder two daughters are in school. Her husband works as a plumber. They don't own a house which is why they are renting their home.
 
Bertha has her own sewing shop and has worked in this field for six years. She studied in order to have her own shop and she is a certified teacher of industrial garment production. She makes children's clothing and shirts etc. She works long hours and works from Monday through Saturday.

This is the second loan she will have received through the community bank. She plans to use the funds to purchase raw materials for her business such as fabric and thread etc. Her goal is to have a bigger shop one day.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, closures etc.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 31 years old. Vanessa is married and has three children aged 9, 5 and 2. She is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops. Her husband, who is also a farmer, earns extra through "habal-habal" (motorcycle transportation). Vanessa dreams for her children to finish their studies and have bright futures.

Vanessa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vanessa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vanessa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia D. C. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Arsenia is married and has 4 school-aged children. She makes a living buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arsenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Arsenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan, her third, was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arsenia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: So

texts.en: So P. is 59-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Tom province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparent. So P. uses this farmland for growing rice crops, and she has been planting her crop in the dry-season rice field. Her husband assists her in the business. The couple is married and has four children, four of whom are single and still living under their care, while the other one is married. Two of their children are sewing workers in the garment factory. Because their farm is outside of a watering system, So P. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary O. is a 49-year-old lady from Pap Onditi, just a few kilometres from Kisumu city.  She is married to James and they have four children between the ages of 24 and 18.

Rosemary is a tailor and has been in this business for the past eight years.  She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a client who has benefited from the loans.  

Rosemary will use the entire loan amount to buy materials to add to her stock to enable her to serve her clients well. Her monthly income is KES. 13,000 and she is optimistic that this will increase after getting the loan.

Her dream is to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Geronides

texts.en:
Geronides Z. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Geronides is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns & operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals, like adobo & bulalo, in the local community. Geronides has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Geronides joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Geronides is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Geronides from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en:
Juliette lives in the Cocotomey district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. Together with her husband Franck, she looks after their thee children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past 6 years, Juliette has run a general store in her neighbourhood. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. She hopes to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to restock her shop.

loans.name: Mirian Yaneth

texts.es: Mirian Yaneth Q. T. de 36 años de edad, vive en casa de su suegra con compañero de vida, dos hijos y una cuñada. Mirian Tiene un negocio de Venta de ropa usada ó de segunda, en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. Ubicado en el Centro del Municipio de Mejicanos del Departamento de San Salvador. Una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes del municipio. El puesto de Mirian es muy visitado ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan y en este lugar, la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que  ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más fardos de ropa usada y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir Como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos.
texts.en: Mirian Yaneth Q. T., 36, lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her life partner, two children and a sister-in-law.  Mirian has a business selling second hand, used clothes where she stocks an assortment of clothing items like: skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. located in downtown Mejicanos, San Salvador Department.  This is a heavily trafficked area that’s well known by local residents.  Mirian’s stand is quite popular because people always find what they are looking for there: kindness and good service which is the most important.  Her dream is that her business grows so she’s decided to do a loan in INTEGRAL to buy more bundles of used clothes and have a wider variety of items available like: pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and shorts, among others.  The goal is to attract more buyers and attain a higher sales level as well as higher income.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa works hard to support four children. She is married and has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Milagrosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Amado Gilberto

texts.es:
Amado de 52 años,es soltero, tiene casa propia  de material noble que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz.  Sus pobladores se dedican exclusivamente al comercio al por mayor y menor de todo tipo de productos.

Amado se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces como queques, suspiros, alfajores de distintos tamaños desde hace 4 años, cuenta con un horno artesanal, su negocio lo tiene e su domicilio para seguridad y comodidad de Amado, así puede atender a su clientela a la hora que sea.  Sus ingresos que obtien son para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su negocio.

Al ver que su negocio a ido creciendo a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus dulces.  Desta manera Amado puede seguir vendiendo su producto y como es conocido por sus ricos dulces que vende lo recomiendan  mucho y con las ganacias que obtenga  puede pagar su préstamo, mejorar su nivel de vida y su negocio, de una manera puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Amado, age 52, is single and has his own house, which is made out of noble materials and has basic utilities.  It is in the district of José Leonardo Ortíz.  The local population exclusively works in wholesale and retail commerce with all types of products.

Amado has been making and selling cakes, pastry and "alfajores" in different sizes for four years.  He has an artisan oven and runs his business out of his home for safety and ease, allowing him to attend to customers at any time.  His income is used to improve his quality of life and business.

Since demand has been growing he requested a loan of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy ingredients to make his products.  This way Amado can continue selling his products and use the profits to pay back the loan on time and responsibly, as well as improve his lifestyle and business.  Amado is well known for his delicious pastry and customers recommend him frequently.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make pastry.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde vive en el estado de veracruz en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. Doña Martilde tiene la edad de 39 años, solo estudio la secundaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Alejandro el cual tiene un lavado de autos, ellos tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son mujeres de nombres Monserrat de 14 años que asiste a la secundaria y Valeria de 12 que asiste a la secundaria, y un niño de nombre Alejandro de 4 años que asiste al preescolar.

Doña Matilde nos platica que hace mas de 2 años en la primaria de sus hijos la invitaron a vender antojitos mexicanos (gorditas, empanadas, tortas, tacos y tostadas) en la hora del recreo y ella se dio cuenta que era una buena oportunidad para ganar un poco de dinero y asi ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ademas de que puede estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos.

Ella necesita este credito para invetirlo en la compra de insumos (maiz, frijol, aceite, tortillas, queso, crema, tomates, chiles, cebollas y carne ) para la elaboracion de sus antojitos mexicanos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio cresca dia a dia un poco mas para poder seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y en un futuro sus hijos puedan estudiar una profesion y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Matilde lives in the town of Tierra Blanca, better known as the “Bride of the Sun”, in the State of Veracruz. The area is known for its livestock industry and the abundant summer heat that can reach as high as 54°C. Doña Matilde is 39 years old and has a high school education. She is married to Sr. Alejandro, who owns a car wash business. They have three children, including two daughters named Monserrat (age 14) and Valeria (age 12) who are in high school and a son named Alejandro (age 4) who is in preschool.

Doña Matilde says that more than two years ago, an elementary school invited her to sell Mexican street food, such as gorditas, empanadas, “tortas” (sandwiches), tacos, and tostadas during recess. She says this was a good opportunity to earn a little bit of money to help her husband with the household expenses. It also gave her the chance to be closer to her children.

Matilde needs this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies such as corn, beans, oil, tortillas, cheese, cream, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, and meat for preparing Mexican street food.

Doña Matilde hopes that this loan will help her business grow a little bit each day so that she can continue helping her husband with the household expenses. In the future, she wants her children to study so that they can pursue a profession and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing traditional street food.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a married woman with three children. She is 42 years old and has had a food selling business for three years. Lily sells fruits such as mango and banana and also some vegetables to the people in her community. She is grateful that her business is improving because she obtains many customers.

Lily is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell.

In the future, Lily hopes to maintain her buy and sell business to supply the needs of her college students. Lily is doing everything to increase her profit so that she can send her other children to a higher level of education and to pay her obligation to the Microfinance Institution.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Freeland

texts.en:
Freeland is 27 years old and single. He earns about PHP 5,000 per month as a hog-raiser working in the Philippines, which he has been doing for almost 4 years.  He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise, as well as hog feed.

In the future, Freeland hopes to improve and strengthen this business since this is one of the sources of his family’s income. He hopes that someday he will be able to start another kind of business in order to help his parents in financing the education of his younger brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise, as well as hog feed

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 29-year-old farmer from the village of Sartichala, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Nana, his mother and grandmother. She is retired. Zurab’s mother works as a cook in the same village. 

Zurab has five milk cows. He produces cheese and sells it in the village. The total average income of the family is 500 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Zurab plans to purchase one more milk cow. He will have 20% more cheese and the same increase in income from his dairy farm. He will use the increase in income to purchase more household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 5 and 13 years old. She takes care of one additional child.  Her business is well organized. She sells meat and she has one employee in her business. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Jacqueline operates her business from 7 am to 7 pm every day except on the weekend. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy a large quantity of meat for resale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of meat to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. Four of her children are currently in school. Dorothy has had a health clinic for 6 years.         

To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase drugs for her patients for resale. With the help of the loan, Dorothy hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Dorothy is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business such that she has managed to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase drugs for resale

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el octavo ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2008. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos para sus familias e hijos, pero más allá de lo económico, también les gustaría ir creciendo en lo personal y como grupo. 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Emiliana, ella tiene 3 hijos todos mayores, está casada y su marido tiene un sueldo fijo como empleado. Ella tiene un kiosko en su domicilio, en el cual trabaja todo el día, comenta que tiene muchas ganancias ya que es un negocio rentable, desea poder seguir con el negocio e ir agrandándolo de manera gradual. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, cigarrillos y demás que vende en su kiosko ya que siempre tiene mucha demanda. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, ya que de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnacion, and arose as a result of promotions carried out in the area. The group is in its eighth loan cycle and has been working with La Fundacion since 2008. They got together with the intention of generating a better income for their families and children, but beyond financial matters they would also like to keep growing personally and as a group. 

One of the group members is Emiliana. She has three children, all grown, she is married, and her husband is a salaried employee. She has a kiosk in her home where she works all day. She says she earns good money, and now that it's a profitable business she'd like to be able to continue with it and gradually make it grow. 

She is asking for the loan to buy juices, sodas, cigarettes and other things that she sells in her kiosk since there is always a lot of demand for them. She has high hopes for this loan since receiving it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy juice, sodas, cigarettes, and so on to supply her kiosk.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 44 años, es natural de Cullpa y en la actualidad vive en su misma zona en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. El negocio al que se dedica, es la venta de comida, actividad que ha realizado durante 7 años. En ocasiones sus hijos la ayudan en el negocio, tanto en la preparación como en la atención. Por otro lado, ella también ofrece el servicio de bufett para diversos eventos sociales, eso le genera ingresos extras. Del mismo modo ofrece también ropa, ya que vio conveniente este negocio y del cual desea abastecerse de más mercadería. Para ella su filosofía de trabajo es el orden y esto la favorece para tener un control adecuado de sus cuentas, es por eso que las actividades que realiza son rentables, permitiéndole tener ganancias. Es su crédito número 14 con MFP, tiene varios años de trabajo con prestamos y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos que ha favorecido no solo a ella sino también a su grupo de las cuales se siente satisfecha. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de comida asismimos comprará ropa de temporada de acuerdo al pedido que le han solicitado sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nancy is 44 years old and a native of Cullpa. She currently lives in the same area with her husband and four children. Nancy has been selling food for seven years. Her children occasionally help her with the business, both with preparing food and attending to customers. In addition, Nancy provides buffet services for different social events to earn extra income. She also sells clothing because she saw it as a convenient business, which is why she wants to stock up on more merchandise. Her work philosophy is to keep everything in order because it makes it easier for her to have control over her bills. This explains why her businesses have been profitable and have allowed her to generate an income.

This is her 14th loan with MFP. Nancy has worked with loans for many years and every time she has demonstrated that she is punctual with her payments. Not only does she pay on time, but so does the rest of her group, which pleases her. The money she requested will be used to buy nonperishable ingredients for preparing her food. She will also buy seasonal clothing based on the orders she has received from her customers.

loans.use: to buy nonperishable ingredients for preparing her dishes and seasonal clothing for completing her customers' orders.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old. She is a single mother of two school-going children. She operates a salon in Nairobi. She has been in the business for the past 23 years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This is her first loan. She will use the amount to buy two dryers and two steamers. In the future, she aspires to open another salon in Westlands.

loans.use: To buy two dryers and two steamers.

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.ru:
Tunzala 33 qoda. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Aybasanli vmeste so svoim mujem id etmi. Ona zamujem i iemyet 2 detey. 
Uje 5 let ona iemyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji raznix tovarov( kraski dlya volos, zakolki, bujiteriyu, svechki batareyki i t.d). Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit noviy tovar dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Tunzala is 33 years old.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Aybasanli village of the Fuzuli region together with her husband and children.  She is married and has two children.  She has been involved in selling various merchandise (hair color, hair accessories, jewelry, candles, batteries, etc.) in her store for five years.  Tanzala currently needs 2000 AZN to buy new merchandise for sale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married and blessed with three children. For the last five years, he has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. He also practices tea farming to earn extra income. Paul has been able to manage the business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He dream for the future is to become a milk supplier in his region. He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 23 years old and single.  He supports one member of his family.  David practices farming.  He has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

David has borrowed a loan of 60,000 KES from KADET Ltd. as his second term loan after repaying the previous one successfully, and he hopes to use this amount to purchase farm inputs like tools, fertilizers and seeds. 

The profits will be used to to expand the farm and repay back the loan. He hopes to prosper in his farm and also have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is 19 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel. She is married with no children.

To earn a living, Claire has a fish-selling business. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Claire has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Claire has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Claire would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Almagul

texts.en: Almagul is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chauffeur, her elder child is a student, and her younger one goes to kindergarden. She started her cosmetic products retail business in 2010 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is going so well that she couldn't meet the customers' demand. Since the demand is high, she decided to rent another counter and buy even more products to sell. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
Julián de 42 años de edad, es un hombre laborioso. Soltero y sin hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres, de quienes cuida. Su casa se encuentra en el Pueblo Pardo en el distrito de Chanchamayo. El trabajo de Julián es incesante. Cuenta con terrenos agrícolas en su zona, donde produce frutos cítricos como: Tanyarinas, carambolas, naranjas, limones, etc. “Me conviene sembrar tanyarinas, su precio es mayor, cada java la vendo a 10 soles”, comenta. Además menciona que, gracias a su estrategia de venta que consiste en captar compradores que visiten sus propios sembríos, se ahorra considerablemente el pago del traslado.
Así también se dedica al servicio de transporte. Con un carro de propiedad de sus padres, recorre la ruta: La Merced – San Ramón y viceversa, obteniendo de 60 a 70 soles al día. Esta actividad la realiza cuando cesan las labores en el campo. Sus planes para el futuro no están lejanos, pues comprará un terreno de cultivo para incrementar su producción de las tan dulces y solicitadas tanyarinas. Éste sería el préstamo número 7 que, con su ayuda, obtendría de MFP, por lo tanto se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Caramboleros”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que se siente a gusto y contento por ser parte de él.
De recibir el dinero, lo invertirá en la compra de un sierra a motor para acelerar y hacer mas llevadero el trabajo, estima que el precio asciende a 1600 soles.
texts.en:
Julián, 42, is a hard-working man. He is single and does not have any children. He lives with his parents, who he takes care of. Their house is located in the village of Pardo, in Chanchamayo district. Julián's work is never-ending. He owns farmland in the area, where he grows citrus fruits like tangerines, starfruit, oranges, limes, etc. 

"It serves me well to plant tangerines because their price is better. I sell each crate for 10 nuevos soles," Julián notes. Besides that, he mentions that thanks to his sales strategy -- which consist of attracting buyers who visit his land -- he saves considerably on transportation costs.

He also works in transportation service. He covers the La Merced - San Ramón route and vice-versa in a car owned by his parents. He earns 60 to 70 nuevos soles a day doing this work, which he performs after his work in the fields.

His plans for the future are not far off. He will buy a piece of land to increase his production of the sweetest and most requested tangerines. This will be his seventh loan, which, with your help, he will obtain through Microfinanzas Prisma. He promises to be punctual with his repayments.

"Los Caramboleros" ["The Starfruits"] is the name of his communal bank, which he feels pleased and content to be a part of.

Upon receiving the loan money, Julián will invest it in the purchase of a motor saw to speed up his work and make it more bearable. He estimates that the price comes to 1,600 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy a motor saw

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Inocencio is a farmer who lives in Carilucud, Solana where he grows rice to sell. His rice field is located 200 meters along his house. He has been planting rice for almost eight years. He got involved in this type of work because he only finished high school and has no other source of income besides farming. He wants to sustain his family's needs so he works hard to gain income from his farming business.

Right now he lacks funds so he is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Inocencio aims to send his five children to college to earn a degree so that someday they can live successfully.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Monserrate Soledad

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Monserrate, Tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 19, 17 y 8 años de edad, los mayores ya son independientes, el menor estudia en escuela y a es quien vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres en un mercado de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Trabajan desde las 05h00  hasta las tres de la  tarde, ella le ayuda con el negocio mientras él se desplaza a otro mercado de mayoristas a comprar más de los productos que necesita para darle a  sus clientes lo mejor ya que esta es la clave para tener muchos clientes, ofreciendo un buen producto, limpio y al precio justo, llevan 4 años dedicados a  esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas y verduras para su negocio. La señora Monserrate es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Unión y Solidaridad meet bimonthly in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.  

Here we meet Señora Monserrate who is 38 years old and is in a common law marriage that has produced three children ages 19, 17 and 8.  The older two are adults and the youngest attends school and lives at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  

Together with her husband they have a business selling fruits and vegetables at a market in the city of Portoviejo.  They work from 5:00 am until 3:00 in the afternoon.  She works the market while he travels to other wholesale markets to buy more products that they need in order to offer their customers the best.   The key to having a lot of customers is offering a good, clean product at a fair price.  They have been doing this for 4 years.  
  
The loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables for their business.  Señora Monserrate is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because the interest rates are lower than other loan institutions.  

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel de 32 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 9 años; allí tiene un taller de ebanistería , actividad que aprendió mientras trabajaba en un negocio, con estas mismas características, durante 10 años, para 5 años después independizarse y comprar sus propias  sus herramientas y maquinarias e iniciar su microempresa de la cual vive él y su familia. Su meta mas adelante, es tener una máquina industrial  y trabajar especialmente las puertas,  para distribuirlas semanalmente a través de vendedores. En su taller trabaja muchas líneas, como camas, comedores, estantería etc; En el taller de Gabriel, sus clientes mandan a hacer sus productos y le dan un porcentaje del precio del producto, para que éste de inicio a su trabajo. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo, es insuficiente para lograr incrementar su negocio y responder a su clientela en las épocas de mayor rotación de los productos que Gabriel vende. Esta es la razón por la cual se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materias primas e insumos con su primer credikiva, que es también el primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización; con este inversión logrará hacer nuevos diseños y exhibirlos en su taller.
texts.en: Gabriel is 32 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with his companion and their three children ages 1 to 9.  There he has a cabinet maker's shop, an activity that he learned while working in a business with these same characteristics. He worked with the previous business for 10 years, and has been independent for five years, having purchased his own tools and machines to start his own micro business, which is how he and his family live now.  His future goal is to have an industrial machine and to work particularly on doors in order to distribute them weekly via vendors.  In his shop he works on many different pieces, including beds, dining room tables, shelves etc.  In Gabriel's shop, his clients order products and give him a percentage of the price of the product so that he can get started on his business.  Currently his capital is not sufficient to be able to grow the business and to respond to the needs of his clientele in the periods of highest sales for his products.  For that reason he approached Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, a Kiva field partner, in order to buy raw materials and agricultural products with his first Kiva loan.  This is also the first financing that he has done with this organization.  With this investment he will succeed in making new designs and exhibiting them in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and agricultural products

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is 30 years old and single. She has been operating a yogurt business for the past five years.
