She started as a farmer, and after saving enough, she ventured into her current business. She has a challenge of her customers not paying on time, and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Moreen needs a loan to purchase a yogurt packing machine.

loans.use: to buy a yogurt packing machine.

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
Beata is single and has three children. Living in deteriorated housing, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to improve her house by purchasing building materials to change her weakened zinc roof and broken wooden walls as well as a new door and window.

Beata is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost five years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Trabajando para el mañana (Working for the future) in one of the rural villages in Samana, where she has received six loans to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products, 

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and  show fidelity in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while running their businesses loans and attending groups meetings.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, wood, nails, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Born in 1970 at Tsévié, Madam Jeanne A. is a mother of two (02) children. Fatherless very early, her mother didn’t have the sufficient means to assure for her a long time her school education. What puts her to abandon the school at form3. She was afterward recuperated by an aunt who has assured her was already repaid. the dress making trading in the mind to be able to provide for her brothers and sisters needs. Married to a building electrician, he has not assured her the must take care of her children, brothers and sisters who are living with them. But thank to her dynamism and activity control, she has much clients who make her trust. To overcome this situation, she had requested and got a credit which Madam Jeanne A. requests today, a credit of $950 which will allow her to equip her workshop with two new sewing machines and to initiate the haberdashery items selling which miss in the area kpali. She could then make income to provide for her family needs.

Née en 1970 à Tsévié, Madame A. Jeanne est mère de deux (02) enfants. Orpheline de père très tôt, sa maman n’a pas eu les moyens suffisants pour lui assurer pendant longtemps sa scolarisation. Ce qui fait qu’elle a abandonnée les études en classe de 4ème. Elle a ensuite été récupérée par une tante qui lui a assuré sa formation en couture dans le souci de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses frères et sœurs. Mariée à un électricien bâtiment, celui-ci ne lui a pas assuré la joie au foyer. Dans cette situation, elle doit s’occuper de ses enfants, ses frères et sœurs qui sont chez eux. Mais grâce à son dynamisme et à sa maîtrise de l’activité, elle a beaucoup de clientes et qui lui font confiance. Pour sortir de cette situation, elle avait sollicité et obtenu un crédit qu’elle avait déjà remboursé. Jeannette sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $950 qui va lui permettre d’équiper son atelier de deux nouvelles machines à coudre et d’initier la vente des articles de mercerie qui manquent dans le quartier Kpali. Elle pourra alors dégager un revenu conséquent pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to equip her workshop with sewing machines and to sell the haberdashery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Yuma intends to purchase high quality seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Mrs. Keng S. is 32 years old mother of 5 children lives in Kampongcham province, Cambodia. She grows crops and sells them to the market, where her husband can makes around $2.5/day in revenue from driving a horse-cart ( instead of motor-taxi and tuk tuk) to transport passengers from and to the village. Horse -cart taxi is very popular for the habitants in this village.
Moreover, S. hopes the loan will help her purchasing a rice mill in order to generate her crops in to rice to sell to retails 
In the future, she plans to increase her income by purchasing another part of land to invest much more crops and sell them to the wholesaler at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a rice mill for her agriculture.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos is a hard-working, enterprising man who started his business a year ago so that he could have a better future. He buys and sells tostadas and tortillas, and as of today he has an extensive clientele. He understands the business very well, so he has had great success. He hopes to keep expanding the business and increasing sales daily. He hopes his business will help him improve his situation and his quality of life.

Juan Carlos is asking for $925 to stock his store, now that demand is increasing day by day. He expects to repay the loan in six months. He is very grateful for your support in helping him expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos es un hombre soltero muy trabajador y emprendedor, que hace un año decidió empezar con su negocio para poder tener un mejor futuro, él se dedica a la compra y venta de tostadas y tortillas y a la fecha tiene una gran cartera de clientes, él conoce muy bien el mercado en el que se encuentra y por ello es que ha tenido éxito con su negocio y desea seguir creciendo y mejorar cada día con sus ventas. Con su negocio espera mejorar su situación y calidad de vida.

Juan Carlos esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar insumos para su negocio y continuar con su crecimiento ya que su demanda está aumentando día a día, él ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To stock his food store

loans.name: Evo

texts.en: Evo is one of the most determined members of Vaitele fou 2 center.  Being a divorced, single mother of one child, is the drive behind her tendency to become financially independent.  In order to support herself and her child,  she sells goods at the flea market, e.g. clothes and handicrafts, which gives her a profit of $44 daily, six days a week.  And she earns extra money every Sunday with her food vending business where she caters for the village people by selling meat pies and apple pies. She is now looking at moving up to the next loan step.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Pilar owns a luncheonette where she sells drinks, cookies and other ready-to-eat foods. Her shop is located at the busy intersection of two major streets in San Ignacio. This business is her livelihood and has helped her sustain her family. Maria, now 50 years old, is married with two daughters, one of whom helps her in her shop and the other is now married and lives with her husband.

Like many women in Paraguay, Maria worked in Argentina for a number of years. The economic situation is good enough in Argentina to allow these women to work and save money, rather than living day to day. It is in this way that Maria was able to save the money to open her store by renting some space. She is also grateful to her husband who helped maintain the family during this time. Today she lives in her own house in a preferred neighborhood in San Ignacio, Paraguay.

With the credit she has requested, Maria will repair a small-refrigerated cart, which will be of much use during the hot summer months.

loans.use: To repair a small-refrigerated cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an assortment of sewing materials and ready-made clothes

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang Sokunthy, 34, is the mother of two children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To aid in meeting her family’s expenses, she runs a stand selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area and typically makes on average around $7 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a fortune-teller and generally makes around $2 each day.

Thang will use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs. Additionally, she will buy poultry and pigs to breed for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba S. is 36 years old, and is married with two sons. Unfortunately, her husband is unemployed, so she is the main bread-winner in the family.

Matluba sells sugar in the local market. She and her elder son travel to the neighboring country of Uzbekistan to purchase the sugar. As any mother does, she dreams that her sons can get a higher education, therefore she needs to work hard and to make efficient profits. She does make efficient profits, and her business brings in a considerable income to the family.

Matluba is requesting 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 4 months. She plans to increase her working capital, improving her working conditions, and pay the fee for her son's education. Matluba has proved to be a reliable client and promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Increase working capital, improve the business, and partially pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara has been selling basic necessities ever since she first set up her small shop out of her humble home. In addition to this business she also sells firewood upon request. These two activities have enabled her family to improve their quality of life. Clara's main desire is to continue working so that her family can accomplish their goals. Your support will help this selfless mother acquire a larger quantity of products and enlarge her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Clara desde hace tiempo se ha dedicado a la comercialización de artículos de primera necesidad desde la pequeña bodeguita que instaló en su humilde domicilio, con esta actividad además de la venta de leña que realiza esporádicamente y bajo pedidos ha logrado que su familia goce de mayores beneficios y su deseo es continuar con su labor para que estos puedan cumplir cada una d las metas que se han trazado. Vuestro importante aporte servirá para que esta abnegada madre adquiera mayor cantidad de productos y para la ampliación de su pequeña bodeguita.

loans.use: Purchase of more basic necessities and to enlarge a small shop

loans.name: Fatha Mohammad

texts.en: Fatha Mohammad lives in District 5 of Kabul Afghanistan, where he is  the married father of three children, two daughters and one son. Fatha has been involved in agriculture for more than five years, during which time he has worked hard to further his business. He now needs to expand his business to better provide for his family, and is therefore requesting a loan to increase his agricultural stock so as to cultivate all of his land.  Fatha thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand his agricultural stock

loans.name: Obekai Traders Group

texts.en:
Charles K. is an average father aged 36 and married with 3 children.  

He has been running his business for two years.  He got his capital from small savings commonly referred to as a “merry-go-round” from a local welfare group.  His business is located next to a bus terminal, and most of his clients are people traveling from one destination to another.   

Charles uses the little profits he gets from his business to feed, clothe, and educate his children.
 With the help of his loan, Charles will be able to diversify his business and start selling fresh fruit juice along with the grocer business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his grocery business

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en: Gulom D. is 23 years old and lives in Asht, Tajikistan.  His father was a schoolteacher, and Gulom hopes that his son will also one day be a schoolteacher.  Gulom was unable to train as a teacher, however, because he served in the army and then started a livestock business when he returned, about three years ago.  Having repaid a previous loan which allowed him to buy milk cows and rams and thereby start his business Gulom is now applying for a loan of $825 for eight months to purchase a bull.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mr. Yem N. owns a small rice farm in the Angk Taley Village in Kampong Speu Province. One of Mr. Yem N.’s cows died, recently, so now he does not have enough draft animals. Thus, Mr. Yem N. decided to request a loan to purchase a new cow to replace the deceased one used to plow his field. Mr. Yem N. is a widower with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a car driver whom makes only a small income. A fourth child is attending the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study.  Previously, Mr. Yem N. had obtained a loan from AMK to start a poultry business. Last year, his wife needed an operation on her throat and Mr. Yem N. spent $1000 in medical bills; unfortunately, his wife died because of this disease.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to replace the deceased one used to plow his field.

loans.name: La Montañita Group

texts.es:
We are all part of a group called La Montanita, located in the community of Montanita in the municipality of El Paraiso.  One of the good qualities of our group is that we know each other very well and we've worked together for a long time.   This is important as we all work with a great deal of integreity.  

 We work making and selling traditional snacks,  called rosquillas, in our community. People typically eat them for breakfast, or in the evening with a strong coffee.  Our products are very popular and we sell them around the community and in public offices and private homes, shops and the municipal market.  

 We are requesting a loan so that we can make more products and better meet the demand of our customers.    As we grow our business and increase our income, we'll be able to provide a better life for our children.   Thank you. 

nosotras somo el grupo la Montañita, ubicado en la comunidad de la Montañita, el Chichicaste, municipio de El Paraiso, una cualidad positiva de nuestro grupo es que nos conocemos muy bien y hemos trabajados unidos siempre y lo mas importante es que somo muy honrrados en todas nuestras actividades.

nosotras nos dedicamos a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, como ud deben saber la rosquilla en nuestra comunidad y en la ciudad de Danli es muy comun ya que es como el pan tipico de nuestras costumbres, y este tipo de alimento se consume en el desayuno y en la cena con un buen cafe negro caliente.

nuestro producto es muy popular y muy vendido, nosotras lo elaboramos y salimos a venderlo de manera ambulante en diferentes oficinas publicas y privadas, pulperias, mercaditos y tambien lo vendemos en el mercado municipal de Danli.

en estos momentos necesitamos la ayuda monetaria para poder tener mas produccion ya que la demanda es muy grande y para nosotras es un reto poder cubrir con todas las exigencias de nuestros clientes. por tal razon estamos solicitando la ayuda, y con las ganancias que obtengasmos podremos tener una mejor calidad de vida para nuestros hijos.
gracias

 Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients and materials necessary to make more of the traditional snacks they sell.  The income from this business enables them to take care of their children.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil (his father is pictured) was born in 1981. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Djabrayil region in Azerbaijan and he has settled in Khirdalan town. He has run this business for 8 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy foods for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy foods

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en:
Repeka L., 36, is married with five children. She has many years of experience selling pork Buns & Samoan foods. She sells her goods to the public and local villagers three days per week.

Repeka has had two previous loans with SPBD. With this loan, she hopes to buy meats, flour, onions, yeast, bananas, taro and coconuts to expand her business. She will also use the money to purchase materials to repair the roof of their home. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 340 Tala (~141 USD). SPBD loans are Repeka's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase meats, flour, onions, yeast,bananas, taro and coconuts to expand the business

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Каримова Нигина  жительница города Турсунзаде. Работает на рынке «Саховат» , который находится в городе Душанбе. Занимается торговлей мужской одежды. Опыт в сфере бизнеса составляет уже 4 года. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 13 месяцев.Возраст 26 лет и она не замужем. Живет с родителями и помогает обеспечивать свою семью.
texts.en:
Nigina K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, married, lives with her parents and helps support her family. She works at the Sahovat market located in Dushanbe. She sells men’s clothes and has been in this business for 4 years. Nigina plans to obtain the loan in order to bring in seasonal goods. She will repay the loan within 13 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Шарипова Майсара проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 34 года , разведена и имеет двоих детей. Три года назад после развода начала свой бизнес. Пригнала один автомобиль на продажу , так и бизнес начал расти . Сейчас у нее две машины и она хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы добавить в товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Maisara S. lives in the Varzob District. She is 34 years old, divorced, and has two children. After her divorce three years ago she started her own business. She brought one car to her city to sell, and from there her business began to grow. Now she has two cars and would like a loan to add to sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to Sales Volume

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Thuý năm nay 36 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng hai con nhỏ tại thị trấn Lương Bằng huyện Kim động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Chị Thuý tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 1999 hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho 3 mẹ con chị là từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 15.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua giống cây bưởi về trồng, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua phân bón phục vụ cho việc trồng trọt của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T. is 36 years old. She lives with her two young children at the town of Luong Bang, Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Mrs. Hoang joined TYM fund in 1999. The main income for Mrs. Hoang and her two children, which comes from livestock raising and farming, totals at 2,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to partly invest in pomelo seedlings for planting. The rest of the fund would go to fertilizer for her farming business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and Planting

loans.name: Reynalda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Reynalda tiene 43 años de edad, habita en Hialeah II etapa en la ciudad de Managua, casada y con tres hijos de 13, 14,16 años ambos niños estudian en el colegio del barrio, su esposo es comerciante y administra un kiosco de un colegio, en donde vende comida rápida, la Sra. Reynalda tiene una pulpería y vende en su casa por las noches fritanga,  tiene nueve años de experiencia, inicio con capital propio ofertando pocos productos, y ha venido creciendo y mejorando su situación económica de su familia, con esta solicitud es la novena que ha sido de gran apoyo para su negocio, con este préstamo quiere comprar productos para surtir la pulpería y ofertar a sus clientes la variedad. Sus planes a corto plazo es  comercializar  nuevas variedades de productos y obtener nuevos clientes, a si como dar educación  y un futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Reynalda is 43 years old. She lives in Hialeah II Etapa, in the city of Managua. She is married and has three children of 13, 14, and 16 years of age. These children study in the neighbourhood high school. Her husband is in sales and operates a kiosk in a school, where he sells fast food. Doña Reynalda has a general store and from her home, she sells fritanga (grill food) in the evenings. She has nine years of experience. She began with her own capital, selling a few products, and has continued growing and improving the economic situation of her family. This request is the ninth that have been a huge help for her business. With this loan she wants to buy products to stock the general store and offer her clients variety. Her short term plans are to sell new product varieties and to get new clients, and so give education and a future to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to stock Doña Reynalda's general store

loans.name: Kidenana

texts.en:
Kidenana K. sells maize flour and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Kidenana is 50 years old and a widow.   She has 2 children who attend school. A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education,  and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She is a hairdresser and sells hair cream and hair extensions. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair products to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase hair cream and hair products to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo B. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica a su actividad agropecuaria en el municipio de El Sauce donde a diario se esfuerza grandemente para lograr salir adelante y suplir las necesidades de su familia.

Con pocos recursos inició su negocio y a lo largo que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de un novillo para llevar a cabo su actividad y así continuar brindando las condiciones de vida necesarias para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo B. is a very hardworking gentleman that works in farming in the town of El Sauce. He makes a great effort daily to get ahead and meet the needs of his family.

He started his business with few resources. Over time he has supported his immediate family made up of his two small children. The reason he is waiting in Ceprodel is because he requested a loan to buy a young bull to carry out his work. This way he could continue to offer his family the necessary conditions for living.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a young bull

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience K. is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of one child who is breastfeeding. She has been sewing for four years now. She is a specialist in female wear. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work, Patience has two apprentices whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with a quality education. Patience belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Cry for life’.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has farmed ever since her childhood and even since she got married, it is their major source of income. They plant rice and vegetables; however, their income is not enough to meet the needs of their family. Because of this, Nenita decided to engage in buying and selling charcoal. In this way, she can help her husband earn a living for their family. In line with this, she would like to borrow at least PHP 5,000 that she will use as business capital. She said that by working hard and being patient, she will be able to sustain her business for it to become progressive.

Nenita is a resident of Barangay Manamtam of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Isidro and they were blessed with four children who are all in the elementary level. She hopes that they may send all their children to school and pay for their education through college.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Nuvia

texts.es: La Sra. Nuvia B. tiene 46 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian, ella se dedica a la compra venta de camarones, los compra en cedeño, ella tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el producto lo va a comprar en su carro y luego lo distribuye en diferentes localidades y comunidades de esta zona, (mercaditos y supermercados) tambien los vende por encargo a personas que se lo pidan, ella necesita el credito para comprar 500 libras de camarones, 200 libras de pescado blanco y 200 libras de pescado rojo.
texts.en:
Nuvia B. is 46 years old and is a single mother. She has 4 children all of whom are studying. She buys and sells prawns for a living. She buys them in Cedeño and has been working in this business for 14 years. Once she has purchased the products by truck, she then delivers them to various areas and communities within the region (markets and supermarkets). She also sells some to individuals that have put in orders. She needs the loan in order to buy 500 pounds of prawns, 200 pounds of white fish and 200 pounds of red fish.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy prawns and fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
“Family unity fights poverty,” says Elizabeth M. of Barangay Nagcuartelan in Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to the prevailing economic crisis that is happening globally, Elizabeth and her husband help each other to sustain their livelihood and provide the basic needs of their family, especially the education of their two children.

Her husband patiently maintains their rice and vegetable farming business while Elizabeth diligently works in her tailoring business. She makes dresses, curtains and uniforms. Her wish is to have a progressive business and that she can borrow PHP8, 000.00.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline J. manages a general store in the village of Dabubu Grande in San Agustin, Isabela. Their place is surrounded by hills and mountains. She is 37 years old, married to Danny, a farmer. They are able to manage their store despite life's challenges.

Aside from managing a store, Evangeline is engaged in retailing gasoline in front of their store for extra income. She now hopes for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP15,000 to improve her vending business and become successful someday. She will utilize the loan to buy more stock, especially the commodities that every family needs. Evangeline is hoping that her children will have a prosperous living someday through her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Daher

texts.en:
Daher is a 58-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Daher has owned a grocery store for ten years. Daher requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Daher has requested a loan.

Daher is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His customers are people from his village. When Daher first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his financial need. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Here is Nazgul, the leader of the group. Nazgul is the mother of three children. Her eldest son goes to college, whereas her two other sons go to kindergarten.

Even though her spouse is a farmer and in addition to that rents a warehouse, where he works as a salesman, Nazgul has a business of her own. She owns a pub and sells beer on tap. She showed her determination when she started her business nine years ago with only twelve and half dollars.

Nazgul used to work as a saleswoman in two shops. She saved some money and managed to buy back these shops. Eventually, she sold them to buy an empty building, and made it into a pub. Now she earns twenty five dollars monthly. During this time, she has been able to buy a new lodging – a two-room flat in the rural city of Tokmak – and has increased her turnover.

“I have a piece of land next to my pub, which is empty now. I am keen to build a big grocery store with a broad range of goods. This would help me attract more customers to my pub and increase my turnover! I am sure it would work if I got a loan,” exclaims Nazgul, as she points to the empty place.

Nazgul plans to bring her business to a high level while her sons are at school. Thus, she wants to ensure a secure future for her children. 

Nazgul’s partners are Jelmira, Kanchoro and Kuku.

Jelmira is thirty eight. She sells foodstuffs in a food store that she takes on lease. She needs a loan to purchase stationery before the school season. Her dream is to buy a house and move out from her flat.

Kanchoro is a widow and the mother of three children. At age of fifty two, she works as a security guard in Chui oblast’s tax inspection. She needs a loan to buy a new carpet.

Kuku is a widow as well. She has raised nine children. She sells women’s bags and needs a loan to buy a container. This would enable her to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, además Maria junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una congeladora.
Los sueños de Maria son tener otro restaurante y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Maria is 31, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Maria travels to different regional fairs to sell various articles of clothing. Also, Maria and her husband have a restaurant in a rented location. She works there every day. Maria needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy a freezer. Maria’s dreams are to have another restaurant and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.en:
Bakhtiniso has 9 years of experience as a seamstress. She first worked with her mother, which is how she learned her trade. Four years ago she started her own business, and with the help of some money her husband saved, she was able to buy the sewing machine she needed to open her business. Bakhtiniso specializes in national women’s dresses. Her workshop is in her home and she works Monday through Sunday from 8:00am until 7:00pm. She would like to take out a loan of 4000 Somoni to be able to purchase a new modern sewing machine for her business. Bakhtiniso is counting on your help and thanks all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shihihutag

texts.en: Shihihutag owns a computer and copier service business and runs it in a rented office in a busy trading center. He is 31-years-old and lives with his wife in an apartment in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 and his monthly earnings are between 600,000 and 700,000 tugrugs (~ $420 - $490 US). While he has been successful in his business so far, he has found it expensive to purchase necessary equipment and products in Ulaanbaatar. This is why Shihihutag has decided to import his supplies and equipment directly from China. He has received loans in the past from XacBank, the leading bank in Mongolia, and has always paid back his lenders on time. Shihihutag is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ $700 US) loan so that he can begin to import computer and copier equipment from China, in order to cut down on his overhead and increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To import computer and copier equipment

loans.name: 02.03.1.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mai H. Thị (16) is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the town of T. Hoá . Mai is the leader of a seven-member group loan sponsored by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.1.4 (02.03.1.4 Nam Ngạn).

Mai is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Mai sells rice products in the local community. Mai has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mai joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mai has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1963500 VND from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Mai's third loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


N. Thị Phương (18) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
T. Thị Nguyệt (19) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.
N. Thị Dậu (20) is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
Ngô T. Thuỷ (21) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.
P. Thị Kim (22) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.
N. Thị Thuỷ  (17) is a 48 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her livestock business.


About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.



Mai H. Thị (16) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoá . Mai là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.1.4 (02.03.1.4 Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Mai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Mai kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND. Vào 2008, Mai đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Mai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. N. Thị Phương (18) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2. T. Thị Nguyệt (19) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3. N. Thị Dậu (20) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4. Ngô T. Thuỷ (21) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


5. P. Thị Kim (22) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


6. N. Thị Thuỷ  (17) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Kev

texts.en: Kev H., age 29, is married with three children. One of her children is enrolled at a local primary school.  Mrs. H. lives with her husband and children in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. To make a living, she grows rice and raises chickens, earning an income of about $3 per day. The family is mainly supported by her husband who is a skillful fisherman. He is able to earn about $6 per day which is the primary source of income for his family and pays for the education of his three children. Mrs. H. and her husband wish to improve their standard of living by earning a better income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new fishing boat so her husband can more easily transport fishing traps to the lake.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 29 years old and married to Virginia Njambi. They have a five-year-old child.

David operates a barber shop in Naivasha. He has been in this business for the last three years and has a steady and loyal customer base. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a new shaving machine to replace the one he currently uses. In the future, he plans to buy a power saw so that he can open a workshop where he will render services using the power saw.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. You can obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fixing up his place

loans.name: Norma Yanira

texts.es: Norma Yanira R. D. P. D. 35 años D. edad, vive en Santiago Nonualco en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 16 y 14 años D. edad. Norma comercializa por las calles D. Santiago Nonualco semillas D. marañon, las cuales son preparadas por ella misma. Ya cuenta con 16 años D. tener dicho negocio, en el cual decidió iniciarse gracias a los consejos D. su hermana la cual se lo recomendó con el fin D. poder mejorar la economía familiar. Norma compra las semillas y las prepara D. manera artesanal y luego las coloca en una bolsa pequeña D. manera que pueda vender las medidas exactas, sus hijos colaboran con el proceso D. preparación D. semilla. Norma solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el capital necesario para poder incrementar la cantidad D. semilla cruda y así contar con más productos para su venta. Ella aprecia mucho su negocio ya que ha sido a través D. este como han podido brindarles estudios y ropa a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma Yanira R. D. P. is 35 years old, and lives in Santiago Nonualco in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband and their two children, who are 16 and 14 years old. Norma markets cashews, which she prepares herself, on the streets of Santiago Nonualco. She has been in this business for 16 years now, which she decided to initiate thanks to the advice of her sister who recommended it to her in order to improve her family economic situation.

Norma buys the cashews and prepares them in a handmaD. manner and then places them in a small bag so that she can sell them in exact measures. Her children contribute to the process of preparing the cashews. Norma is requesting a loan which she will use for the necessary capital in order to be able to increase the quantity of raw cashews and therefore count on more products to sell. She appreciates her business a lot since it has been through this that she has been able to give her children schooling and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw cashews

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Ahuehuete Group

texts.es:
La localidad de San Juan Ahuehuéyo está situada en el Municipio de Ayala (en el Estado de Morelos). Tiene 2255 habitantes. San Juan Ahuehuéyo está a 1160 metros de altitud.
Contiene una población indígena de 262, las lenguas indígenas NAHUATL Y MIXTECO, Su población es económicamente activa. El significado de ahuehuéyo viene del árbol que tiene por nombre en náhuatl “AHUEHUETE” Y asi es como se llama el grupo de quien vamos hablar.

Lo integran 4 personas,  sus nombres son: 	MARIA CONCEPCION G. G., MARINA DE JESUS S. S., GINA REBECA L. G., EMILIA H. C.. De esta ultima es de quien vamos hablar.

Se llama Emilia Hernández Carreño y no tiene ningún significado su nombre su edad es de 33 años, curso hasta el tercer año de secundaria la cual lleva por nombre LICENDIADO BENITO JUAREZ en  su misma localidad.

El crédito que ella solicita es para la compra de materia prima, como son: bultos de soya natural y compra de de bolsas de trigo por kilo, ya que ella se dedica a la elaboración de productos naturales como son: MILANEZA DE TRIGO, LONGANIZA DE SOYA, CHICHARRON DE SOYA, HAMBURGUESAS DE SOYA Y ALBONDIGAS DE SOYA y otros mas, ella mismo los elabora sin ningún químico todo es natural.

     Aun no cuenta con nombre propio su negocio, actualmente lleva 15 años dedicada a la elaboración  y venta de este producto natural. Ella aprendió junto con su esposo cuando estuvieron trabajando en un restaurante conocido al centro de cuautla, ahí aprendieron este oficio y producto., antes de empezar con la producción de alimentos de soya, se dedicaban a la venta de yogurt natural y  fruta, y  venta de granola  y que no les fue muy bien ya que no contaban con el capital para poder seguir su producción de lácteos, pero al aprender hacer los productos como la milanesa, longaniza. Etc. Ellos vieron que esto si les era redituable y que no se invertía mucho y obtenía mas ganancias

Su negocio esta en su propia casa, ahí es donde elaboran su producto, les es importante ya que no le agregan conservadores, todo lo que utilizan es natural. 

Ella tiene una gran satisfacción por lo que hace y que su esposo le ayude en el negocio, su clientela son sus vecinos su mejor promocion que tiene donde vive, también vende sus productos a los mercados de la zona, cuenta con dos compradores muy buenos ya que ellos le consumen por mayoreo y tiene el deseo de que alguien los conozca para que puedan exportar sus  productos a otros estado y se den a conocer.

Los desafíos que han presentado en su negocio son:  la alza de precios en el mercado con respecto a su materia prima que utiliza y mucho les afecta cuando hay periodo vacacional por que no venden igual.

Emilia es casada desde hace 18 años con el sr. Mariano Vázquez Acevedo tiene 4 hijos el primero lleva el nombre de: DOMINGO VAZQUEZ H. es el mayor de los hermanos cuenta actualmente con 17 años de edad y trabaja independiente, el segundo se llama EMILIO VAZQUEZ H., el estudia el primer año de secundaria junto con su hermano, MARIANO VAZQUEZ H. son cuates de nacimiento ambos van a la misma secundaria.

Y la pequeña que lleva por nombre GEMA VAZQUEZ H. cuenta con 7 años de edad y va en segundo de primaria.

     Emilia describe a su localidad donde hay mucha vegetación, campo, cultivos de maíz, cebolla, caña y fríjol,  al entrar a su comunidad podemos observar toda esta naturaleza.

Su casa es pequeña, cuenta con 3 cuartos, le falta repillar por que esta en rustico tanto paredes como suelo, pero cuenta con un pequeño jardín muy bonito y fresco. Ella quiere para un futuro darles la mejor educación a sus tres hijos pequeños y darle una mejor calidad de vida, estaba dudosa sobre el crédito que ya se le fue otorgado por que no creía que fuera cierto.

Quiere expresarles con sus propias palabras lo siguiente: "estoy muy agradecida con la institución FUNDACION REALIDAD, A.C. ya que sin su apoyo no podríamos lograr este pequeño avance en nuestro negocio y que es muy bueno que también apoyen a mujeres o madres solas por que ellas son las que mas luchan por mejorar su calidad de vida ya que no cuentan con alguien con quien luchar hombro a hombro."

Ella se integro al grupo por invitación de la sra. Marina de Jesús S. Sánchez actualmente ella es la representante del grupo y es quien le pone sal y limón al grupo.  Son muy unidas. Le sigue la sra. Gina rebeca López gatita, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces en su localidad, continuo con la sra. Maria concepción González garcía ella  vende antojitos mexicanos (Tortas) en la cooperativa de la escuela primaria cercana a su comunidad y para finalizar esta la sra. Emilia de quien hablamos, Ellas conforman el grupo Solidario (flat)  “ ahuehuete”.
texts.en:
San Juan Ahuehuéyo is located in the Ayala Municipality (in the state of Morelos). It has 2,255 inhabitants. San Juan Ahuehuéyo is at 1,160 meters in altitude. It has an indigenous population of 262. The indigenous languages are Nahuatl and Mixteco. The population is economically active. The meaning of “Ahuehuéyo” comes from tree and its name in Náhuatl is “Ahuehuete”. That is the name of the group that we will talk about. The four members are María Concepció González García, Marina de Jesús S. S., Gina Rebeca L. G., and Emilia Hernández Carreño. The last one is who we will discuss. Emilia Hernández Carreño’s name does not have any significance. She is 33, and she went to school until the third year of high school. The school’s name is Licendiado Benito Juarez, and it is in the same area. The loan she is requesting is to buy raw materials like bulk natural soy and bags of wheat by the kilo. She makes natural products like wheat milanesa, soy chicharron, soy hamburgers, soy meatballs, and others. She makes them herself without any chemicals. Everything is natural. Her business does not yet have its own name. She has been making and selling natural products for 15 years. She learned together with her husband when they were working in a well-known restaurant in the center of Cuautla. There they learned the job and the product. Before starting the production of soy food they sold natural yogurt, fruit, and granola. It did not go very well for them because they did not have the money to continue producing the dairy products. But, upon learning to make the products like milanesa and sausages, etc. they saw that this was profitable. They did not invest much, and they got more earnings. Her business is in her house, where she makes her product. It is important to them to not add preservatives; everything they use is natural. She has a great satisfaction from what she does and that her husband helps her in the business. Her customers are her neighbors, and they are the best promotion she has where she lives. She also sells her products in the area markets. She has two very good buyers who buy wholesale. She has the desire that someone will get to know them so that they can export their products to other states and they get to know the products. The challenge in her business is the rise in prices of the raw material she uses. This greatly affects her at vacation time because things don’t sell the same then. Emilia has been married to Mariano Vásquez Acevedo for 18 years. They have four children. The first is Domingo Vazquez H.. He is the oldest sibling, is 17, and he works independently. The second is Emilio Vazquez H.. He is in the first year of high school with his brother, Mariano Vazquez H.. They are twins, and go to the same high school. The little one is Gema Vazquez H.. She is 7, and she is in the second grade. Emilia describes her area as a place where there is lots of vegetation, fields, and corn, onion, sugar cane, and bean crops. Upon entering her community we can observe all of this nature. Her house is small; there are three rooms. They need to finish the walls and the floor, but it has a small garden, which is very pretty. In the future she wants to give her three small children a good education and a better quality of life. She was doubtful about the loan, and then it was granted. She did not believe it was true. She wants to use her own words to say the following, “I am very grateful to the Fundación Realidad A.C. institution because without their help we would not be able to make this small advance in our business. It is also very good that they support women and single mothers because they are the ones who fight more to improve their quality of life. They do not have anyone to join in this battle shoulder to shoulder.” She joined the group by the invitation of Marina de Jesús S. Sánchez. She is currently the group’s representative, and she is the one who puts pizzazz in the group. They are very united. She is followed by Gina Rebeca López Gatita. She sells sweets in her area. Then there is María Concepción González who sells Mexican snacks (sandwiches) in the primary school cooperative, which is close to her community. Finally, there is Emilia, who we have discussed. They form the “Ahuehuete” Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soy and wheat

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita A. is from the village of Bucana-Sicayab. She is 55 years old. Tita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Tita sells surplus clothing products in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,900 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Tita joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Tita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Assiongbonvi

texts.en: Assiongbonvi A. owns a books store where he sells a variety of books in Elmina.  Assiongbonvi has received senior high education. He is married and has four children. His wife is a hair dresser. Assiongbonvi has been selling books for some time now. He is responsible for paying school fees, bills and other family expenses. His loan will be used to buy Christian books in addition to the textbooks, novels, and literature books for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save to reinvest into his business to increase his capital.

loans.use: To buy Christian books in addition to textbooks, novels and literature books for sale.

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en:
Maroun is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bekaa. He has been working as a home and furniture painter for ten years. Maroun is known for his precise and clean work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to work independently. When he first started, he had difficulty networking and had some financial issues because he couldn’t afford to buy all the tools needed for his work. 

Maroun requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase some painting tools for his work. This is the first time that Maroun has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools for his work

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 39 años, siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a su familia, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Lourdes de 39 años y sus dos menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La siembra de papa, choclo y alverja es la actividad a la que se dedica. Todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para que sean más fértiles y productivas. Paralelamente a esta actividad su esposa se dedica a la crianza de vacas, las cuales le brindan leche para el consumo de su familia y para la venta. Ellos saben que tiene que trabajar en todo lo que puedan, ya que la educación de sus hijos les demanda muchos gastos.
Lo que más le gusta a Jaime de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos; lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos días espera cosechar sus productos y venderlos a buen precio en el mercado y así poco a poco reunir dinero para instalar una tienda de abarrotes en su barrio.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Jaime con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es un socio muy responsable y puntual. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas semillas de alverja y papa, también adquirirá abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Jaime is 39 years old. He has always worked very hard to get his family ahead. He lives in his own home with his wife Lourdes, 39, and his minor children, who are the reason for all his work. Potato, corn and pea crops are what he does for a living. Every morning he works his land so it will be more fertile and productive. While he does this activity, his wife raises cows. They provide milk for the family and to sell. They know that they have to work in everything they can, since their children's educations require a lot of expenses. What Jaime likes the most about his work is protecting his crops from the pests that can plague them. He has been doing this for 23 years and he considers that the hardest part is transporting the products to market of the city of Tarma, where he sells his crops. Within a few days he hopes to harvest his products and sell them at a good price at market and thus little by little get the money together to open a grocery store in his neighborhood. This is the ninth loan that Jaime has had with MFP. He knows that he has to make all of his payments on time if he doesn't want to cause his communal bank problems. With the two thousand nuevos soles he is asking for he will buy new pea and potato seed, and he will also acquire fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Kinta

texts.fr: Kinta Y. est âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6ans. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 7 ans et demi et a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permet de développer un petit commerce de viande de porc et d'huile de palme. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir mené depuis plus de 5ans, ce qui lui à procuré des revenus financiers lui permettant de construire un habitat pour sa famille et de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kinta Y. is 44 years old, she is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” for seven and a half years and has received 15 consecutive loans. Her new loan allows her to develop a small retail business of pork meat and palm oil. She has a lot of experience in this type of activity having managed it for over five years. This business has provided her with a financial income allowing her to build a home for her family and to take care of her children’s school fees

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and promote her retail activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks and snacks  to sell.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kea S. is 50 years old and is the village bank president selected by eighteen people, located in Kandoeng Thum village, in Kandal province. The members of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose. Mrs. Kea S. and her husband, Mr. Phall Nop, are farmers who own a pL. of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from being farmers, they also breed pigs at their home. Mrs. Kea S. now is requesting for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to support her farming crop. This couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the last one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and to support her farming crop.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
La señora Paola vive en anticretico, en la zona de alto tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en un snack de comida rápida ubicado en la zona de miraflores de lunes a viernes, los días sábados y domingos trabaja en una discoteca en el área de guardarropa para poder generar mayores ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una computadora y poder seguir estudiando.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Paola lives under the anticretico modality (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in the Alto Tacagua area of La Paz. She works in a fast-food eatery located in the Miraflores area from Monday through Friday. On weekends she works in the coat check of a discotheque to earn extra income. She is asking for funds to buy a computer so that she can continue with her studies. She is an Impro client and has repaid well in the past so she qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. sells locally-made spices, salted beef, groundnut (peanut) paste, onions, canned tomatoes, and so on, at Abura. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Efua uses her earnings to support her husband in looking after the family.

Efua will add the loan to her initial capital to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a bigger shop to sell from.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag C. is a 46- year- old single mother who lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Ganhuyag operates a clothing making and repair business in a rented basement and sells out of a stall at Narantuul, the biggest market in the city. She and her sister started the business in 1994 and since then, she has been gaining much experience in the business and the variety of products has been enlarged earning a good profit. Ganhuyag has found success in her operation and has used her earnings to support her family. Ganhuyag is an honest and hardworking woman who hopes to continue her success by growing her business and employing two tailors at the workplace in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase two sewing machines and more material for her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines

loans.name: Peena

texts.en:
Peena is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and six children in an area called Gandheyan Autad. She is a very caring and supportive lady. She manages the domestic chores and helps her husband with his livestock business. 
 
Her husband L. A. is 55 year old. For the past 45 years, L. has been selling the milk produced by his buffaloes from his home. 

Peena is seeking a loan of 60000 Pakistan rupees to buy more buffaloes so that her husband can increase the amount of buffalo milk he produces. There is high demand for his buffalo milk, especially from his neighbors, who enjoy the taste and quality of his product. This is the second loan for Peena.

loans.use: Purchase more buffaloes to increase the milk-selling business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 20 años, se dedica a remendar  y entallar chaquetas en su máquina de coser, siendo su única herramienta de trabajo, que la ha ayudado para satisfacer sus necesidades. Con el tiempo ha llegado a convertirse en una especialista en zurcidos para prendas deterioradas, ante esto sus clientes le tiene estimada y consideración por el buen trabajo que realiza. Ahora que incursiona en el mundo de la confección, aun le falta por aprender mucho, pero se siente satisfecha por la productividad de su negocio. Sin embargo durante los días que no tiene material en que trabajar, se dedica al reciclado junto a su esposo, de esa manera consiguen ingresos adicionales para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su mercado y renovar su maquina por otra multifuncional. Es su quinceavo crédito con  MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas como hasta hoy, puesto que este aporte le será muy favorable para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará telas polares, debido a la estación de invierno en la que tienen que soportar, así que la demanda de prendas de vestir a base de este material ha aumentado y espera confeccionar lo suficiente para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, lives in her own home with her husband and three children. For more than 20 years she has earned an income making alterations and repairs to jackets on her sewing machine, which is her only work tool. Over time she has come to specialize in sewing up rips and tears in clothes that are somewhat worn for which her customers recognize and appreciate the good work she does. Now she is experimenting in the world of dressmaking. She still has a lot to learn, but she feels satisfied at the productivity of her business. However on days when she does not have material with which to work she and her husband dedicate themselves to recycling activities and so are able to bring in additional income for the needs of their children. Her greatest wishes are to expand her market and to update her sewing machine with a multifunctional one. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she commits to making all her payments, as she has done, given that this support will be very helpful to her in increasing her working capital. With this loan she will buy polar fleece fabric. Because of the winter season which must be endured demand for clothing made from this material has gone up. She hopes to construct enough of this type of clothing to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polar fleece for making winter clothing

loans.name: Glenda Yadira

texts.es:
Glenda Yadira, A. C. tiene 21 años.  Es soltera y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Manuel y Wendy.

Glenda es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Glenda se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz gandul y arroz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en comercial Peña, en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, gandul y arroz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar una casa y un terreno. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como gusano, y otras enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Glenda Yadira A. C. is 21 years old. She is single and has two children, Manuel and Wendy. They live in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Glenda is a member of the Valle Alto rural bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de DIos an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are a total of 23 members, most of whom work in agriculture. This will be their second loan with the San Jose Cooperative. Glenda is a farmer and grows corn, pigeon peas, and rice. She makes her purchases every month at the Peña Store in Ventanas and sells her produce in the same shop. She will use the loan money to purchase seeds for her different crops. She thinks that this loan is a great opportunity to improve her life. Her dream is to purchase a house and a plot of land. Her business faces challenges primarily infestations and plant diseases such as worms. She likes to play sports and listen to music in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds (corn, peas, and rice)

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a homemaker who also works part-time selling blankets. She has a four-room house in a mid-sized city of Pakistan called Vehari. She has a 16-year-old daughter studying in eight grade, and who is keen to become a doctor. Bashiran is striving hard to fulfill her daughter's dream by trying to provide her quality education.  Her blankets selling business helps her to bear her daughter's education expenses. 

Her husband works as a supervisor in a private company for a reasonable income. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her business. With the loan amount, she plans to buy blankets in bulk and work full-time on this business. She is a very active and enthusiastic lady. She is confident that she will be able to expand her business and improve her financial condition by investing money in her business. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has found to be a responsible loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase blankets for reselling

loans.name: Scola

texts.en: Scola is a married lady who is blessed with a two-year-old child.  She operates "Scola Beauty Place".  She has been running the business for three years and has two employees.  She joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Funga Leso.  Since she joined the group, she has learnt how to keep track of her business progress.  She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kes to purchase hair chemicals, weaves, braids, cosmetics and a blow-dryer.  Scola is very ambitious and she sees herself running a big beauty parlour in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals, weaves, braids, cosmetics and a blow-dryer

loans.name: Felicia Lia

texts.es: La Sra. Felicia, vive en la zona de Alto  Obrajes es casada  tiene dos hijos es muy trabajadora ella realiza el preparado de empanadas y papas fritas,  a las cuatro de la madrugada ya que a las siete de la mañana reparte las empanadas y las papas fritas en los distintos colegios de la zona todos los días, los días sábados y domingos reparte a kioscos y tiendas de barrio , la Sra. Felicia destinara su préstamo para mejorar su ambiente de trabajo y aumentar un horno que le facilitara su trabajo diario, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Felicia livesin the Alto Obrajes area. She is married and has two children. She is very hardworking. Every day she prepares empanadas and french fries at four in the morning and at seven in the morning she delivers the empanadas and french fries to different schools in the area. On Saturdays and Sundays she delivers to kiosks and neighborhood stores. Felicia will use her loan to improve the ambience of her work and to enlarge an oven that will ease her daily work. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for the preparation of her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase didactic products for her day care centre.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan M. is a single mother caring for five children. Three of them are single and attend the local school. The other two are married and are employed in different jobs. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband. She is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to ensure her family lives a proper life. Mrs. Phan M. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it by receiving helps from her daughter, but now she can not plow in her farmland. 

In order to solve this problem, Nak Sina would like to borrow a loan to hire a tractor to plow her farmland so she can plant crops. Mrs. Phan M. was not available the day of the photo, so her daughter is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to plow her farmland so she can plant crops.

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Williams; El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica  ala compra y venta de autos, el ahorra su dinerito y luego aumenta lo que le falta y compra un carro para luego venderlo, de las ganancias de la venta del carro el viajar y trae otro auto y lo vende, ahora en particular el socio está solicitando el auto para poder llenar el tanque de combustible y traer de retorno un nuevo auto.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar combustible y traer un nuevo auto.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
32-year Sr. William is a member of the ‘Leaders’ Community Bank located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. He is married and has two children. His job is buying and selling cars. He has some money set aside, but he needs to have more to buy a car and then sell it. With the profit from the sale of the car, he will travel to find another one and then sell it. He is now seeking a loan so that he can buy a tank of gas, and then bring back a new car.

William is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to pay back the money according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy gas for his car-buying and selling business

loans.name: Chhorng

texts.en:
Chhorng T., 48, is a young woman and the mother of two children. To earn a living, she owns a small store where she sells food and soft drinks.  The store is in a good location to increase her income.

She has a life partner in her husband who is a building worker in the construction field. The family normally earns an average of $3.5 per day to help cover their daily living expenses. 

Chhorng T.’s house was broken because of the heavy rainy season, and part of the house was destroyed. To solve this problem, Chhorng T. is requesting a loan to repair a part of her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita L. is from the city of Macupa, Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Esterlita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Esterlita plants and harvests bananas for sale. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jawaher

texts.en:
Jawaher is a 47-year-old widow living in Nabatieh with her single child. Jawaher has worked as a tailor since 2006 and has 30 years of sewing experience. Jawaher is working hard for her living since her husband died; she believes that she has to work hard for her small family after the loss of her husband. She had to prove to relatives and friends that she’s strong enough to take care of her family. 

Jawaher is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy textiles she likes with a good wholesale price. The price is so very special that she can’t resist buying them. Jawaher is planning to expand her business more and more since she received her friends' and relatives' blessings and support.

loans.use: To buy special-price textiles

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in a business of selling mandaze, salt,soap and sugar. She is 29 Years old, married to a builder with three children and two of them go to school.  She wants to borrow a loan to stock more bags of sugar, salt and bars of soap. Betty hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock of more bags of sugar, salt and bars of soap to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
